loans.name: Bann

texts.en: Bann R., 44 years old, is married and the mother of three teenage children who are tailors. The family lives in the best tourism territoR. of Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. Bann R. currently works as an internal staff member for a company, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver (he appears in the photo). Bann R. will be using her first loan to allow her children to purchase more sewing machines for their tailoring service.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines for a tailoring service

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela tiene 26 años, vive con su esposa y con su hijo de 6 años, en la casa de se madre. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, siempre trata de buscar los mejores ejemplares y que estén en buenas condiciones, pues de eso dependen el valor. Todos los sábados comercializa sus animales en la feria ganadera de su zona y cuando le sobra algún animal lo tiene en su casa alimentándolo para que no pierda peso y venderlo la siguiente semana. El deseo a futuro de Guisela es tener un establo grande para criar más animales y venderlos a gran escala. 
Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, desde que ingresó a su banco comunal es una de las integrantes más activas de su grupo y se compromete a seguir con esa misma actitud positiva. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de más animales para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Guisela, 26, lives with her husband and six year old son in her mother’s house. She has been buying and selling animals for eight years. She always tries to look for the best examples that are in good condition because their value depends upon it. Every Saturday she sells her animals in the livestock fair in her area. When an animal is left over, she keeps it at her house. She feeds it so that it does not lose weight, and she sells it the following week. Her desire for the future is to have a large stable to raise more animals and sell them on a greater scale. This is her second loan with MFP. Since she joined the communal bank she has been one of the most active members in the group. She promises to keep up with the same positive attitude. The money she is asking for is to buy more animals to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more animals

loans.name: Alasseni

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alasseni Sanogo est marié à deux  femmes et  père de 4 enfants. Il est né le 17 Juin 1974 à Kaï  dans la commune rurale de Loulouni, préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative  de la république du Mali.  Il vit  avec ses  épouses et leurs enfants à Kaï.
Il est cultivateur depuis son jeune âge et a appris à faire le commerce depuis 5 ans. Expérimenté en raison des années d’exercices dans le commerce de céréales, il le mène aujourd’hui avec réussite. 
Il est à sa deuxième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt  passé s’est bien déroulé et il compte maintenir cette collaboration pour satisfaire ses nombreux clients dont les demandes ne cessent d’augmenter.  
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 2 tonnes de maïs et de mil. Elle s’approvisionne à Kaï et environnants mais aussi au marché de Loulouni le jour de foire.  Il vend  en gros et en détail, au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter le fonds de commerce. 
Il ambitionne être un grossiste et  avoir un camion de transport.
texts.en:
Mr Alasseni S. is married with two wives and the father of four children. He was born on June 17, 1974 in Kaï, located in the rural town of Loulouni, prefecture of Kadiolo, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He lives with his wives and their children in Kaï. He has been a farmer since a very young age and has learnt the trade business for five years. After all these years of experience he is now a successful trader of cereals.

This is his second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He has repaid his previous loan on schedule and wants to continue his cooperation with us to meet the ever rising demand of his customers.

Alasseni will use his loan to buy 2 tons of corn and millet. He gets his supplies in Kaï and in the nearby villages, but also at the market in Loulouni. He sells retail or in bulk, cash or credit, to a clientele made up of men and women. He expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000 CFA francs (US$180) which he will mostly reinvest in his business. His ambition is to become a wholesaler and own a truck for transportation.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase electrical equipment

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is from the village of Bocator Tangub City. She is 33 years old. Marilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn sells cloth ready to wear products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily expenses. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose tiene 19 años de edad.  Vive con su cónyuge que támbien es una persona joven. Tiene una hija de 1 año.  Ellos viven en la casa de su suegra.  Ellos se dedican al reciclaje.  Su cónyuge tiene un pequeño negocio de la crianza de cerdos.  Tiene 1 cerda madre y 3 cerdos pequeños que su madre le obsequió.  Esta actividad la vienen ejerciendo hace 1 año.  Jose tiene muchos objetivos, uno de ellos es incrementar la crianza de cerdos ya que es un negocio muy rentable.  Su suegra la apoya.  Es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito por recomendación de su suegra  que también es clienta de la Caja Rural.  Con el dinero que solicita desea dedicarse támbien a la venda de sandía como ambulante ya que anteriormente se dedicaron a esta actividad.
texts.en:
Jose is 19 years old and lives with his wife, who is also young. He has a 1 year old daughter. They live in his mother-in-law’s house, and work in recycling. His wife also has a small pig-raising business. She has one mother sow and three piglets that her mother gave her. They have been working in this business for one year.

Jose has many goals, one of which is to build the pig-raising business because it is very profitable. His mother-in-law supports this. This is the first time that they have applied for a loan on the recommendation of his mother-in-law, who is also a Caja Rural client. With this loan he wishes to begin selling watermelon as an ambulatory vendor because he used to earn his living with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in Recycling and Purchase of Fruit

loans.name: Lourdes Isabel

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Merced esta ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad  considerada cuna de deportistas y escritores, su principal actividad de economía es la agricultura, también han implementado microempresas de panadería, corte y confección entre otros, su  principal atractivo turístico es su arquitectura.

La señora Lourdes C. es socia de éste  banco comunal sus socias son muy carismáticas  logrando un ambiente familiar, ella vive  en la parroquia Santa Ana,  tiene 29 años de edad, está casada hace poco tiempo y tiene un hijo de tres años, su esposo trabaja como electricista y entre los dos han logrado edificar su casa propia.

 Lourdes trabaja en su negocio ubicado en su casa, tiene un local de venta de pollos asados en su comunidad, realiza esta actividad hace 3 años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos, su horario es de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. 

Este es  su sexto ciclo trabajando en su banco comunal, con los prestamos de la fundación   ha logrado  hacer crecer su negocio cada día un poco más,  el nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir  en la compra de ollas, cubiertos, manteles, mesas, sillas, etc. para incrementar su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus exigentes clientes.

Su meta es llegar a comprar un carro para su negocio.
texts.en:
The La Merced communal bank is in the city of Cuenca; a city considered to be the birthplace of athletes and writers. Its principal economic activity is farming although it also has established microbusinesses in bread-baking and dress-making, among others. It's main touristic attraction is its architecture. Lourdes C., 29, is a member of this communal bank whose members are very charismatic and have established a family-like atmosphere. She lives in Santa Ana parrish. She has been married for a short time and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband is an electrician and they have managed to build their own home together. Lourdes works selling roasted chickens from her home. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and she tells us that she has good days and bad days. She operates from 8am until 8pm. This is her sixth loan cycle with her communal bank. Loans from the foundation have allowed her business to grow a bit every day. The new funding will be used to buy pots, cutlery, tablecloths, tables, chairs, etc. to enlarge her business and provide better service to her customers. Her ultimate goal is to buy a car for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots, cutlery, tablecloths, tables, chairs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in central Ghana.

Mary works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes from a chop bar by the roadside. She buys the ingredients for her dishes from nearby communities.

Mary has been in business for over twenty years. She is requesting this loan so she can buy ingredients in bulk and so increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk for the dishes she sells.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Назарова Ситора проживает в городе Душанбе. Не замужем. Возраст 27 лет, имеет среднее образование. Ситора более 2 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где в основном торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sitora N. lives in the city of Dushanbe. She's 27 and unmarried with a middle school eduation. Sitora has been a vendor for more than two years. She has a shop at the market where she sells mainly clothing. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales.

loans.name: Sainoding

texts.en:
Sainoding R. lives in the village of San Roque, Barinaut Iligan City. He is 21 years old, single, and makes a living running a habal-habal (or motor vehicle transport) business to people in his community. Sainoding has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP from his work.

In 2010, Sainoding joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve his life and business. He has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP, his first from our organization, to buy materials he needs to improve his customer service.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to improve his ability to serve his customers

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Esperence's Group

texts.en:
Esperence is 41 years old and she is married. Esperence lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here, Esperence has owned a business of selling charcoal for about 5 years. The hours of her business are from 7 AM to 7 PM every day except Saturday.

Esperence is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. She wants to increase her business by adding more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. With this business expansion, Esperence hopes to earn more profits. Those profits will allow her to continue progressing in her business and keeping her business financially stable. Esperence is very thankful to any Kiva lender who will contribute to the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery F. has been a second-hand clothes seller in Abura for some time. Her education is junior high level. Mery is married and has two children. Her husband also sells second hand clothes. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of the house. Her loan will be used to buy more second-hand clothes for sale. She hopes to use the increased profits to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vivian Jepkogei

texts.en:
Vivian is a single mother of two lovely children. She is a farmer who plants maize both for her family consumption and for selling. She has been in her farming business for six years now and most of her customers come from where she lives. She also sells milk to one of the biggest milk distributers in Kenya called Kenya Cooperative Creameries (KCC).

Vivian was introduced to KADET through an existing group. She has applied for a loan which she is planning to use for farming like buying seeds for planting and manure and other fertilizer.

Vivian's goal is to continue with her farming business to a higher level, educate her children to higher learning institutions and most importantly to buy land in Eldoret and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 20 to 25 years old. Her two youngest children are still enrolled in school. Ruth is a farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been in business for more than 10 years. Her primary source of income is milk, maize and bean production, but she also sells clothes to earn extra money. She knows that challenges always exist, and currently her main one is marketing her products and dealing with competition.

Ruth has applied for a loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 60,000 to diversity her farm by raising poultry. She says that with this loan she will have a higher income, be better able to support her family and do a better job of coping with high prices. She hopes to expand her business in the future and acquire more poultry so that she can meet the high demand for this product in her area, especially during the festival seasons.

loans.use: To start a poultry-raising business

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia T., 45, makes sure sure that her family's daily needs are met by running her own variety store, which she has had for quite some time.

Celia has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues and uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by replenishing her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to replenish her inventory

loans.name: Raphan

texts.en: Raphan is a 40 year old father of three. He earns a living from dairy farming. He lives in the Kiambu area in a slum. He has been doing dairy farming since 2007 and has employed one person who milks his cows. Raphan is also employed as a casual laborer who does carpentry and construction. He has a membership with Ruturu farmers in Faulu Kenya. Through this group, his standard of living has changed because his business has improved since he has been taught new farming methods. He has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy animal feed and build a cow shed. He hopes to build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and build a cow shed.

loans.name: Nenita's Group

texts.en:
Nenita B. is from the village of Calaran Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Nenita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is chicos 3.

Nenita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling grocery products such as noodles, coffee, sugar,salt, canned goods,shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital for her business. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for resale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yèrèye Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Yèrèye sont mariées dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Konodimini, chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage, de mariage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers.  
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 7ème cycle de prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les six précédents.
Madame Habi Traoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 barriques d’huile d’arachide. 
Elle se ravitaille en huile à Bamako et  revend en détail à domicile et au marché du village à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Madame Habi Traoré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000FCFA en moyenne qui sera utilisé pour épargner afin d’avoir des petits équipements pour agriculture (charrues et charrette) et assurer les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The four women of the Yèrèye group are all married and live in monogamous families; they are on the average 40 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Konodimini, the main locality in a rural community in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They all know each other as neighbors or relatives and work as vendors of various goods. In order to expand their business capital, they have decided to collaborate with Soro Yirwaso and are now on their 7th solidarity [group] loan, having duly repaid the previous six. Mrs. Habi Traoré plans to use her share of the loan to purchase two barrels of peanut oil. She stocks up on oil in Bamako and sells it retail out of her home and at the village market to a customer base composed largely of women, for cash and sometimes on credit. Mrs. Habi Traoré plans to achieve an average monthly income of 35,000 West African Francs, which will be put away in savings in order to purchase some farming tools (plows and a cart) and help provide for the family needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing peanut oil [for resale]

loans.name: Daniel Agengo

texts.en:
Daniel has been working in quarrying for 22 years in the town of Naivasha. He is 42 years old, married to Irene Awuor amd they have four children.

Daniel was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to pay his casual workers who help extract stones from his quarry site. Daniel plans to buy a lorry which will make transporting stones from his site easier.  He currently hires transportation, which is expensive.

loans.use: To pay his casual workers

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea D. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Irenea is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Irenea owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Irenea has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irenea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Irenea is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Irenea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Jimuel

texts.en:
Jimuel D. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 32 years old. Jimuel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jimuel owns & operates a planting and harvesting rice business. Jimuel has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jimuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jimuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Jimuel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Jimuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man and the father of two young children. He is from Lebanon. He has more than 15 years of experience running a small car repair shop, where he repairs all type of cars. With his loan request of US $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to increase his business' capital. He is looking to diversify his business by purchasing spare car parts to build up his business. He hopes to open a new shop where he can buy and sell spare car parts. His business income is needed to help support his wife and two children, and to pay the considerable school fees.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: purchasing spare car parts

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan S., 38, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its quality palm products. Her husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

S. and her husband are farmers and are able to earn an income of USD 2 each per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family’s use.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María es vendedora D. comida, posee un puesto D. venta callejero, es divorciada pero ella sola se ocupa D. criar a tres hijos. Es una clienta conocida D. IMPRO, ya lleva cuatro créditos y solicita su primer crédito con KIVA. Solicita préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción para la refacción D. su vivienda, se acerca la época D. lluvias y ella quiere tomar precauciones. Ella es residente D. la zona D. Villa Yunguyo D. la ciudad D. El Alto.
texts.en:
María has a street stall from which she sells food. She is divorced and raises her three children by herself. She is a well-known client of IMPRO and has already had four loans with them, and is now asking for her first one with Kiva. María is seeking a loan to buy construction material to renovate her home. The rainy season is approaching and she wishes to be prepared for it. She lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Yunguyo in the town of El Alto

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: house repairs

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Kol Group

texts.en: This group loan has four members who live in Pongro village in Takeo province. Mrs. Srey Mom K., 24 years old, has been selected as group leader by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Srey Mom K. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also owns a general store in the local village. Her problem is that her field's soil is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Srey Mom K. is seeking  a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a widow with a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité Renacer volvio a formarse gracias ala gestión dela Señora Lorena B. y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Capiatá,  estas señoras tiene bien en claro sus metas  son  muy trabajadoras.
 Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el comité  anterior ya que dos de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente su comité.
La Presidenta Lorena B. trabaja en un Restaurant  en Asuncio.
Ella trabaja solo algunos días de la semana y esos días que no trabaja quiere dedicarse a la venta de comidas en su propio domicilio ya que tiene la posibilidad de preparar y de vender.
Tiene tres hijos todos entran en la escuela vive.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que ella utiliza para la elaboración de comestibles.
texts.en:
The Renacer (Rebirth) group was restarted thanks to the help of Mrs. Lorena B. and the support of another group that was working in the same place. This group is from Capiatá, and these women have very well-defined goals and are very hard-working. The group has overcome a very difficult struggle, as two of the members did not make their weekly payments. They canceled the loan and assumed the responsibility of restarting their group.

Lorena B., the group's president, works in a restaurant in Asuncio. She only works on week days and on the days she does not work in the restaurant, she works selling food from her home since she has the skill to prepare and sell. She has three children and they are all studying. She is asking for the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make the food.

loans.use: To buy ingredients, especially meat, to make food

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. is married and has five dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Adjoa operates a food joint at Abura. Her husband is a cleaner. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of utility bills. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to buy a piece of land.

The picture shows Adjoa cooking her food to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook for sale.

loans.name: Juana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Juana Méndez es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive en la ciudad de Azogues que es conocida por sus hoyadas, su iglesia catedral es muy conocida por estar en la alto de toda la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y muchos han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo y así brindar un mejor futuro a su familia.

Nuestra socia tiene 61 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijo, 6 de ellos son  casados y viven   independientes, su ultima hija vive en su casa, estudia en el colegio y sufre de la enfermedad de artritis infantil por lo que está en tratamiento, su esposo es chofer profesional y realiza fletes a distintas partes de la ciudad, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Juana es comerciante hace 40 años, vende variedad de ropa para todo tipo de clientes, cuenta con un puesto propio y labora de martes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Este es el quinto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería para surtir  su local ya que esta es su meta.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Méndez is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres de la Bahía" (Women of the Bay).  She lives in the city of Azogues, which is known for its hollows and for the cathedral church that sits at the highest point of the entire city.  The people there make their livings in commerce and raising animals.  Many have left to find better work and to be able to offer their families a better future.

Our member is 61 years old, is married and has 7 children.  Six of her children are married and live on their own.  Her youngest daughter lives at home, is in high school and suffers from juvenile arthritis, for which she is in treatment.  Her husband is a professional driver and offers charters to different parts of the city.  With the income the two have compiled, they have been able to build their own home.

Doña Juana has been a shopkeeper for more than 40 years.  She sells a variety of clothing for all types of customers.  She has her own shop and works from Tuesday to Saturday from 8:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the evening.

This is her fifteenth loan with the communal bank.  She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to stock her shop, since that is her goal.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Las Naranjas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  "Las Naranjas" y se integra D. seis señoras cada una con diferente actividad, le dieron como nombre "Las Naranjas"  ya que cuando se realizó L. firma D. contrato era  tiempo D. cosecha D. naranjas y mandarinas.
     
 L. señora quien se le entrevisto es nueva integrante y se llama Hilda R. López, es madre soltera con un pequeño D. siete años D. nombre Herbin Mauricio él está estudiando el segundo año D. primaria.
    
 ElL. solicitó el préstamo para  surtir su mini tienda D. abarrotes, ya que le hacían falta algunas cosas que no podía comprar por falta D. ingresos, hoy espera que con este apoyo logre surtirlo y salga adelante.
     
Lo que L. motivó a realizar ésta actividad fue su pequeño hijo, pues elL. necesitaba un negocio para darle lo mejor y deseaba también estar al pendiente D. él, y lo única forma D. hacerlo era tener su propio negocio. 
     
Con las ganancias que ha logrado obtener lo invierte comprando lo más necesario para su negocio, así el negocio se ve más surtido y su clienteL. le compre con gusto.
      
Lo más importante para elL. es que su negocio crezca para poder ahorrar y sacar adelante a su hijo dándole una buena educación y sea una persona con futuro.
     
 Formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le hizo su vecina doña Vitalina, a integrarse al grupo y así tenga un dinero D. donD. pueda disponer y surtir su negocio
      
   Las personas que integran el grupo son:

Rosalinda Hernández López: invierte el préstamo en L. compra D. ropas para luego venderlo en las comunidades cercanas D. su localidad.
María Vitalina Sánchez D. L. C.: invertirá el préstamo en L. compra D. productos por catalogo  y venderlo en L. comunidad.
Silvina A. R.: invertirá en L. compra D. hoja D. guineo y venderlo en L. misma comunidad y también en L. ciudad D. TuxtL. Gutiérrez.
Teresa Juárez Vázquez: comprara ropas en L. mesilL.  y luego venderlo en L.  misma región.
CarmeL. González Mejía: invertirá el crédito en L. compra D. útiles escolares, para surtir su papelería.
Hilda R. López: invertirá el préstamo en L. compra D. mercancía para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group, called "Las Naranjas" [The Oranges] is maD. up of six women, each with a different type of work. They chose the name "Las Naranjas"  because they signed the contract to form as a group during the orange harvest. 
     
The group member profiled here is a new member named Hilda R. López. She is a single mother with a seven-year-old son named Herbin Mauricio, who is currently in second graD..
    
Hilda is asking for a loan to stock her small grocery store, as there are a few items that she needs to restock but cannot buy at the moment due to a lack of capital. She hopes that this loan will allow her to restock the store and move forward with this venture. 
     
Her motivation in opening the store was her young son. She needed a job that would let her proviD. for him as best she could, but also one that would let her stay near him and take care of him. The only way to do both was to start this small business. 
     
She has been investing her earnings in buying more items to sell at her store, so that she can offer a wider variety of goods and keep her customers satisfied. Her main goal is to see her business grow so that she can begin saving money to help her son get ahead, by giving him a good education and a bright future.
      
Hilda became part of the "Las Naranjas" group through an invitation from her neighbor Vitalina, who encouraged her to join in order to be able to get the funds to fully stock her store.
      
The members of the "Las Naranjas" group are:

Rosalinda Hernández López: She will use her loan to buy clothing, which she sells in nearby communities.
María Vitalina Sánchez D. L. C.: She will use her loan to buy catalog products to sell locally.
Silvina A. R.: She will use her loan to buy banana leaves to sell in her community and in TuxtL. Gutiérrez.
Teresa Juárez Vázquez: She will use her loan to buy clothes in L. MesilL. and sell them in nearby areas. 
CarmeL. González Mejía: She will use her loan to buy school supplies, to stock her paper goods store.
Hilda R. López: She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth E. is a 30-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a furniture making business. She lives in Purok Kapayapaan, Barangay Luzviminda, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her furniture making business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $450. Lilibeth is now borrowing 20,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 24th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lilibeth hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Andrew Muya

texts.en:
Andrew has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 3 years. He is 28 years old, married to Beatrice Njeri and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He hopes to use the loan amount to rent a piece of land and plant potatoes.

In future, Andrew hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land and plant potatoes.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Manuela is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has a 22-year-old child. Her husband is a carpenter. Manuela owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells milk, soft drinks, and other products. Manuela also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to her community. Manuela wishes to be debt-free someday.

Manuela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house

loans.name: Ntamu

texts.en:
Ntamu is a married woman with four children, two of whom had graduated while two are still attending school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a retail shop business for the past three years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Ntamu faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demands. During rainy season, the demand for her products is lower compared to hot summer season where the demand is higher. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000  Kshs, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour and cereals for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to run her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour and cereals for resale

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor Guadalalupe P. Rodríguez es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, hace 9 años opto por poner un negocio en su vivienda para tener un ingreso extra a la familia. Por las mañanas su esposa es quien atiende la tienda, por que Guadalupe trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una maquiladora. El negocio tiene como nombre “Miscelánea P.” donde ofrece en todo producto de abarrotes y refrescos, al que desea invertir para tener mayor variedad.
texts.en: Mr. Guadalalupe P. Rodríguez is a responsable and hard worker.  Nine years ago he decided to start his own business out of his home, to provide extra income for his family.  In the mornings, his wife helps out with sales, since Guadalupe works as a security guard in a factory. His business is called “Miscelánea P.” where he sells a variety of food items and soft drinks.  He seeks a loan to invest in increased inventory to vary the products he sells.

loans.use: increased inventory and product variety

loans.name: Jilma Del Socorro

texts.es: Jilma Del Socorro tiene 30 años, se dedica  a la venta y compra de cerdos. Hace más de 7 años tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.  Para poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida. Poco a poco fue ahorrando para comprar cerdos, ya que en su comarca este negocio es muy rentable, además que ella deposita mucho empeño en su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, pues tiene que pagar para que una persona traslade los cerdos a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jilma Del Socorro is 30 years old and has two dependent children. She has been buying and selling pigs for more than seven years so that her family can get ahead and improve their standard of living. Jilma has been gradually saving in order to buy pigs since this type of business is very profitable in her region. She also says that she invests a great amount of effort into her business.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy pigs. She will also pay someone to transport the pigs to her home.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire pigs & pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera cuenta con casa propia de material noble en donde vive con sus hijos mayores, cuenta con una tienda comercial con la cual tiene mas de 3 años de experiencia en dicho rubro ella tiene metas de ampliar su negocio Norma desea invertir el dinero para la compra de mercaderia como abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas, frugos, frutas verduras entre otros ya que tambien desea invertir en la campaña escolar, su sueño es tener un negocio mas grande como un MiniMarket y diversificar su productos ya que tiene amplia clientela es muy conocida en la zona donde vive.
texts.en: Norma is 58 years old and is a single mother. She has her own home where she lives with her older children. She has a commercial store where she has more than three years of experience in that sector. She has aspirations to increase the size of her store. Norma would like to invest the money for the purchase of merchandise such as groceries, soft drinks, juices, Frugos (a brand of canned vegetables), and vegetables, among others. She would also like to invest in school supplies. Her dream is to have a bigger store, such as a MiniMarket and diversify her products since she already has a wide clientele base and is very well known where she lives.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as groceries, drinks, canned vegetables, fruits, vegetables, notebooks, and school supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 48-year-old married woman with three children. Her children's ages are 13, 12 and 10.

Evelyn is engaged in farming. She helps her husband, who is a farmer, plant and harvest rice crops. Evelyn's husband mainly manages the farm. She also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells around their neighborhood. Evelyn does her best to help provide for the family.

Evelyn's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes for her familiy's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza V. 38, is married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Langcataon in the municipality of Pangantucan, a part of Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Analiza runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she buys and sells biscuits, breads, snacks and candies to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan, her seventh from HSPFI, of 13,000 PHP which she used to purchase additional inventory and gain some working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snacks and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional snacks and canned goods

loans.name: Lady Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Lady S. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y muchos lugares para visitar, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva los paladares de quienes la visitan, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Lady tiene 42 años, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 16 años de edad y estudian en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Lady labora en su negocio hace 4 años, ella da el servicio de viandas (almuerzos), trabaja de lunes a viernes solo el medio día. Hace 2 meses ha iniciado con el negocio de un Spa, prestando su servicio por las tardes.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de maquinas para su Spa.

Su meta es agrandar mucho mas sus negocios.
texts.en:
Lady Salazer is a member of the communal bank “Maria Reina de la Paz” (Mary Queen of Peace) and lives in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, great architectural beauty, and many places to visit.  It has a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of those who visit and the people maintain their culture and traditions.  

Lady is 42-years-old, she is divorced and has two children of 17 and 16 years of age who study in school.  She does not have her own house as she lives as a renter. 

Lady has worked in her business for four years.  She gives food service (lunches) and works from Monday to Friday only until midday.  Two months ago she began with the business of a spa helping in the afternoons.

Our member is on her second loan that she has made in the communal bank she was invited into by a friend.  The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of machines for her spa.

Her goal is to make her businesses much larger.

loans.use: to buy machines for a spa.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 48, married, and has five children. 

She earns a living by raising livestock like cows, pigs, and water buffalo in the Philippines. Leonida is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise. 

Leonida has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a bakery. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Felix Genaro

texts.es: El sr. Félix con domicilio ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi, tiene la actividad de transportista afiliado a una empresa de taxis, solicito su crédito para el mantenimiento general del vehículo donde también una parte del dinero lo invertirá apoyando a su esposa la señora Lucy que comercializa deportivos en la zona da la Garita por las mañanas. El Sr Félix también realiza viajes extras con su móvil los días de restricción (días Jueves) este día el no puede entrar al centro de la ciudad ya que su vehículo se encuentra con restricción .Los viajes son a diferentes lugares, los cuales son contratos espontáneos por recomendaciones de otros clientes que el ya los conocen por el buen servicio que brinda, es una persona amble y trabajadora que esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Félix lives in the Pampahasi zone.  He is a public transportation provider affiliated with a taxi company.  He asked for his loan to provide general servicing to his vehicle.  Part of the money will be used to help his wife, Lucy, who sells sportswear in the La Garita zone in the morning.  Félix also does extra trips with his vehicle on restricted days (Thursdays).  On that day his car cannot enter the center of the city because his vehicle is restricted.  The trips are to different places.  They take place due to spontaneous contracts from recommendations from other customers that know him for the good service he provides.  He’s a kind, hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 42 years old and is married to Beatrice.  They are blessed with three school-going children. 

He got to know about KADET LTD through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru town. This will be his fourth loan. He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  Peter plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings, pay for labor, and buy two bulls.   

In the future, Peter hopes to increase his farm production by practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, pesticides and seedlings, pay for labor, and buy two bulls

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Esperanza has a shop that sells snacks, biscuits & breads. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods & bread. Esperanza has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Esperanza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods & bread.

loans.name: Nereyda

texts.es: Nereyda de 27 años de edad es casada,  trabaja como Farmaceutica de la casa de la mujer  desde hace 3 años, donde ha demostrado ser responsable y cumplida con sus compromisos, su esposo tiene un taxi propio de donde obtienen ingresos familiares que permiten solventar los gastos del hoga. Esta solicitando su 8vo crèdito para terminar de costruir una habitaciòn brindando de esta manera la comodidad que se merece a su familia, su mayor sueño es tener  mas privacidad en el hogar y seguir estudiando y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Nereyda is 27 years old and married.  She has been working as a pharmacist at a women's shelter for three years.  She has shown herself to be responsible and punctual in meeting her obligations.  Her husband owns his own taxi with which he makes family income that allows them to cover their household expenses.

Nereyda is requesting her eighth loan to finish building a room which will allow her to provide the comfort that her family deserves.  Her biggest dreams are to have privacy in her home, to continue studying and for her children not to want for anything.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sandra Del Carmen tiene su familia que está compuesta por su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, trabaja desde hace 5 años por lo que ha sido una gran experiencia al conocer a sus clientes y saber lo que ellos le solicitan. Tienen su local en su vivienda en donde transitan una gran cantidad de clientes y por el carisma y la buena atención la conocen bien.  Con su nuevo préstamo comprara pantalones, camisas, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, lápiz labial, polvos, toallas y sabanas. Esta muy agradecida por los préstamos que les han dado, gracias a ello pueden continuar con el negocio.
texts.en: Sandra Del Carmen has her family which is composed of her husband and three minor children still in her care.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She’s been working for the last five years and it’s been a great experience to get to know her customers and to know what they request.  Her sales are in her home and a good number of customers come through thanks to her charisma and the good attention they know they’ll get from her.  She will use the new loan to buy pants, shirts, perfumes, creams, treatments, lipsticks, powders, towels and sheets.  She is very grateful for the loans she’s gotten; thanks to them she’s been able to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy pans, shirts, perfume, creams, treatments, lipstick, powder, towels and sheets.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is farmer with an income of $1.60 per day. She is a single mother with one son; he is a goldsmith with $4 of income per day. Every month, she has to spend $35 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy equipment for her son to decorate gold well. She did not want to do anything besides farming but she wants to enlarge her son's career to get a good shop and have enough equipment for his work.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her son to decorate gold.

loans.name: Bedan

texts.en:
Bedan, 60 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last ten years. He normally plants carrots and potatoes and sells them at the local market.  

Bedan was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. For this loan, his third, he has borrowed KES 25,000, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana es cliente antigua, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras al por mayor, las verduras D. temporada que traen desD. la zona D. rio abajo, ella tiene por allá parcelas D. sembradíos, por lo que cada época D. siembra manda insumos como semillas abonos fungicidas, etc., en el momento D. la visita ella se encontraba con la venta D. achojchas, espinacas, carotes, berenjenas, repollos, zapallo en su puesto del mercado campesino en la zona D. San Pedro. Con el dinero del credito comprara semillas y abono, la Sra. Juana tiene el esposo que se dedica a la jardinería, ella tiene hijos ya independientes, y bajo su cuidado esta su nieta D. 12 años, es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana is a long-standing client of our institution who sells vegetables wholesale.  She transports seasonal vegetables from Río Abajo where she has plots of farmland.  Every sowing season she orders supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, fungicides etc.  When we visited her, we found Juana selling 'achojchas' (a native vegetable, similar to a cucumber), spinach, carrots, eggplants, cabbages and pumpkins from her stall in the rural market in San Pedro.

Juana will use her loan money to buy seeds and fertilizers.  Her husband is a gardener and her children live independently.  She has a 12-year-old granddaughter in her care.  Juana is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталия – частный предприниматель из Ивано-Франковска, Западная Украина. Она не замужем, сама воспитывает 5-летнего сына. Наталия работает на центральном рынке, занимаясь розничной торговлей спортивной одеждой, шапками, штанами, а также тапочками и бельем. Она предлагает большой ассортимент спортивной одежды по низким ценам. Сначала Наталия работала продавцом на рынке, а потом решила начать свое дело. В сфере торговли она работает уже 3 года. Ее валовый доход составляет 15 000 гривен в месяц. Чистая прибыль – 5 000 гривен. 

Наталии необходим кредит в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить ассортимент тапочек – 100 штук, 50 штук шапок и 70 пар штанов. Будучи матерью-одиночкой, Наталия старается сделать все возможное, чтобы обеспечить своему сынишке достойную жизнь. Она очень хочет скопить какие-то сбережения и дать сыну высшее образование в свое время. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Natalya is a small business owner from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine.  She is not married and is raising a five-year-old son by herself.  Natalya is involved in retail sales of athletic clothing, hats, pants and also slippers and undergarments.  She offers a wide assortment of athletic clothing at affordable prices.  At first, Natalya worked as a salesperson at the market and then decided to start her own business.  She has been working in the retail field for three years.  Her gross income is 15,000 hryvnia per month, and net profit is 5,000 hryvnia.  Natalya needs a loan in the sum of 7,000 hryvnia in order to buy a new assortment of merchandise: 100 slippers, 50 hats and 70 pairs of pants.  Being a single mother, Natalya tries to do everything possible to provide her son with a decent life.  She wants to save some money and provide her son with a higher education in due time.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of merchandise: 100 slippers, 50 hats and 70 pairs of pants

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es soltera, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la venta de telas de lona de diferentes colores y calidades, inició este negocio por la necesidad que tenia de mejorar su condición de vida y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo para la compra de mas telas para la venta lo que es lona de diferentes colores y comercializar mas de este producto. En el futuro espera ver su negocio el mas grande del lugar donde vive.
texts.en:
Micaela, 56, is single.  She has four children.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She sells canvas in various colors and textures.  She started the business because she needed to improve her living conditions and to date has 15 years’ experience.

She decides to request a loan to increase her working capital to buy more canvas in various colors in order to sell more of this product.  In the future she hopes her business will be the largest in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of five children.

Anaam is a tailor in a factory for men’s clothing. In 2005 she decided to also work in her house after her main work time, making, repairing, or altering  suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than five years experience in this field. She understands local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the area.

She is requesting a $2,600 loan in order to purchase a new tailoring machine and an electric power generator and to repair the walls of her workplace. 

She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine and an electric power generator and to repair the walls of her workplace.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Erma has a construction shop that sells hollow blocks. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw materials for making hollow blocks and sand.

Erma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making hollow blocks and sand.

loans.name: Paulina Gliceria

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está separada y tiene tres hijos, dos independientes, con estudios D. educación primaria incompleto.
	
Trabaja desD. hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artesanía en bordados, teje llicllas, chalinas,  también venD. quinua lavada y habas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo  D. S/. 700.00 nuevo dinero que invertirá en la compra D. un rollo D.  bayetas, lanas, un quintal D. quinua y habas molidas, estos productos los venD. en la ciudad D. Tacna.

La señora desea traer casacas D. la Paz para vender en Tacna y así generar otros ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Aymaras Juli II”  Communal Bank in the Juli district, Chucuito province, in the Puno department. She is 53, separated, and has three children, two of whom are independent. She did not finish elementary school.

Paulina has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her business selling crafts and embroidery. She weaves llicllas [an intricately woven, colourful cloth that covers the back and shoulders; can be used as a shawl or as a sling for carrying children or items] and scarves, and also sells quinoa and beans.

She is requesting a new loan of 700 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of a roll of cloth, wool, a quintal of quinoa, and beans. She sells these products in the city of Tacna.

Paulina wants to buy jackets in La Paz to sell in Tacna and make more income.

What she most likes about her Communal Bank are the talks about business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of: a roll of cloth, wool, a quintal of quinoa, and beans

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. Adelaida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Mbwana

texts.en:
Mbwana is 42, married, and has six children. Five of his children attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past three years, Mbwana has operated a palm wine business, selling at wholesale to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business.  He dreams of expanding his business and hiring employees in the future.

With a loan of KES 10,000, Mbwana wants to start a vegetable stall business by purchasing bundles of vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Magamed

texts.en:
Magamed is a farmer from the village of Nakhiduri, East Georgia. He is 53 years old, married,and lives with his family in the village: his wife, Melukhsa, his 30-year-old son, and a daughter-in-law. The main source of the income for the family is potato growing. They grow potatoes on family-owned 0.5 hectares of land. Magamed sells harvested potatoes in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Magamed requested credit for purchasing potato seeds. High quality seeds will be the prerequisite of good income in spring. Also Magamed hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable for potato growing this winter and he gets a good harvest, which will be sold for an appropriate price and the family will get more than planned in income. Magamed will use received profit for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de antojitos, está viviendo con sus dos hijos y su padre, también tiene a cargo tres sobrinas porque su hermana la madre de las jóvenes falleció hace 4 meses. El negocio de ella es la venta de atoles, tamales, tostadas de plátano, empanadas, esta venta la realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de plátanos, azúcar y harina, para hacer la venta, este préstamo le ayudara para que su negocio cuente con lo necesario.
La aspiración de María es que su negocio sea prospero, para poder ayudar a toda la familia y cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María sells antojitos (snacks). She is living with her two sons and her father and she is also taking care of her three nieces because their mother, her sister, died four months ago. Her business involves the sale of atoles (a thick, syrupy drink made of corn), tamales, roasted bananas and empanadas. She sells from her home and as a street vendor.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bananas, sugar and flour so she can make her sales. This loan will help her stock her business with all that is necessary. María’s goal is for her business to be prosperous so that she can help the entire family and cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Asoson Asin Osur

texts.en: Asin is 28 years old, married, and has a two year old son. He describes himself as a welcoming and principled man. He has been running three pharmacy retail stores for the last three years. He sells syringes, tablets and surgical products. He has two employees. His primary customers are local residents. His business faces a challenge of insufficient funds for maintaining supplies. He will use the loan Kes 20,000 to buy tablets and surgical products. In the future, Asin hopes and dreams to run several retail stores.

loans.use: To buy tablets and surgical products.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 52-year-old widow from Kagadi, Uganda who owns a restaurant in the same town. She started this business with 250,000 shillings but now her business is worth 3,000,000 shillings. With this business, she has been able to educate her 10 children and buy land. Inadequate capital is hindering her dream of expanding her restaurant. She also dreams of building a permanent house and starting up a wholesale business. Patricia wants a loan to buy soft drinks and food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and food for the restaurant

loans.name: Elcedita

texts.en: Elcedita lives together with her husband parents and children. She has been engaged in agriculture for already 12 years. Now Elcedita would like to develop her farm. With the help of the loan amounting P 30,000 she will purchase seeds, as well as fertilizer.  The children are growing, so are their needs. Elcedita wants to insure her family is fed and her children are educated. Development of agriculture will help Elcedita to implement these purposes.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Musa A

texts.en: Musa A is a maize farmer from Katselle village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa A would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa A can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Musa A, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 53 years old, married with four children and lives in Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental. Analiza owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting banana, coconut and corn to sell. She has been in this business for several years . In 2011, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Recently Analiza is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and additional seedlings for replanting. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedling.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Ms Grace W. is a single mother of 4. She runs a hotel business, and also sells clothing and household fabrics to supplement her income and help her meet the education needs of her children. The $450 loan will enable her to increase the stock of bed sheets, bed covers, etc. which she sells to customers who come from as far away as the neighboring country of Uganda. She anticipates a good profit margin from this cross-border trade in clothing and fabrics. Her vision is to open a large warehouse shop in the near future so that she can buy things in bulk for sale.

loans.use: Purchase Stock of Household Fabrics for Sale

loans.name: Guldaran

texts.en: Guldaran is a mother of three children. She is 57-years old and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She has in business for two years and wishes to expand the dairy farming and increase her income. With her first loan of $600, she bought a pregnant cow. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milch cow

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 60 years old, a widow, and whose children are all married and live in far away communities, but because of this, they do not have the means to aide her economically and so she opened a store within her home, where she sells fresh products to her neighbbors. Eloisa belongs to the group CIRCONIA 4. With the loan, she wishes to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to stock her business, as it is her only means she has to make a living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ELOISA TIENE 60 AÑOS , ES VIUDA , SUS HIJOS ACTUALMENTE ESTAN TODOS CASADOS Y VIVEN EN COMUNIDADES LEJANAS , POR LO TANTO NO LE PRESTAN EL APOYO ECONOMICO PARA SUBSISTIR DEBIDO A ESO ELLA INSTALO UNA TIENDA EN SU CASA , DONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA LA GENTE DE SU VECINDAD . ELOISA PERTENECE AL GRUPO CIRCONIA 4 . CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE INVERTIR EN MAS MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO YA QUE ESE ES SU UNICO MEDIO QUE TIENE PARA VIVIR.

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Del Rosario, 39, is married with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer and she currently works at home selling fruits and vegetables from a small shop where she sells her products to people in the surrounding neighborhood. With the loan, she hopes to plant and harvest her own vegetables. She belongs to the Lourdes 3 group with Mercedes Zuniga Val (clothes sales) and Reyna Fonseca Rodriguez (fruit and vegetable sales). They hope to use the loan to invest, dona Mercedes in a larger inventory of clothes for sale from her house, but also to go out to sell in nearby neighborhoods, and dona Reyna hopes to set up a small shop for selling fruit at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA DEL ROSARIO, tiene 39 años, casada, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y ella vende frutas y verduras en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño local donde vende sus productos a las personas que viven a los alrededores, con el préstamo espera sembrar y cosechar sus propias verduras . Pertenece al grupo Lourdes 3 junto con: MERCEDES ZUÑIGA VAL (vende ropa) y REYNA FONSECA RODRIGUEZ (vende frutas y erduras) .Ellas esperan con el préstamo invertir doña Mercedes en mayor cantidad de ropa para tener en su casa y además salir a vender a las comunidades cercanas y doña Reyna espera instalar un pequeño localcito de venta de las frutas en su casa.

loans.use: Fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid, 26 years old, owns a small travel agency in Tarik Jdideh, in Beirut. He worked for several years in a ticketing company but received very small wages. 3 years ago, he decided he wanted to be on his own and opened the travel agency. 
This is the first time Hamid requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Like the majority of micro-entrepreneurs who contact us, he heard about Al Majmoua through word of mouth from other borrowers.
Hamid needs a USD 1,000 loan to purchase a new computer for his business.

loans.use: Buy a new computer for his small travel agency.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia Y. is a married mother of four: three girls and one boy. Two of her daughters are married and have their own families. Earlier Zakia used to stitch on order but now does not because her son is grown up and her family wants her to rest now. Her husband is a taxi driver and her son is a jeweler. He started and established this business with the loans they took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Now he wishes to produce a large variety of jewelry for which he requires a loan.

loans.use: produce large variety of jewelry

loans.name: Tulambe

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Tulambe K.. Earlier this year she established a business raising and selling chickens to supplement her monthly salary of $70 from the Tanzanian Prisons Service where she is employed. Tulambe is requesting a loan of $275, with which she plans to purchase additional chicks. The business helps Tulambe to support her two children, Theresia, 17, and Eva, 12.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Jam Som Group

texts.fr:
Jam Son is a group from the eco village of Mbam who is involved in market gardening. The choice of this activity was made by the screaming lack of vegetables in the region while the population and the hotel industry are forced to obtain vegetables outside of the region. This creates speculation on the prices and causes high costs of living for our households, comprised mostly of poor people. This is how the group Jam Som, in the framework of their struggle against poverty and the improvement of living conditions of the population, is soliciting a loan to bring forth this project.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.
