Jam Som est un groupement de l'éco village de Mbam qui s'active sur des ativités de maraîchage. Le choix de cette activité est dû au manque criard de légume dans la zonne alors que les populations et les structure hôtelier sont obligées de se procurer des légumes en dehors de la zone ce qui cré une spéculation sur les prix et provoque la chéereté de la vie dans nos ménages composés de pauvres. C'est ainsi que le groupement Jam Som , dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté et aussi l'améllioration des cadres de vie de populartions sollicite un prêt afin de mettre a jour ce projet.

loans.use:
Market gardening -

Maraîchage

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim C. L., 27, is the mother of one child and a vendor of grocery products in front of her house. She typically makes an average of $3.60 a day. Her husband, Mr. Yet Pet, 46, is a motor- taxi driver who earns about $3 a day of profit.  This couple plans to use the loan of $500 to purchase a vegetable stand at the market, which has a large  number of potential customers.

loans.use: To purchase a stand in the market to sell a variety of grocery products.

loans.name: Javlon

texts.en:
S. Javlon is 23 years old and he is married. He lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan and is in the livestock business. He also works with a building team, doing finishing and repair work on apartments, but his general family income comes from the family business of raising and selling livestock. His wife has a dairy business.

Mr. S. Javlon has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 8 months to buy a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To buy a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is the 32-year-old single mother of two children. She is dedicated to offering her cosmetological services to the public from her own home, thanks to the welcome and the experience she has obtained throughout many years. She would like to continue to be the preferred cosmetologist of her neighbors and clients and has is thinking of enrolling in the center in order to learn new haircutting and coloring techniques, besides implementing a workspace to improve her service.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita de 32 años es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, se dedica a prestar sus servicios de cosmetóloga al público en general desde su propio domicilio, gracias a la acogida y experiencia que ha ido obteniendo durante largos años. Desea seguir siendo la cosmetóloga preferida de sus vecinos y clientes y tiene en mente capacitarse en un centro para aprender las nuevas técnicas de cortes y peinados, demás de implementar su espacio de trabajo para mejorar su servicio.

loans.use: Development of workspace

loans.name: Rommy

texts.es:
Rommy Lopez has a small general store which she runs from her home in the city of Chinandega, in the municipality of Cinco Pinos. From the time she began her business six years ago, she has been able to improve her economic situation as her husband's salary was not enough to cover the household costs.

Today, she continues to grow the business thanks to the support of Ceprodel, whose loans have enabled her to buy more merchandise to sell. With the new loan, she is confident that she will continue to grow her business.

La dama Rommy L. posee su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido por ella misma en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio de Cinco Pinos. Desde que lo inició hace seis años atrás ha logrado mejorar su situación económica debido a que se incorporó a este negocio por el hecho de que el ingreso de su esposo no cubría con los gastos del hogar.

Hoy en día ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual al haberle brindado créditos los ha utilizado para la compra de los productos de a pulpería. Hoy en día una vez más solicita créditos para la obtención de su mercadería. Por esto es que ella permanece confiada esperando que se le otorgue el crédito para así continuar con su negocio en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR THE SMALL GENERAL STORE SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME.

loans.name: Deam

texts.en: Deam Y., 46, grows crops and makes thatched roofing out of palm leaves. Through the sale of her goods, she earns approximately $1.67 per day. Her husband, Mr. Pong Chin, is a motorcycle-taxi driver, earning around $3.33 per day. They have three children, two of whom are married. The family lives in Momeanh Village, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Y. seeks a loan of $100 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one that her husband currently uses. The loan will allow her husband to improve his motorcycle-taxi business, and thereby increase the family income. (The photo is Y.’s husband)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one that her husband currently uses

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 43 years old, is married and the father of two children.  The family lives in the southern suburbs of Beirut, Lebanon, where Hassan is a hair designer for men. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to improve his shop in order to better accomodate his clients.  Hassan will then attract more customers and expand his business, which is the only source of revenue for his family. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Decoration improvement to the barber shop

loans.name: Angela Sardiz

texts.es:
Angela is 30, has four children that are in elementary and high school, she lives with her husband Amner. He travels to different towns and villages to buy wood, then sends it to Angela to sell for the best offer. They have been doing this activity for the last three years. What she likes the most about her business is that she meets people that know about the business and she learns how to manage it and what to do. She doesn't work on this every day, but when product arrives, she works all day with no breaks. Angela works to help with the daily expenses and her children’s education, who she hopes to see become professionals in the future. The reason why she is requesting a loan is to rent a location where to store the wood and sell it easier.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Ángela, de 30 años, tiene 4 hijos que cursan estudios primarios y secundarios, vive con su esposo Amner. Él realiza varios viajes por diferentes caseríos para comprar madera y luego la envía a Ángela para que la venda al mejor postor. Realizan esta actividad desde hace 3 años. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a personas que saben de este negocio y le enseñan como es el manejo y qué se debe hacer. Su actividad no es diaria, pero cuando tiene su producto trabaja todo el día sin descanso. Ángela trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos, a quienes desea verlos profesionales más adelante. El motivo de su solicitud, es para alquilar un local donde almacene su madera y poder llevarla a vender con mayor facilidad.

loans.use: Rent a location to store wood.

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Erick habita en la II etapa del barrio de Hialeah, tiene 27 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, ya que tiene que cuidar a sus dos pequeños hijos. Don Erick trabaja como conductor de las rutas urbanas  de las cooperativas de esta ciudad de la Capital de Managua, el cual se levanta temprano ya que comienza a dar la primera vuelta en las primera horas de la mañana, y son cinco vuelta las que realiza por días,  ya son diez años los que tiene de andar en las rutas pues le ha permitido hacer su pequeña casa así como subsistir. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para terminar de construir una habitación, para eso necesita comprar materiales como arena, cemento, piedra. A largo plazo es  tener su propia ruta de transporte para trabajarla y tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Erick, 27, lives in the Hialeah barrio in Managua. His wife is a stay-home mother, who cares for their two small children. Erick works as a bus driver for the cooperatives in Managua. He gets up very early each day, because the first trip begins in the early hours of the morning, and makes five trips throughout the day. He has been at this job for ten years, and has been able to build their small home and make a living. The loan he is requesting will be used to finish an additional room in his home; he needs sand, cement, and stone. His long-term goal is to own a bus, work his own routes and have a better income to provide for his children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the construction of a room

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 38 years old, divorced, and has three children, all of whom are in school.  As a dealer of hardware tools and goods, such as paint, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, and pipes, Rose purchases supplies in bulk at wholesale prices in Accra and resells them at retail price in her area.  She hopes to increase her profits and income so that she can expand her shop to also include the sale of cement.  Therefore, Rose has joined the Swoni Se Trust Group, which allows its members to support each other, and has requested a loan of $875, which she will use to purchase greater quantities of hardware goods at low prices for resale.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of hardware goods at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Torng

texts.en:
A resident of Sleng Koung Village in Takeo Province, Mrs. Torng M. is a 49-year-old farmer who owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Yet, presented on the right in the photo, is a construction worker. She is the mother of four children, one a garment factory worker, another a rice trader, another a construction worker and the fourth a student at the local school.

Even though the family members have various livelihoods, they do not have enough money for adequate living conditions. Therefore, with the hope of improving their income, Torng is requesting a loan to buy rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Veysal

texts.en:
Veysal M. is a hard-working person who tries to provide the best for his 3 beloved children. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it. He carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals.

Over the past 6 years, Veysal has gained experience in the purchase and sale of sheep, and his business has brought stability to his family. He would now like to purchase more sheep so he can better support his large family. He is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Veysal thanks you very much.

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. lives in Siem Reap Province, where the Angkor Wat Temple located. He is a motorcycle taxi driver, providing rides to passengers who want to travel around his community. Since 2006, her has earned approximately $3 a day. He is married to Cham Rat, who is 24 years old, and they have two children. His wife makes a living by making traditional baskets to sell at a local market, and earns around $2 a day. To develop his business, S. has applied for a loan to buy a trailer to connect to his motorcycle. The trailer will help S. earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to connect to his motorcycle

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 48 años de edad, vive con 3 de sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, quienes le apoyan en todo, sobre todo en sus propósitos para su negocio. Desde muy joven sus aspiraciones han estado en el arte textil, es por eso que María es una excelente costurera, cuenta con máquinas de coser, que le son de mucha utilidad para la realización de su trabajo diario que es la confección de ropa para todos los gustos, implementado su pequeño taller en su casa, donde también vende sus prendas, las que deja al contado o al crédito. María es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo, incluso trabaja con varias instituciones educativas para la confección de los uniformes para los docentes y para los estudiantes. Esta actividad de la costura la viene realizando desde hace 20 años. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un local adecuado para su taller textil y donde podrá también exhibir sus prendas.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and lives with 3 of her 4 children and her husband who support her in all she does, especially in her business. Since she was very young, she aspired to work in textile arts, which is why Maria is an excellent seamstress. She has sewing machines which help her immensely in her daily work which consists of making all types of clothing. She works out of a small shop in her home where she manufactures and sells her goods, which she sell on account or on credit. She is sought after for her high quality work, including being sought out by educational institutions to make uniforms for both teachers and students. She has worked in this business for 20 years. This is her 7th loan from Prisma Microfinance and she will use the money to build a more suitable shop for her textile business where she will also be able to exhibit her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buildling a store for her workshop

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim K. is 54 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She grows and sells rice from her rice field and earns around US$ 1.50 per day. Her husband owns a plot of land and grows and sells cucumbers to the market. He makes less than one dollar every day. This couple has four children, two of whom are married and two who work as farmers.

Kim K. currently has a new idea to make additional income to help support her family. She is requesting a loan to start raising pigs and purchase more land to expand her cultivation.

loans.use: To raise pigs and purchase land

loans.name: Saima Abdul Latif Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is 28 years old and a married lady and citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Saima baji is an uneducated lady; she couldn’t study because her parents had few financial resources. She is married to a man whose name is A. L. and he has an animal-selling business. He buys animals from the animal market and sells to the butcher shops and earns a profit. He has been in this business for the past 10 years.

Saima baji is the mother of one son whose name is Chand and he is in kindergarten. Saima baji is a highly determined lady. She wants to see her son at the peak of success and for this purpose she prepares embroidered dresses and sells them to clothing shops and earns a profit. She saves her income to be able to admit her son to a good school. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy goats for her husband's animal-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business. Abida Jabeen wants a loan to buy bakery items (bread and butter) to sell. Farzana Maqbool baji wants a loan to buy cold drinks for her drink corner. Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es: la Sra. Olga F. se dedica a la venta de pescado frito y tambien hace sopas de pescado, su fuerte es el pescado frito pero tambien hace cocteles de curiles, camarones, sopas marineras, ella tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual es muy buena porque a la gente le encanta comer pescado frito y como ahorita se aproxima la Semana Santa ella desea comprar muchos mariscos ya que los clientes son muchos y no se va a dar abasto con el producto que tiene, quiere estar preparada para esta epoca que es dentro de semana y media.
texts.en:
Olga F. sells fried fish and also makes fish soups. Her specialty is fried fish, but she also makes clam cocktail, shrimp and seafood soups. She has worked in this business for many years, and this has gone very well very well because people love to eat fried fish. With the Holy Week coming up, she wants to buy a lot of seafood because there will be a lot of customers and she does not yet have a sufficient supply. She wants to be prepared for this occasion, which is in a week and a half.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish, oil, butter, salt, vegetables, cabbage, onions, vinegar, spices, tortillas, soft drinks

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
ALLOTOWANOU Martine est née vers 1953. Martine est originaire de la Vallée dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Martine est mariée et mère de six enfants; elle vit à Cotonou avec son mari. Mais aucun des enfants n'est encore à sa charge. Martine vend des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho, riz, etc) qu'elle va chercher dans les villages environnants et qu'elle livre aux semi- grossistes à crédit. Martine vend aussi de l'huile de noix de palme et de tomates fraîches. Pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle Martine a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a aujourd'hui. C'est pourquoi Martine demande de prêt à ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Martine ALLOTOWANOU was born circa 1953. She comes from La Vallée, in the Ouémé Department in Southern Benin. She's married and the mother of six children, and lives in Cotonou with her husband. However, she does not have to support her children anymore. Martine sells cereals (corn, millet, sorghum, rice, etc) that she gets in the surrounding villages, and that she delivers, on credit, to semi-wholesalers. She also sells palm nut oil and fresh tomatoes. To better meet customer demand, she needs more important financial means than what she has today. This is why she is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of tomatoes, sacks of bean and sacks of corn

loans.name: Tobi

texts.en: Tobi is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She sells weavons and hair extensions. She is also a hair stylist. Tobi requests a loan of N60,000 to purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, se conformó en fecha 17 de enero del 2009,gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas, la Sra. Daniela R. D., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, contactó con la asesora ,para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 480.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de frutas y verduras, venta de carne, venta de tortas de miel, etc.
El grupo Renacer es un excelente grupo, que trabaja en forma solidaria, todas las integrantes asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para el bien común del grupo.
texts.en:
The Renacer (Rebirth) Women's Committee was formed on January 17,2009, thanks to the current Director of Finance, Señora Daniela R. D., who is engaged in producing and selling meals. She contacted the Adviser in order to find out about the process used by the Emprendedoras (Enterprising) Women's Committee. With that advice, she managed to bring together 16 women who are now working harmoniously in their second cycle as a solidarity group within the program. The average loan taken out by each participant is 480,000 Guaranís, which will be used for different activities such as: selling meals, or notions, or supplies for the pantry (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba tea, etc.), selling fruits and vegetables, or meat, or selling Torta de Miel (honey cake), etc. The Renacer Group is an excellent group who are working together. All of the members attend the weekly meetings and take part in activities for the common good of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise or supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Al Wouroud Group

texts.en:
A. Wouroud is a group of four women who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon.

Wahida is a 37-year-old married woman with two children. She has owned livestock for seven years and is involved in milk production. Wahida is successful in her work because of her experience. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she learned it when she was young. Wahida decided on setting up her business because there is a demand for it in her region. Her clients are locA. people. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock and milk production. This is the first time that Wahida has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock.

Zeinab is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been working in agriculture for five years and she owns livestock. Zeinab is successful in her work because she enjoys it. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Zeinab requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Zeinab has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

Ayda is a 19-year-old woman. She has been working in agriculture for four years and she owns livestock. Ayda is successful in her work because she is experienced. Her clients are people from her region. Ayda decided on doing her business because she likes animals and because she learned the business when she was a teenager. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Ayda has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Mounira is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. She has been working in agriculture for 15 years and she owns livestock. Mounira is successful in her work because of the experience she has gained since she started learning this business when she was young. Her clients are people from her region. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Mounira has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

About group loans In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To increase her livestock

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale sells tubers of yam. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla E. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Perla is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Perla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a loan amounting to 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Perla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena vive con sus 2 hijas de edad escolar, ya que es divorciada, ella se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas desde hace 2 años surte como proveedor a una tienda.
Su proyecto es para invertir en la compra de mas material para la fabricación de mas piñatas, y así su venta se incrementara, por tal motivo esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Magdalena is divorced and lives with her 2 school-aged daughters. She has been making piñatas for 2 years and supplies them to a retail store. Her requested loan will be used to purchase materials needed to make more piñatas and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Marvic

texts.en:
Marvic M. is from the village of Artadi, Mambajao Camiguin. He is thirty years old and separated from his spouse. They have three school-age children. To make a living, Marvic owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector, running a handicraft business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Marvic has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marvic joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Marvic is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of his children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Jay-Rone

texts.en:
Jay-rone B. is already 23 years old. He is still single and doing his best to help his parents to support their family needs.

Jay-rone operates a tricycle transport business in his village. According to him, he wants to change the old sprocket of his tricycle that he uses in his business because he wants to maintain his motor vehicle to improve it and to increase his daily income.

Jay-rone is requesting PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase the needed spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport. He hopes and prays that he will obtain the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle transport

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: La asociación “15  de diciembre” esta formada por doce mujeres, se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Tejada, con el apoyo de su asesor de créditos demuestran ser un grupo alegre y responsable.  Las actividades de este grupo son distintas, por ejemplo Micaela vende Cosméticos por catalogo, Guadalupe vende dulces y otras golosinas, Narcisa y Zulema se dedican a la elaboración y venta  de comida, Elena confecciona polleras, Eva costura ropa.  Ellas precisan de capital para comprar productos o materia  prima, es decir compraran; variedad de cosméticos, dulces, galletas,  arroz, telas, broches y otros. Con esta adquisición lograran que sus ganancias sean mayores y también los ingresos para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS O MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is sixty two years old, divorced, and the mother of seven children. Three of her children are currently in school while the other four older children work. To support them, Grace has been trading food for six years now. She always tries to maximize profit through Just In Time delivery (JIT). She trades wheat and spices such as maize and pepper in bulk. She buys these crops directly from farmers at a relatively low price. She sells them at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. She also brings some of her goods to nearby markets to sell. She says she wants to use the loan to buy the goods in bulk so that she can distribute to a greater number of customers. She believes this will prevent her from frequent traveling and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more food like maize and pepper in bulk.

loans.name: Udiedi 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Elena lives in Santo Domingo, the crowded capital of the Dominican Republic, where traffic jams and intense heat are more reliable than electricity and running water. She is the group coordinator of her group "Udiedi" and is wanting to take out her second loan through Esperanza International.

Elena will be using this loan to buy a pack of tennis shoes to sell to her customers. Selling tennis shoes results in a larger profit than selling clothing, but requires more initial capital to buy them, so she is very thankful for this loan. She is thankful to Esperanza for having low and manageable repayments which has allowed her to reinvest more money into her business. She looks forward to taking out more loans in the future to help her business grow and to support her house and family financially. Thank you for your help!

loans.use: Shoes

loans.name: Nol

texts.en: Nol M., age 56, is a widow who lives in Takeo Province with her four children. She works as a farmer and is typically able to make US $3.00 each day. She is aided by her three children who are garment factory workers. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, made worse because food prices have also been high. Nol M. is asking for US $600 to raise cows.

loans.use: To buy cows to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Lotufou

texts.en:
Age:                            35
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      3   (ages 3 - 16)
Business:                    planting & harvesting taro and bananas
Loan purpose:             to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise
Weekly profit:              WST $450  (US $188)

Overall Social Metric Score*:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

Lotufou works in her father 's business, planting & harvesting taro and bananas.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Lotufou needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Lotufou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lotufou's 1st loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from secondary/high-school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a 60-year-old married mother of six children, some of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Araba works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a baker who bakes bread and supplies to retailers. Araba buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a LAPO client. "Lift Above poverty organization" (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Doris is 35 years old and married with four children. Her eldest child is 12 years old. Doris is a Bini by tribe. Her husband sells planks to support the home.

Doris owns a stall where she sells groceries like cornflakes, noodles, soap, milk, biscuits, and drinks. She hopes to own a classic supermarket in the future. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es: María Consuelo P. P. de 42 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San salvador. Vive  junto a sus padres y tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales depende por completo de María. Ella posee una venta de productos varios como gel para el cabello, pasta dental, pegamento, papel higiénico, entre otros productos más. Su venta está ubicada frente al mercado de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Este lugar es muy estratégico, ya que siempre está muy lleno de una gran cantidad de personas. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de productos varios, sobre todo pastas dentales, ya que son estas las que más se venden en el lugar. María es una señora muy responsable quien trabaja mucho para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos y ayudarle a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María Consuelo P. P. is 42 years old and lives in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her parents and her three children, all minors and dependent solely on her. She owns a stand where she sells a variety of products, such as hair gel, toothpaste, glue and toilet paper, among others. The stand is located in front of the Santa Tecla market, in the Department of La Libertad. It is very well located as the market is always full of people. María has asked for a loan to buy a greater quantity of products, in particular toothpaste, since these are the top selling items at her stand. María is very dependable, she works hard to be able to provide for her children and to help her parents with expenses at home.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic need items for sale.

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are small-scale local entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. These women have come to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to expand their businesses, make better sales, and consequently improve their standard of living.
Isatu M., second from left, is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old, married to a professional worker, and has four children. For 15 years now, Isatu has been selling cooked food. With her share of the loan, she will buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, fish and meat, in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as rice, fish and meat

loans.name: Blessed Family Group

texts.en:
Blessed Family is a group made up of five borrowers led by Amos S.. He is 33 years old, married and has two children, one an infant and the other a six year old who is in the second grade. Amos also takes care of his sister. He was not able to go to university due to lack of funds. 

Amos and his family live in the Cotton Tree Community in Harbel, capital of Margibi County in central Liberia. He makes a living selling dry goods, buying them wholesale and selling them retail in his town. He has been in business for five years, and hopes to expand his operations in the future. 

When he went into business, Amos was worth 3,000 Liberian dollars but by working hard has increased that to 16,000. The main problem he faces is transporting goods from his supplier to his shop.  He has few if any problems selling them once they arrive, because he is known for having reasonable prices. He has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell, including body cream and slippers to wear in the shower.

Amos dreams of having enough money to give his children a good education. In the photo, he is the person holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, and has 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts a special emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more body cream and shower slippers.

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna C. is from the village of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is 43 years old, married and has 8 Adult and School-aged children. To make a living, Flordeluna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the other source of income of the family comes from the income of her husband being a Carpenter. Flordeluna has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeluna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Flordeluna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Flordeluna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Mr. Kha Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of seventeen people, is located in Prey Rumdeng village in Takeo province and each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Kha K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which he cultivates rice to earn a living.

In this farming, Kha K. faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to plow his rice field. So she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. With the rest of the loan, he would buy recycling goods to re-sell for an income. His wife, Mrs. Keo Hon, buys recycling goods and resells them for a good price to support the family.

Mr. Kha K. has four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the other looks after a cow.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow his field

loans.name: Atuel's Group

texts.en:
Zacarias A. is from the village of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Zacarias is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Zacarias is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a food stall, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and makes approximately $230 a month from this activity.

In 2004, Zacarias joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 12th loan from PMPC. Zacarias plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: A. Véronique est née en 1975 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à ZANNOU Thimonté, un revendeur, Véronique est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Véronique vit ensemble avec sa petite famille au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de treize ans que Véronique habite dans ce quartier. Véronique partage avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Véronique n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Véronique vend divers produits alimentaires (biscuits, bombons, lait, etc.) de façon ambulante, mais aussi à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Véronique vend des chaussures. Véronique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Mais Véronique achète ses chaussures à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Véronique est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Véronique désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et renforcer surtout son activité de vente de chaussures. C'est la raison pour laquelle Véronique sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
A. Véronique was born in 1975 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County. Married to ZANNOU Thimonté, a retailer, she is the mother of five children who are all in school. She lives together with her small family in the Avotrou district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For almost thirteen years, she has been living in this district. She and her husband share in covering the various family expenses. Véronique never attended school. To meet her needs and to provide for her family, she sells a variety of food items (cookies, candy, milk, etc.) from place to place but also out of her home. As a side business, she sells footwear. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She buys her shoes in Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already had three loans, which have all been repaid. She would like to increase her stock of goods and to bolster her business in particular for selling shoes. For these reasons, Véronique is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of cookies, candy, and shoes

loans.name: Holganat

texts.en:
Holganat S., 50, lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (the Mongolian traditional nomadic tent).

Holganat operates a clothing and consumer goods trading business. She sells a variety of clothing and consumer goods from a rented counter at the Tirlik market including thread, scarves, needles, and buttons. She pays 10,000 MNT per month in rent.

Holganat has been operating her business since 2000, and she has gained valuable experience over the past ten years. Every two to three months she purchases about 2,000,000 MNT worth of inventory to resell. With her business profits, she has purchased a car.

Holganat has been planning to expand her business and selection of goods in the future. She operates her business at an outdoor counter that is very cold in the winter and very hot in the summer. However, she is a very hardworking person trying hard to provide a better life for her family. She says, “I would like to create my own shop and be able to afford to pay the education fees of my children.”

Holganat is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase clothing and other goods in Taikeshken, a Chinese border town.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Afiavi Jeanne

texts.fr: A. Afiavi Jeanne est née le 30 Mai 1975 et est mariée à VONDJESSE, un commerçant. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis cinq ans environs à Hêdomé, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Jeanne assure avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Jeanne n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Jeanne mène comme activité principale, la vente de divers articles de mercerie dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Jeanne exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Jeanne n'a pas rencontré de difficulté dans le remboursement de son crédit. Jeanne sollicite un deuxième prêt, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire.
texts.en:
Afiavi Jeanne A. was born on May 30, 1975 and is married to Jesse Vond, a businessman. The couple have five children who have all attended school. For the past five years the family has lived in the community of Aborney Calavi. Together, Jeanne and her husband meet the family expenses. Jeanne has never attended school. To meet her many responsibilities, Jeanne's main business activity is selling various sewing items from a shop located in her home. Jeanne buys her supplies at the Dantokpa international market in Benin and at Lome in Togo. Jeanne started this business eight years ago. She has made one previous loan with ALIDe and had no difficulty repaying this loan. Jeanne is requesting a second loan to increase both the size of her business and her operating capital.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of thread, 10 carton of buttons, etc

loans.name: Merci Plus Group

texts.en:
Elodie V. is the leader of a Community bank named “Merci Plus”, which is composed of 24 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Elodie, 28 and married, runs a cellphone booth. She has been in business since 2001, selling eggs with a beginning capital of $70. With hard work and good management, she has been capable of diversifying her business by adding prepaid cellphone cards and wigs to resell in order to increase her working capital. She makes a profit of about $10 per day. Elodie’s ambition is to become a prepaid cellphone cards and wigs provider in her area. As she wants to develop her business, she decided to join one of Hope’s groups in June 2009. She is planning, with the next loan, to purchase dozens of prepaid cards and wigs. Elodie, with good strategies, has succeeded in building up permanent customers. She always talks to her customers, she knows them well by their names, and she never runs out of stock. Elodie has a six year old son who attends school.

loans.use: For purchasing dozens of prepaid cards and wigs to resell in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina P. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Rosalina is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling banana products, while her husband manages their transportation services as the driver in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Sadikjon

texts.ru: Джаханов Садыкджон житель района А. Джоми. Ему 51 год. Он является женатым мужчиной и любящим отцом 4 детей. Имеет средне - специальное образование, шофер. По профессии проработал 7 лет. Сейчас он занимается торговлей на рынке. Продает приправы, семена бобовых и зернобобовых культур. В этой области уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Клиент хочет расширить свой бизнес и на полученную прибыль женить детей.
texts.en:
Sadikjon J. is a resident of the A. Jomi region. He is 51 years old. He is a married man and a loving father of four children. He has specialized secondary education, a driver. He has worked in this profession for seven years. At this time he sells on the market. He sells spices and different kinds of seeds and cereals. He has been in this field for four years. He is taking out the loan to increase sales. He wants to expand his business and use the profit to wed his children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia, de 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos mayores, por el cual lo apoyan económicamente. Vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa (selva central peruana), donde tiene su propia casa. Hace muchos años atrás trabaja en la actividad agrícola, pero no se sentía cómodo con la labor que hacía, ya que a ella siempre le gusto tener su propia tienda, desde luego que lo consiguió con el pasar de los años y con algunos ahorros que tuvo durante su antiguo trabajo. Hoy tiene muchos clientes, lo cual hace que sus ventas son muy satisfactorias, debido al buen servicio que les brinda. Desde entonces la venta de golosinas, galletas y gaseosas ha mejorado con respecto al año anterior, debido a que procura siempre mantener su tienda bien surtida de productos. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su propio barrio, desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y sus planes a futuro es ampliar su negocio, introduciendo nuevos productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, para que así en un tiempo corto se transforme en un bazar. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además está satisfecho con su banco comunal, debido al buen desempeño de cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería, de esa manera pueda abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 53 years old, married and lives with her two oldest sons who help support her financially. She lives in the Santa Rosa area (the central Peruvian jungle), where she has her own home. Years ago she worked in agriculture, but she did not feel comfortable doing the work and she always liked having her own store. Over time, and with the money she had saved from her previous work, she was able to establish it. She now has many customers, and her sales are very satisfactory, given the good service that she provides. Since then her sale of sweets, cookies, and soft drinks has improved over the previous year, because she always tries to keep her store well stocked. Her point of sale is in her own neighborhood, and she works from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm. Her future plans are to expand her business by introducing new primary need products for the home, so that she can convert the store into a bazaar in a short time. This will be her 14th loan through MFP, and she is committed to making all of her payments. She is very happy with her communal bank because of the good performance from each of her fellow members. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise so that she can supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is 24 years old and married 30-year-old A. A. about two years ago. She moved to Kot Radha Kishen after her marriage, a small city in Pakistan located in Punjab province and famous for its dairy products. She lives in a small village near a city called Gandhian Outad in a three-room brick house with her family. She doesn’t have any children as she just got married two years ago. 

Her husband is an educated person. He continued his education up to 10th standard and started to work in the wheat fields to support the family financially. In the morning he works in the wheat fields and in the evening he sells milk from his buffalo.  He has been involved in a milk-selling business for the last 10 years. 

Mehwish is a housewife. In the absence of her husband she takes care of the buffalo and gives her water and food on time. Her husband wants to buy another buffalo for his business so he can sell milk to more people and generate good income. Mehwish has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy a buffalo for her husband’s business. She is hopeful that by purchasing another buffalo, her husband will be able to get the desired positive results from his business. She is a regular client of Asasah and is on her 2nd loan.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Delia Lourdes

texts.es:
Delia vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto en la zona Alto lima.  Delia es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de papa y chuño, está es su principal fuente de ingresos. 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de mercadería. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Delia lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto. Delia is a merchant, and she sells potatoes and “chuño” (freeze-dried potato). This is her primary source of income. The loan is to buy merchandise. This is her first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. M. is 41 years old and married. His wife is employed as a clerk and they have four children aged between one month and twelve years. They hope to give their children a very good quality education to university level. David's business is located at Mwembe Tayari, where he offers computer repair services to the people around Mombasa town. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the white beaches of the Indian Ocean.
David would love to grow his business to augment his income (he is also employed). He works very hard from early morning to late in the evening and manages his time in order to keep his business going well. He is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy computer accessories to expand his business and be able to serve a greater number of customers. He hopes to be a prominent businessman in the future. He describes himself as very hardworking, honest and faithful.

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Naida

texts.es:
La Sra. Naida tiene 26 años. Es soltera, vive con sus padres en  Fernando de la Mora.
La Sra. Naida se dedica a la compra venta de perfumes, jeans, remeras, camisas, etc. hace 6 años.
Ella tambien se dedica a la enseñanza en una escuela en  Fernando de la Mora. 
 La Sra. Naida necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderìas como jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones, en cantidad a menor precio. 
 En el futuro desea abrir un local en su domicilio  donde se concentra su mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Naida is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents in Fernando de la Mora.
For the last six years, Maida has bought and sold perfume, jeans, t-shirts, shirts etc.
She also teaches in a school in Fernando de la Mora.
Naida needs this loan to buy more merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts and pants in larger quantities at cheaper prices.
In the future she wants to open a shop in her home, around where most of her customers are concentrated.

loans.use: To buy jeans, t-shirts, perfume, shirts etc.

loans.name: Edia Jemina Dennis

texts.en:
Edia Jemina Dennis S. is married and has eight dependents. She has received schooling through junior high.  Edia is a fishmonger at Abura. She has done this work for seven years now. Her husband is a carpenter.  Edia uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Edia will use the loan to expand her fish business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Edia plans to reinvest back into her business.

The picture shows Edia selling her smoked fish at the market.

loans.use: expand her fish business

loans.name: Noel's Group

texts.en: Noel N. is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Noel is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. Noel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Noel raises pigs for sale. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Noel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Noel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Noel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Maria; ella tiene 37 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se  dedica a la artesanía haciendo aretes, collares,pulseras para luego distribuirlo a las tiendas que tienen este tipo de negocio.La socia es una persona muy emprendedora y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio  y así poder ofrecer á mas clientes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Karen is 37 years old.  She is married, has three children, and is an artist who makes necklaces, and bracelets, to sell in shops.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman and moves her family ahead in this manner. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies so that she can sell to more customers.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta G. is from the village of Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Aneta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aneta owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. Aneta’s husband is the driver to local community members. Aneta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aneta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aneta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. Aneta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business into making and selling snacks. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Aneta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business into making and selling snacks

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 54 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija Isabel de15 años. Hace muchos años atrás Elvira decidió dedicarse a la venta de golosinas, negocio que se encuentra ubicado cerca al ovalo de una avenida principal de su distrito, en un pequeña carretilla. Desde entonces atiende todos los días a sus clientes, en este trabajo su hija la apoya cuando no tiene responsabilidad escolar; ya que así puede ir Elvira al mercado central para abastecerse de más mercadería. Le gusta el negocio que realiza por las buenas utilidades que recibe. Sin embargo esta expuesta a diversos riesgos cuando trabajo hasta altas horas por la noche. Mas adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y paralelo a ello, empezar con la venta de comida. Es su noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor facilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy respetada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversidad de golosinas para tener su negocio siempre muy atractivo.
texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old and a hard working, responsible mother who lives in her own home, along with her husband and 15 year old daughter, Isabel.  A few years ago, Elvira decided to begin selling snacks.  Her business, a small cart, is located along a main street in her district.  Since then she's been serving her customers daily.  Her daughter helps her when she's not in school or studying.  This allows Elvira to go to the market to stock up on merchandise.  She enjoys her business because of the good profits it generates for her.  Never the less she is subject to various risks when she works late into the night.

In the future she plans to expand her business and begin selling food as a parallel business.  This will be her ninth loan through MFP.  She knows that if she repays this one on time, she will be able to get another one more easily, without placing a burden on the members of her communal bank, where she is well respected.

She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of snacks in order to make her business an attractive one.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Javier Orlando

texts.es: El señor Javier Orlando A. C. tiene 37 años y vive con un primo en el sector de Suba en Bogotá. Posee un salón de estética en el cual ofrece el servicio de corte, alicer y tinturado de cabello. El estudió contabilidad y finanzas básicas al terminar sus estudios de secundaria, pero nunca ejerció esa profesión. Empezó a trabajar en una peluquería y allí permaneció siete años. Más tarde, realizó algunos cursos de especialización en corte de cabello y hace nueve años decidió que era hora de abrir su propio negocio en un local cercano a su residencia. El éxito fue total porque atrajo la clientela que atendía cuando era empleado. Actualmente y sobre todo para  realizar arreglo de uñas en manos y pies, el señor Javier utiliza los servicios de una joven a quien le paga un porcentaje del producido diario. Este es el segundo préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de champú, tintes y cremas capilares. El volumen promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 80.000 COP  y el margen de utilidad es del 60%. La reciente temporada invernal que azotó el país incidió en una baja de sus ingresos. En un futuro el señor Javier piensa remodelar el local de su negocio para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y contratar otro estilista para él dedicarse a vender en otras peluquerías productos de un importante laboratorio que le ofreció la posibilidad de convertirse en distribuidor mayorista. Por ahora éste es sólo un proyecto y, mientras se hace realidad,  el microempresario seguirá cuidándoles el cabello a sus clientes, algunos de hace tantos años que ya no necesitan decirle qué tipo de corte quieren que les haga.
texts.en:
Javier Orlando A. C. is 37 years old and lives with a cousin in Suba sector of Bogotá.  He owns a beauty salon where he offers hair cuts, hair straightening and hair coloring services.  Javier studied accountancy and basic finances when he finished his high school studies but he never worked in the profession.  He started working in a hairdressing salon and stayed there for seven years.  Later, he carried out some specialization courses in hair cutting and nine years ago he decided that it was time to open his own business in premises near to his home.  It was a complete success because he attracted the customers he had when he was an employee.

Currently, and above all to do manicures and pedicures, Javier uses the services of a young woman who he pays a percentage of his daily income.  This is the second loan that Javier has taken from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to invest the money in buying shampoo, hair dyes and hair creams wholesale.

Javier's average daily sales amount to 80,000 Colombian pesos and his profit margin is 60%.  The recent winter season that hit the country led to a reduction in his income.  In the future, Javier is thinking of remodeling his business premises so that he can make his customers more comfortable and so that he can hire another stylist so that he can dedicate himself to selling products in other hairdressing salons as an important laboratory has offered him the possibility of becoming a wholesale distributor.  For now, this is only a project and, until it becomes a reality, this small businessman will continue looking after his customers' hair.  Some of his customers have been with him so long that they no longer need to tell him what hair cut they want him to give them.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, dyes and hair creams wholesale

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly C., 29, is married with three young children living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US $2.50 each day. Her husband purchases and sells yams at the local market. Her husband, Sari Narin, typically makes about US $10 each day as a yam farmer. Ly C. would like a loan of US $300 to reinvest in her husband's business. (C. is pictured with her family members.)

loans.use: To increase yam farming business

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San H. has been in the farming business for many years in the province of Kompong Cham. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow rice crops, and she gets good results from her planting almost every year. Her husband assists her in the same business. They are blessed with six children, four of whom are single and two are married. Three of her children are working in various occupations. 

Soon San H. will plant her rice crop in her dry-season rice field, but she doesn’t have the capital to do it yet. To solve this problem, she would like to request a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jessica Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessica Irene, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”,  del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 27 años y es madre de una niña que aun dependen de ella.

Jessica Irene, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, hace 03 años viene dedicándose a la  venta de Lenceria en las marcas Leonisa y Peter Pan, esta actividad la realiza en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan.  Nos cuenta que en la actualidad se siente muy contenta, ya que su negocio le esta yendo muy bien. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, inició su actividad comprando sus productos para tenerlo en stock.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles comprará lencerías como: sostenes, bikinis, calzones, bockser, pijamas, todo esto en diferentes tallas, modelos y colores,  para damas, caballeros y niños.


Jessica Irene, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y perseverando día a día.  Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica Irene belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Aguerridas II”, which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, single, and the mother of a daughter who is dependent on her.

Jessica Irene is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For the past three years, she has been selling lingerie from the Leonisa and Peter Pan brands. She operates her business from her home, where she attends to her customers who come by day after day. Jessica says that she is happy because her business has done very well. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she started her business by purchasing products to build up her inventory.

With his loan of 800 PEN, Jessica will purchase undergarments such as bras, bikinis, socks, boxers, and pajamas in different sizes, styles, and colors. She will have products for women, men, and children.

With great strength, Jessica Irene believes that she can continue to work and persevere each day. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her find opportunities to develop in the communities where they live.

loans.use: Purchase undergarments for women, men, and children

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca” at FINCA Peru. She is 41 years old, married and has four children in school. Victoria travels to the cities of Pisco and Ica where she sells different grains. She acquires her products at the suppliers’ market in the city of Ayacucho. She travels weekly to sell the grains. 


Her loan of 2000 PEN will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, and corn. A few months ago, she was able to construct her house. She would like to expand it and run a store from her home one day.

loans.use: Purchase grain from markets for sale

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es: Edmundo tiene 53 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en la ciudad de Morropón en Piura, a unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 12 años, gana su vida como obrero de campo. Es muy responsable en sus deberes laborales. Este trabajo le ayuda solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos a ella lo que ayudará mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Edmundo  es muy conocido en la zona y posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Ha manejado otros préstamos y siempre cumple con sus obligaciones de deuda en una manera puntual. Edmundo es un padre entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Edmundo is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in the city of Morropón in Piura, about four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  For more than 12 years, he has earned his living as a field laborer. He is very responsible in his job duties.  This work helps him meet his family's expenses.  

His house is currently in a deteriorated state.  He would like to make some improvements to it to help improve his family's quality of life.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to make the repairs. 

Edmundo is very well known in his area and he has good business and personal references in the community.  He has received other loans and he always meets his payment obligations punctually.  

Edmundo is a devoted father who always watches over his family's well-being and development.  The people that know him feel esteem and affection for him.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 54 años de edad y es casado con hijos mayores. Vive en casa propia con su esposo en el distrito de La Matanza en la provincia de Morropon, unas cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace dos años, María cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. María es muy conocida en la zona y tiene una clientela establecida. Con este negocio, ella puede solventar sus gastos personales y familiares.

Como ya ha comenzado la temporada escolar en Perú, sus clientes están comprando suministros para sus hijos. María quiere responder a la demanda de sus clientes con la compra de más útiles escolares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. María cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Ella es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y ha cumplido con sus otras obligaciones de manera puntual. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su ayuda en aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a 54-year-old married mother with grown children. She lives in her own home with her husband in the La Matanza district of the Morropon province, located some four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For two years, Maria has been running a small general store from home. There, she sells daily consumption products, such as basic need items and other goods. Maria is well-known in the area and has a solid client-base. With his business, she is able to cover both her personal and family expenses.

Since the school season has already started in Peru, her customers are currently purchasing school supplies for their children. Maria wants to meet this demand by purchasing more school supplies. For this reason, she sees the need to request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Maria has good personal and work references. She is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa's and has fulfilled her prior commitments punctually. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support in helping her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jane Wairimu

texts.en:
