Jane Wairimu N., 67, has farmed in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 21 years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 31 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 9. Adela’s husband works as a farmer.

Adela is a farmer working in San  Francisco Agusan Del Sur. Adela has been growing rice  for 10 years. Adela earns 2,500 Philippines pesos per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Adela hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Mrs. Eam is a 50-year-old woman.  She is married to Mr. Moeurn, age 54.  They both work in the farm fields as rice cultivators in Kompong Cham.  This old couple lives with six others and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  

Mrs. Eam is currently planting a potato crop, which she will harvest when they are mature. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it lacks fertilizer.  Because of this problem, Mrs. Eam has decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, which will make her crop grow well.  She will use the remainder of the funds to pay for plowing costs and purchase more seeds for future plantings.

loans.use: buy fertilizer & seeds and pay for plowing costs

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel esta solicitando un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, en esta momento lo que mas le interesa mejorar son los acabados del interior, ya que necesita enojares en las paredes y la pintura. En este momento el no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el cemento y la pintura especial  para el interior de las casa. 
Don Manuel esta solicitando su cooperación para este préstamo, desea mejorar la calidad de vida, bien estar  y la seguridad de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe como cocinero de un puesto de tacos.
texts.en:
Manuel is asking for a loan to do some home improvements.  At the moment what he is most interested in is doing the finishing touches to the inside because he needs to seal and paint the walls.  He doesn’t have the money needed to buy cement and special interior paint.

Manuel is asking for your cooperation for this loan.  He wants to improve his family’s quality of life, wellbeing and security.

He plans to use the salary he earns as a taco stand Cook to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add finishing touches to the interior of his house.

loans.name: Mumuwa Community Bank Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a member of the Mumuwa Community Bank Group (pictured here). She earns an income by raising and selling poultry. This has been her business for eight years now. The mother of four operates her business from Mpigi. Previous to launching this business, she operated a restaurant. It was capital from that endeavor that enabled her to take root in the poultry business. 

Aisha tells us that her monthly sales profits total up to about 600,00 shillings. She also ekes out additional revenue from a modest food sales business. 

With this loan, she reports that she plans to purchase more chicken mash and essential medications for her chickens.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken mash and essential medications for her chickens

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of three children and has for the last several years made a living selling candies, biscuits and bread. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Sally is a new member of HSPFI, but is committed to improving her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
25-year-old Novelyn is a married woman with 3 young children aged 5, 3 and 1. She and her husband are both farmers. They till their own land, which is located in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. They grow rice to sell at the market.

Novelyn has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. She hopes this loan will help improve their business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical bills.

For the past 10 years, Susan has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is price fluctuations in the business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Susan plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of washing soaps, detergents, wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of washing soaps, detergents, wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Sokghet

texts.en: Sokghet, 38 years old, is selling fruit. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $10 per day. She has three children. They are 12, 8 and 4 years old. Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $50 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to transport fruit to sell. In the future, she wants to extend her store to sell more kinds of fruit to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fruit to sell

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is 50 years old and married to Joan. They have been blessed with three children. For the last year he has been selling like radios, CD and DVD players, plugs, chargers for phones.
 
He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This is will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to buy stock,like CD and DVD players, plugs, and chargers for phones.

In future, he aspires to grow his business, hence improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy stock ,like  CD and DVD players, plugs,and  chargers for phones.

loans.name: Robeth

texts.es:
La señora Robeth, es casada con el señor Alfredo y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quines ya están casados, ella vive  en un lugar muy bonito ya que hay muchos árboles de pino.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su  tienda de abarrotes y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos lleva  trece años y dos meses.

   Su motivo a esta actividad  fue ella misma ya que trabajo en una tienda de abarroter gubernamental y de ahí nació su inspiración en  poner este negocio  que le ha dado un buen resultado.

    Lo que desea es que con esta actividad pueda  seguir trabajando  para  poder apoyar a sus nietos con sus estudios, así tambien comprar un lugar para  construir su tienda más amplia.
texts.en:
Sra. Robeth is married to Sr. Alfredo and they have four children who are already married. She lives in a very beautiful place that has many pine trees.

Robeth is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise in order to restock her grocery store. She says that she has been doing well and has been in business for 13 years and 2 months.

Her reason for starting this business is because she had experience working at a grocery store owned by the government. There she was inspired to start this business which has given her good results.

What she wants from her business is the ability to continue working so that she can support her grandchildren with their studies. Robeth also wants to buy a place where she can build a larger store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He started his career at a very young age working in the aluminum industry. Today, he is the proud owner of a small shop with one full-time employee helping him with the work.

Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools and supplies for his business to replace the old ones. He states that these purchases will improve his operation and allow him to complete his work correctly.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Nury Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nury, tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años el compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo sola con sus tuvo 5 hijos que tuvo de esta relación, en la actualidad 4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el ultimo que tiene 16 años es el que aun vive con ella y estudia en colegio.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario y con esto sacar adelante a sus hijos hace 15 años empezó un negocio de venta de ropa, el cual lo ha mantenido hasta la fecha y es a través de este negocio que ha podido salir adelante,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también tiene muchos clientes que le encargan sus productos con anticipación, trabaja de miércoles a domingo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra los días sabados. Ella compra en Guayaquil cada fin de mes o cuando necesita mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado con los créditos para sacar adelante su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son terminar su casa y construir un pequeño local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Nury. She is 52 years old. Her companion in life died several years ago and she was left alone with their five children. Four of them are now adults. The youngest one is 16 years old, lives with her, and attends school.

Nury has been able to earn her daily living and move her children forward because of the clothing business she started 15 years ago. She has been able to keep her business running through today and it allows her to stay ahead. Her sales are made by going door-to-door, but she also has many customers who order their products in advance. Nury works Wednesday through Sunday. She extends credit for her products and collects payment on Saturdays. Nury goes shopping in Guayaquil at the end of every month or whenever she needs merchandise.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing. Nury is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the help the loans have provided so that she can keep her business moving. Her dreams are to finish the construction of her house and to build a small store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей в торговом центре. Арендует помещение, где открыл магазин бытовой техники. В этой области он уже семь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения телевизоров, параболических тарелок и необходимой бытовой техники.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the J.Rumy district.  He is 35 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Khurshed is involved in retail sales at a shopping center.  He leases a space, where he opened a household electronics store.  He has been in this field for seven years.  Khurshed is requesting this loan for the purchase of televisions, parabolic dishes and necessary household electronics.

loans.use: to purchase televisions, parabolic dishes and necessary household electronics

loans.name: Lecibel

texts.en:
Lecibel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Lecibel has a shop where she sells snacks like rice and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy the ingredients needed to make snacks.
Lecibel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lecibel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make snack foods.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is a 45 year-old farmer with 6 children. She is the leader of a group with 5 members. She has been a farmer for 25 years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers to better cultivate rice on her farmland. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase her crop yield and to then sell her crops for a good price, which would enable her to earn more income for her family's expenses and for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris is 29 years old and lives in Paynesville South, Liberia. She lives with her partner and has two children, aged 3 and 7, who are in school and live at home. For the past seven years she has been selling slippers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Dorris says she started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. What she really likes about her business is that it helps her to have some money for herself. She hopes to become an international business woman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 58-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. In 2007, she decided to open her own home appliances shop. Today, she’s asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products so she can boost her productivity and her income. In the future, she plans to search for new and high-tech products in order to please more of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional products.

loans.name: Maria Nida

texts.en:
Maria Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business. She has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from pig fattening.
Maria Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to her basket weaving.

loans.name: Santos Genaro

texts.es:
Santos Genaro es un joven de 28 años de edad, al que le gusta mucho trabajar y esforzarse para poder salir siempre adelante. Él se dedica a realizar el servicio de transporte público, en una moto taxi, en los mercados de Ica, ciudad caracterizada por las grandes exportaciones de espárragos, alcachofas, mangos, entre otros.
Santos empezó su negocio alquilando una moto taxi pero con el tiempo y los ahorros que pudo juntar se compró una moto taxi, hace 3 años aproximadamente, esto le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos y fortalecer sus sueños. Actualmente gana un promedio S/ 51.00 diarios, lo que le ayuda a pagar el combustible y también los gastos básicos que el necesita.

Gracias al préstamo de S/3,000 que recibirá gracias a Kiva, él podrá realizarle mantenimiento a su moto taxi, debido a que con el tiempo algunas piezas se han ido malgastando y necesitan ser cambiadas lo más antes posible. Esta ayuda por parte de los prestatarios Kiva lo ayudara a poder continuar mejorando sus ingresos, con lo que podrá ahorrar, y algún día por fin poder comprarse el automóvil que tanto desea para sentirse más seguro en lo que respecta a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Santos Genaro is a 28-year-old young man who likes to work and makes an effort to always get ahead.  He works in public transportation for a living driving a mototaxi in the markets of the city of Ica, which is known for its exports of asparagus, artichokes, mangos, and other things.

Santos started his business renting a mototaxi, but with time and the savings he was able to put aside be bought his own mototaxi around three years ago.  This has allowed him to improve his income and strengthen his dreams.  He currently earns an average of 51 nuevos soles a day, which helps him pay for fuel as well as his basic expenses.

Thanks to the loan of 3,000 nuevos soles he will receive from Kiva, he will be able to repair his mototaxi, which has some parts that have worn out with time and that need to be replaced as soon as possible.  This help from Kiva's lenders will help him to continue to improve his income, which will allow him to save and one day be able to buy the car he wants so badly to feel safer in terms of his work.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 21 year-old businessman.  He is single, and he has been running an electronic shop for the past year with a monthly income of KES 8,000,  which he uses to fulfill his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Timothy will use the loan to buy electrical parts and to stock more electronic items (iron boxes, radios, TVs) for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will save to have more capital to be able to expand his business. 

He hopes to buy commercial land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy electrical spare parts and other electronics for his business

loans.name: Tuyen's Group

texts.en:
Tuyen was born in 1977. She is a member of Co Duong cluster in SEDA. She has two daughters. She and her husband are farmers. Not only do they grow rice but she also breeds pigs. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). This is the first time she has participated in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy pig food. She is the leader of a 5-member group loan in SEDA.

About the other borrowers in her group:
Loan is 27 years old. She has two children. She sells fast food in the market. She would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy goods to make fast food to sell.
Hoan is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 8.502.000 VND to buy poultry food.
Nhung is 31 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND to buy chicken food.
Phuong is 27 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Asha Kibwana

texts.en:
Asha Kibwana is a 39 year-old tailor in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is a divorced mother of four. She has been doing this business for the past six years and she is doing great. 

This is Asha’s first business loan from Kiva partner KADET. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well known business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is a responsible woman. She was born in 1961 in a peasant family. She was start working 34 year ago with farming. During these years she grows potatoes, onion and wheat. She is working successful. She has a great experience in this sphere.  She has four children. Her children help her in business. She is very kind and she can work with people so good. She wants to enlarge her business and to get a good income. She intends to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and other products. She hopes she will get a good harvest for the next year. She needs to money. She is asking for a loan of 9500 with this aim. She needs your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her food kiosk business

loans.name: Panah

texts.en:
Panah is 36 years old.  He lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region.  He is married and has a child. He has been in his business for three years.
Having borrowed $400, he bought 2 calves.
Now he requests a loan of $800 to buy four more calves.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Angélica Elizabeth

texts.en:
Angélica is 28 years old, is married, and has 2 children that currently attend elementary school. Her husband is an employee of the state highway. Angélica began to sell food 2 years ago because she needed to help her husband with their household expenses and economically supporting their children when he was unemployed. She now has a business partner with whom she takes turns running the business. They don't have additional workers; their shifts are by days. Angélica sells hamburgers, flautas, sopes and enchiladas on the weekends but in the near future, she hopes to open her own business or buy her partner’s share and run the business by herself.

Angélica asks for a US$ 375 loan to invest in her business. She would like to offer a wider variety of foods in the menu and gain more clients who have commented on the need of other dishes. She offers to pay this loan in 6 to 12 months. She hopes that you support her to make it through. For this she is very grateful with all the people who collaborate.

Translated from Spanish to English by Allison Garcia and Amanda Poulton (Glassboro High School’s Honors Spanish III Class) under the supervision of Patricia Yáñez

Angélica tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar que estudian actualmente en la primaria, su esposo trabaja en la Red Estatal de Autopistas como empleado. Angélica empezó a vender comidas hace 2 años, por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de las casa, ya que en esa época su esposo se encontraba desempleado y tenían que mantener a sus hijos y todos los gastos del hogar. Actualmente en su negocio tiene una socia, con la cual se turnan la atención del mismo y no tienen ayudantes adicionales, los turnos son por días, ella vende los fines de semana hamburguesas, flautas, sopes y enchiladas, comenta que en un futuro cercano pueda abrir su propio negocio o comprarle la parte de la socia y atenderlo ella sola.

Angélica esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 375 para invertir en su negocio, ya que tiene en mente la idea de ofrecer un menú más variado y lograr captar mayor clientela, que le han comentado su necesidad de otros platillos. Ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y espera de tu apoyo para poder salir adelante y por ello esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que le colaboren.

loans.use:
Purchase of working equipment
Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Rajabhon

texts.ru:
Rajabhon is not married, she is 46 years old and does not have children. Rajabhon and her elderly mother live with the brother's family. Her brother has a large family, and to not be a burden on him, Rajabhon trades on the market. She has 8 years of experience purchasing dried fruit on one market, sorting through it, and then reselling quality fruit on another market. Her mother helps her. The financial gain is small, but it helps to cover the costs.

Rajabhon received her first microcredit loan from MicroInvest 2 years ago; she used the money to purchase fresh apricots and dry them with the help of her family. Since then, she has been receiving loans from MicroInvest.

In August, the price for dried fruit is low, and Rajabhon would like to receive a new loan to purchase and store dried fruit. In January and February, when the prices rise, Rajabhon will be able to receive good profit from her sales.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva

Рачабхон незамужем, ей 46 лет и у нее нет детей. Живет она со своей престарелой матерью в семье своего брата. У брата большая семья и, чтобы не быть ему в тягость, Рачабхон выходит на базар торговать. ее опыт работы 8 лет. Рачабхон покупает на одном базаре сухофрукты и отсортировав продает на следующем базаре. Ей помогает ее мать. Прибыль небольшая, но помогает покрывать расходы. В Микроинвест она получила свой первый займ 2 года назад и тогда она приобрела свежий абрикос и высушила его с помощью семьи. С тех пор она получает займы в Микроинвест. В августе цена на сухофрукты падает и Рачабхон хочет получить новый займ для закупки и хранения сухофруктов. В январе и феврале месяце цена на сухофрукты поднимется и тогда продав Рачабхон получить хорошую прибыль.

loans.use: to purchase and store dried fruits

loans.name: Kokom

texts.en: Kokom is 28 years old and is married. She buys and resells vegetables at her house and usually earns $10 per day. She is a member of MBK and wants to receive a $50 loan and intends to use it to buy more vegetables, and therefore earn more income per day. Her husband, Uding, sells vegetables at the market and earns $16.50 per day. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Mrs. Cecilia U. is a dedicated LAPO client. She is 47 years old, married with 5 children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling provisions and drinks since 1985, and she learned this trade from her mother. She has been with LAPO for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan of $550 in order to buy more provisions and drinks in bulk for sales. She hopes to pay the loan back within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina M. is one of Tanzania’s strong-necked and strong-spirited women who walks from place to place selling various items from a huge basin, basket, or box balanced perfectly on her head. The ‘machinga’s” (hawker’s) job is not an easy one but often the only one available. Amina requires a loan of $725 to purchase additional stock. She is married to husband Msabaha and has four children between the ages of 15 and 22 years.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein owns a mini market in the south Lebanon, in a region called Nabatieh. Hussein and his wife are making plans to buy a car. Consequently, they are both working extremely hard in order to save and make this investment.

This is the fourth time Hussein is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is looking forward to buy new merchandise for his business. Hussein and his wife are both working hard to support their three children.

loans.use: To buy additional market supplies

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is married with a daughter, Yana. She and her family live in Kherson where Natasha sells women’s clothing in the central market. She is very disciplined, analytical and organized. She communicates very well and has innovative skills which help her find new potential customers. Natasha has been in business for 10 years. She has promptly repaid 7 loans. Presently, her monthly net profit is about $5600. 

Natasha admits she needs financial support continue growing and developing her business. Today she is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase inventory and as a result, her revenue. Natasha is planning to continue to gain more loyal customers. We believe her communication and management skills will help Natasha achieve stability and success as well as financial independence. One of her long-term plans is to generate enough profit to purchase a nice separate apartment for her family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials in bulk to produce ice cream and mabí.

loans.name: Thị Thơm

texts.vi:
Mrs P. Thị Thơm is 39 years old. She is requesting a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her paddle of 600 ducks. On a side job, she makes bricks to increase her wage. She has 3 children and her oldest is working. She likes SEDA because it allows her to make small weekly payment.

Translated form Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị P. Thị Thơm (MS: 06020020), năm nay 39 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám nuôi 600 con vịt để. Ngoài ra chị còn làm lò đốt gạch, ngói tạo thêm thu nhập. Chị có 3 con, 1 con của chị đã đi làm còn 2 con vẫn đang đi học. Chị thấy vay vốn trả góp rất phù hợp vơi gia đình chị.

loans.use: to buy feed for her paddle of ducks

loans.name: Esna Nicida

texts.es:
Señora Esna Nico belongs to the Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, located at 7 Alfonso Ugarte Street, in the District of Calleri, part of the Department of Ucayali. She is 42 and the mother of 2 children, her husband is a businessman. With Esna’s first loan from Manuela Ramos of S /. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of groceries for a reduced price. At present she has a stand in one of the busiest markets in our city, which opens very early in the morning since people come here to buy their staple goods. She serves everyone with great kindness because it is very important to her to provide good service. This 4 month loan for S /. 2300 will allow her to buy: 10 boxes of oil, 5 sacks of rice, 5 bags of noodles, 1 sack of salt, 1 carton of milk, 2 boxes of canned goods, etc. Esna is very happy about the support offered by Manuela Ramos which allows her to continue with this project that has changed her life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esna Nicida pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. 7, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, es así que Esna con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de abarrotes al por menor. En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de nuestra ciudad, abre muy temprano su puesto por que a tempranas horas las personas acuden para comprar sus productos de primera necesidad, los atiende con mucha amabilidad por que para ella es muy importante brindar una buena atención. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 10 cajas de aceite, 5 sacos de arroz, 5 bolsas de fideos, 1 saco de sal, 1 caja de leche, 2 cajas de conservas, etc. Esna se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para seguir adelante en el proyecto que se ha trazado para su vida.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in clothing for a small business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is forty-two years old and married with five children. All her children are in school. Ama hawks herrings in the village for the folks to get fish to prepare their meals, either for lunch or dinner. She says smoked herring is entering the lean season therefore she wants to use the loan to buy more herrings to avoid price hikes.

Ama hopes to save some money to rent one of the local market stalls to sell her fish out of as hawking is a very tiring job for her. She also hopes to register to become a member of the health insurance scheme where she and her family can enjoy free medical care. Ama is member of the group called Amen. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of smoked herrings for re-sale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is 58 years old and belongs to the “Señor del Cautivo II” community bank. She lives with her husband and her three children. She says her major problem is not having a fixed store location.

One of her objectives is to have a store selling clothing and other items, as well as being able to travel places with her husband who is already retired.

With this loan of 1,700 Soles, which will be repaid in 8 payments, she will buy leather jackets from the Villa el Salvador factory in Lima in order to sell them in the streets of her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira tiene 58 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II”, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos. Dice que su mayor dificultad es ser ambulante, aunque ya se ha acostumbrado a ello, es una situación difícil que afronta desde hace 30 años. Uno de sus objetivos es tener una tiendita, con venta de ropas y otros artículos y poder viajar con su esposo ya jubilado a otros lugares a pasear. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,700 soles, el cual será pagado en 8 cuotas, comprará casacas de cuero de la fabrica de Villa el Salvador en Lima para poder venderlas en las calles de su localidad de forma ambulante.

loans.use: Purchase of leather jackets

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 60 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380 de Managua, es casada, con dos hijos de 22 y 25 años de edad, uno estudia y el otro trabaja y apoya con los gastos de la familia, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad en una empresa privada, la Sra. Juana es ama de casa. Su hija y su marido decidieron mejorar la casa de Doña Juana es por eso que le ayudarán con una inversión de infraestructura. La solicitud de préstamo es para construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda para darle más seguridad a su familia y a sus bienes, para lo cual tiene que comprar, arena, cemento, piedra, y hierro. A futuro es seguir haciendo mejoras ya que con la ayuda de su hija y su esposo espera salir adelante
texts.en:
Doña Juana is 60 years old and lives in neighborhood 380 of Managua. She is married with two children of 22 and 25 years of age; one studies and the other works and supports the costs of the family. Her husband works in security services in a private company. Señora Juana is a housewife. Her daughter and her husband have decided to make home improvements, which is why they are helping her with an infrastructure investment. The loan application is for construction of a wall at the rear of her house to give more security to her family and their property, for which they must buy sand, cement, stone and iron. In the future, she will continue making improvements; with the help of her daughter and her husband, she hopes to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall in the back of her house

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel T. is 32 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are currently studying.  Having managed a pharmacy for seven years, Samuel is experienced at giving customers medical advice and selling them the necessary drugs.  While selling medicine is a lucrative business in Ghana, it is also very expensive because drugs must be purchased from importers.  In order to purchase drugs in larger quantities at wholesale prices, Samuel has joined the Onyemi Yim Trust Group, which supports its members when they apply for loans, and has also requested a loan of $875.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of medicines for resale.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng C., 48, started her grocery selling over one year ago out of her home in the area of Taskor Village. She currently earns approximately US$ 3 each day. She cares for five children, two of whom are working, and one other is married and living separately.

Her husband, Mr. Hok Luy, 47, is a fisherman. Recently, C. sold groceries till her store was empty and she wants re-stock the store. Hence she has decided to ask for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more groceries to sell. They all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province. The loan will help to increase their revenue to adequately support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Lugazi A-Josephine Group

texts.en:
Josephine Kokumareri, age 40, is a loving and caring guardian to her sister’s 9 year old daughter. She earns a living from her pub business in Lugazi Mbarara which offers a variety of local brand liquor. This earns her 48,000 UGX daily from which she must pay rent of 70,000UGX per month. She has been running the business for over one year and  offers her customer excellent service. Josephine tries to make her pub stand out from the others in her locality by offering free DSTV and GTV entertainment to her customers. 

This business can at times be frustrating. Josephine has to deal with clients who walk away drunk without paying their bills and those who get chaotic and end up breaking glass ware. This though, has not hampered her from expanding her business. She is using the loan proceeds to purchase more local brands of alcohol such as Nile, Bell, Tusker, Waragi, Romi, among others. She is saving some of the profits earned so that she can purchase a pool table for the pub to attract more customers and increase her income. She is more than determined to see her niece through all levels of education.

loans.use: Purchase more local brands of alcohol such as Nile, Bell, Tusker, Waragi, Romi among others.

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng T. lives in the village of Krodas Kor in Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and single. She lives with her family, which includes seven people. She and her parents are the breadwinners who try to work hard in order to make an income to support the household.

Mrs. Thorng T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her field, which is infertile soil. She hopes to make her crop more productive and increase her rice revenue with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian K. sells soft drinks at Liverpool Street in Elmina. Vivian has received junior high education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband works with a printing press.

Vivian has been selling soft drinks since 1998. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: additional capital to increase the sale of soft drinks

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun P., 46, is a widow with four children. She lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.

Sun P. has a business selling fermented fish at the market and earns around US$3 per day. She is also supported by one child who works as a driver. Sun P. has requested a loan to purchase more fermented fish from fishermen to resell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase more fermented fish.

loans.name: Tiny

texts.en:
Mr. Tiny B., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Hoeun Chhang, 39, were married in 2000. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Mrs. Hoeun Chhang also has one son with her first husband. The eldest son is a construction worker and the others stay at home. Besides his children, Tiny also has an old mother living with him.

Tiny has been a mason for over one year. His wife sells porridge and Khmer noodles in front of her house.

Tiny is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle and a cart to load his construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and a cart to load his construction materials

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Marina R. es una dama digna de admirar por ser muy trabajadora y llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación por estar comprometida con el bienestar de este.

Hoy en día ella se dedica a su negocio de venta de comestibles como platanitos, galletas, frutas en bolsa, entre otros y para ello espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina R. is a woman worthy of admiration because she is such a hard worker, and because she provides daily sustenance to the house where she lives. She is devoted to the well being of the people in her home.

She sells food like bananas, crackers, bagged fruit and other items. She hopes to get a loan. With help from Ceprodel, she will be able to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Lilliam Jackeline

texts.es: La joven Liliam tiene 27 años de edad, vende cosméticos, también vende mariscos, ella inicio con crédito que la Vogue dio los productos y luego con las ganancias ha invertido en mas productos. Reside en el barrio 30 de Mayo, es madre soltera con dos hijos de 2 y 9 años de edad, el cual tiene que vender para poder dar la alimentación a sus hijos. Con este crédito va invertir en más inventario para ofrecer a sus clientes la variadad de sus productos. Sus planes es poder tener un modulo donde pueda vender variedad de producto, poder cuidar de sus hijos, dar estudios y que no  le falte nada. Da las gracias Afodenic por hacer posible estas ventas.
texts.en:
Young Lilliam is 27 years old and sells cosmetics as well as seafood. She began her business on credit, selling “Vogue” products, and later used her earnings to invest in more items. She lives in the May 30th neighborhood, and is a single mother of two children, ages 2 and 9. She needs to work in order to be able to feed her children.

She will invest this loan in more inventory to offer her customers a greater variety of merchandise. Her dream is to have a stand where she could sell an assortment of products. She also wants to be sure that her children do not want for anything and to provide for their education.

She is grateful to AFODENIC for making her sales possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and seafood to continue increasing her sales

loans.name: Cusi Urpi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cusi Urpi que significa Pajarito Feliz, el Banco inicia el ciclo 30 con 27 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comidas, frutas, abarrotes en general, calzados, ropa, miel D. abeja, cereales, leña, mercería, cosméticos y servicios D. cosmetología.

Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth venD. calzados a pedido, además D. panes que reparte a los trabajadores D. las instituciones, sus ventas son al crédito.
Por otro lado Edith es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Edith hace manualidades D. acuerdo al pedido D. sus clientes, además venD. ropa a pedido.
	

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, frutas, ropa, leña, zapatos y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar su negocio, superarse como persona y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Cusi Urpi Communal Bank (which means Happy Little Parrot) began its 30th cycle with 27 members. The members perform different businesses such as selling food, fruits, general groceries, footwear, clothing, honey, cereals, wood, crafts, cosmetics and cosmetic services. Elizabeth is unmarried, is 33 years old and has one child. Elizabeth sells shoes to order, plus breads that are distributed to office employees, selling on credit. Furthermore Edith is married, has 2 children and is 34 years old, Edith makes handicrafts according to the request of clients and also sells clothes to order. The members need different loan amounts such as 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles for a total of 9600 soles loan from the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in buying rice, sugar, oil, fruit, clothing, wood, shoes and cosmetics. The dreams of the members are to improve their businesses, succeed personally and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, fruit, clothing, wood, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina tiene 50 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene 4 hijos, ella es una madre muy trabajadora y abnegada con su negocio, vive en su casa propia junto a sus hijos, que son el motivo de su esfuerzo que desea darles buenos estudios. La siembra y venta de espinaca es la actividad que realiza diariamente en sus chacras, las cuales cultiva y riega con mucho esmero para que crezcan y broten muy buenos frutos. Por ello, todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos, y más aún en los meses de cosecha, que tiene que alistar las canastas donde serán embarcadas las espinacas adecuadamente para que no sufran alteraciones hasta llegar al mercado de Tarma.  Los años que llevan en esta actividad le han dado la experiencia para el manejo de sus siembras y venta de hortalizas, y lo que más le gusta es la cosecha, porque avizora la cantidad de dinero que captará con ella, por otro lado, lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar las canastas pesadas a los camiones con sumo cuidado para que no se maltraten, y fue con estas canastas con las que ha preferido tomarse la foto. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, sus compañeros del banco comunal ya están en el 9no préstamo debido a que ella se incorporó en el 5to ciclo del grupo, y está muy contenta con el trabajo organizado de los integrantes. El dinero que solicita es para renovar sus canastas, y para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 50 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children. She is a very hard-working mother and devotes herself to her business. She lives in her own home with her children and is motivated by her wish to give them a good education.
She makes a living growing and selling spinach. Every day she tends and waters her plots with great care so that they grow and produce very good fruit. She gets up very early every day to prepare food and even earlier during the harvest months, when she has to prepare the baskets that carry the spinach safely to the Tarma market.
Her years in this work have given her the necessary experience to manage her crops and sell her produce. The harvest is what she most likes about her work because she looks forward to the amount of money she will gain. On the other hand, the most difficult part of her work is carrying the heavy baskets to the trucks undamaged; it is with these baskets that she has chosen to take her photo.
This will be her 4th loan with MFP. Her fellow members at the communal bank are already on their 9th loan since she joined in on the group’s 5th loan cycle; she is very happy with the members’ organized work. She is requesting the money to repair her baskets and to purchase chemical fertilisers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers and baskets to transport her produce

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer trabaja como transportista en el trufi 88 del Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa; el taxi que maneja  no está en buenas condiciones, por lo que ha decidido venderlo y comprar otro más nuevo, pues esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa.

Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Zona Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de otra movilidad en mejor estado para seguir trabajando.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Wilmer works as driver at the truffi 88 of the Eduardo Avaroa Union; the taxi he drives is not in good conditions, so he decided to sell it and buy a new one, because this activity is his main source of income to support his two children and his wife. He lives at his parents' house in the Villa Dolores in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a new vehicle in better shape in order to keep on working. This is his third Impro loan, his good behaviour allows to approve another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new vehicle to keep on working as a taxi driver

loans.name: Dio

texts.en: Dio M. is currently in the business of selling flour and sugar and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. Dio is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a shopkeeper. She has five children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more materials to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B. is from the town of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Helen is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Helen is just starting this business.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.en:
Rosa has a small restaurant business selling barbecued meats and cold drinks on the weekends in front of her home. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her husband is retired from his job with the Ministry of Agriculture.

Rosa has been working with Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras." She used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in a small amount of candy for sale. Nowadays, she has her business selling cold drinks and grilled chicken and other meats. Rosa reports that her business is progressing well. She hopes to use this loan of 2000 soles to invest in tables, chairs and tablecloths as well as more food for her restaurant.

Rosa's goal is to improve her restaurant and expand her customer base. She hopes to use the profits from her business to help her husband and children.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, tablecloths and food for a restaurant

loans.name: Soronzonbold

texts.en:
Soronzonbold Banzrach is 43-year-old man and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter. He currently lives with his family in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a high school student in a local high school and his wife is a teacher in a local kindergarten.

Soronzonbold has been in the trucking business since 1998. He owns an old Russian truck that he uses for carrying freight between his city and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family is very supportive of his business and helps whenever he needs some help.

Soronzonbold says that he works hard to make sure that his daughter receives good education without any financial strain. Further, he dreams of changing his old truck into a new, powerful one. He requests a loan to repair his old truck in order to carry on his business.

loans.use: to repair his old truck in order to carry on his business

loans.name: Fidelito

texts.en:
Fedelito S., Sr. has a business repairing gas stoves in the village of Barangay Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela. He is 49 years old and is happily married to Noemi. Noemi is an OFW (overseas Filipino worker). She went abroad to help earn for the future of their children. The couple is blessed with four children who are: Nomelyn, 23 years old and a college graduate; Lizel, 20 years old and just finished her Hotel and Restaurant Management course; Moris, 17 years old and a high school graduate; and Fedelito S., Jr., 15 years old and currently a high school student. 

Fedelito works at his repair business and sometimes also works on his man made stoves, made out of cement and recycled stove materials, which makes a good kind of cooking stove. Fedelito wanted a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to maintain his business and become successful someday.  He hopes to get a loan of PHP6,000 that will be utilized for the development of his repair and manufacturing business and ultimately for the welfare of his beloved family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L. is from the village of Lobogon. She is 60 years old. Maria is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a nipa hut making business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling nipa hut  to local businesses and community members. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Maria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Maria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona A. is 34 years old, is seperated with 4 children all under 16 years, and almost all of them are studying in primary school. 
Ramona started her business in 2006- when she returned from Spain, a country where there is better business, she took money to invest in merchandise (new and used clothes)- she has many local people that buy her clothes. 
She invested her loan in buying more merchandise (different types of clothes for spring and summer).

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr: A. Josiane est née le 15 Janvier 1969 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Josiane habite au quartier Agbokou  à Porto-Novo depuis vingt sept ans. Mariée à MEGBLETO Albert, Josiane est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Josiane est une couturière qui vend également des tissus et du charbon de bois. Josiane s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin ; elle a une boutique à Agbokou. Josiane a déjà vingt ans d’expérience dans ce métier. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Josiane sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé
texts.en:
Josiane A. was born January 15, 1969 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Josiane has lived in Porto-Novo's Agbokou neighborhood for seven years. Married to Albert Megbleto, Josiane is the mother of three children who are all in school. The family's expenses are paid by both spouses. Josiane is a dressmaker who also sells fabric and wood coal. Josiane gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin; she has a store in Agbokou. Josiane already has twenty years of experience in this trade. She is a former client of Alidé who has already taken two loans from Alidé, loans that she has repayed well. Josiane is requesting a third loan from Alidé to increase her working capital and to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of wood coal and pieces of fabric

loans.name: Zonie

texts.en: Zonie Occeña is thankful to KIVA for funding a previous loan requested through ASHI. Because it, her eldest child will be graduating as a nurse this year. Soon, she will be able to see the fruit of her hard work and determination in maintaining her business despite of the financial scarcity she often experienced because of insufficient income of her small business. Her husband provides only a small and sporadic income as a farm laborer. The interest rate she paid for the loan that she had requested through ASHI was worthwhile as it enabled her to finance the growth of her business and increase her profit. However, the battle against poverty is not yet over for Zonie and her family. She still has two children, aged 17 to 19 years old, that are in college which requires large amounts of money until they graduate. Zonie  is requesting a larger loan to be able to increase her business and profit which would be saved for her children and used to reach her dream of improving their standard of living.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase large volumes of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo (Félix) de 43 años, y con su hija María de 19 años, quien es la adoración de ambos.
Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de gas, actividad que viene realizando en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la zona donde vive. Su trabajo consiste en abastecerse de balones de gas de la distribuidora, para luego venderlos por unidad a sus clientes. A María le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues le permite tener libertad para pasar tiempo con su hija, aunque algunas veces le resulta cansado atender ella sola su negocio; pero María se ha adaptado a su ritmo de trabajo y es por ello que quiere progresar haciendo un negocio más rentable. 

Este es el segundo préstamo de María con MFP y esta vez promete ser tan puntual como lo fue en su crédito anterior. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de balones de gas para incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
María, 41, lives with her husband, Félix, 43, and their 19-year-old daughter, María, who is the apple of her parents' eyes. For the last nine years she has sold gas in one of her area's busiest markets. Her work consists in stocking up on gas tanks from the gas distributor to subsequently resell to her customers. María enjoys her work very much because it gives her the freedom to spend time with her daughter, although sometimes it is fatiguing for her to tend to her sales all day by herself; but María has adapted to her work pace and wants to make her store more profitable. This is her second loan with MFP and María pledges to be as punctual with repayments now as she has been in the past. With the funds requested she will increase the number of gas tanks she buys to increase her available stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: La señora Aurora, ella tiene 54 años de edad, es una madre soltera mujer  y tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Hace más 4 años  que  se dedica a una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable y ella tenía que mantener a sus hijos pues esta Señora es un símbolo de una persona que trabaja arduamente. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de granos básicos que es lo que esta priorizando la gente al realizar las compras de sus viviendas, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes Su deseo es de poseer un mini súper que pueda surtir a las personas que viven cerca de ella y que le brinden mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurora is 54 years old and is a single mother. She has 6 children and all of them work independently. She has had a small grocery store in her house for 4 years. She began this business due to the need for more income to support her children. She didn’t have a stable job and she needed to provide for them. She is a prime example of a person who works very hard. The loan will be invested in buying basic grains, which is what people prioritize when buying for their households, and also sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents. Her hope is to have a small supermarket that could serve the people who live nearby and also provide a better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small grocery store: basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is forty years-old and married with five children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Theresa works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She trades in all kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. on a table top at the market square. She says she buys her goods from nearby communities. Theresa has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine has worked as a hairdresser since 2004. She’s 33 years old and is married with two young children. She helps her husband in the household.

Today, Sabrine is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a special hair machine and beauty products to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy a special hair machine and beauty products

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, age 32, started his rice farm in 2007. His rice field is in Norala, South Cotabato. He’s married to Maria and has two children. His farm helps his family meet their basic needs. Currently he is applying for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He joined CEVI in October, 2007 to access a loan with only 2% interest. This loan will help him a lot getting some farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC II está formado por ocho mujeres y cuatro varones, trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven la ciudad D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería.

Mariela es socia del banco comunal Señor D. Torrechayoc, tiene 33 años D. edad, es conviviente y su esposo Walter le apoya en el gasto familiar. Mariela se dedica a la venta D. comestibles por mayor, ella es una mujer emprendedora que desD. que abrió la tienda D. abarrotes le va muy bien, Ya son dos años que la socia pertenece al banco comunal Señor D. Torrechayoc, el crédito que reciba es para comprar mas arroz, azúcar, fideos y huevos. 

Los otros socios como Edelmira, Sonia y luz Marina son profesoras, Albino y Nayda se dedican a la venta D. comestibles y Angela se dedica a la venta D. verduras.  

Los socios Militon e Inocencia son esposos que se dedican a la panadería pues alquilan un local para preparar sus panes. Los socios tenían su casa D. material D. adobe cerca al rió vilcanota. Por las precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron sobre la ciudad del cusco, el rió del vilcanota aumento su caudal D. tal forma que se desbordo llevando se consigo casas como la D. los socios Militon y Inocencia, ellos perdieron todos sus pertenencias D. su domicilio. Los socios continuaran con sus trabajos a pesar D. las adversidades del clima.

Otros socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco pues sus compradores trabajan directamente con el turismo, el turismo ha decaído considerablemente.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called Senor D. Torrechayoc II is maD. up of 8 women and 4 men, all hardworkers who always look for opportunities to improve their lives and economic situation, and through their daily efforts ensure a better future for their children. The members live near Cusco, in the city of Urubamba, a region known for its warm climate, beautiful scenery and cattle farming.

Mariela is a member of the bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband Walter, who helps with the household costs. Mariela sells wholesale groceries. She is an enterprising woman and from the time she opened her small shop she has done well. She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years now, and she will use her portion of the new loan to purchase rice, sugar, noodles and eggs. The other bank members, Edelmira, Sonia and Luz Marina are teachers. Albino and Nayda also work selling grocery items and Angela sells vegetables.

Two other members, Milton and Inocencia, work selling bakery goods which they prepare themselves from a shop they rent. They lived in adobe houses close to the Vilcanota river. Due to the torrential rains which have been falling over the city of Cusco, the Vilcanota river overflowed its banks, destroying homes like Milton and Inocencia had. They lost all of their possessions, but they continue in their work asiD. from the tremendous difficulties. Other members are worried because sales have decreased in the wake of the rain which fell for three days in Cusco. These members worked directly with tourists, and tourism has fallen considerably.

The members all appreciate the opportunities that the communal bank provides for them, and they have committed to comply with their respective payments on time.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The money from this loan will be distributed to various members of the communal bank.  Some members have small grocery stores, some teach, and some work with tourists.  All have suffered from the recent torrential rain in Cusco, Peru.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en:
Ejiro O. sells colorful sarongs and jewelry in her stall and also designs clothes for her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business.

Ejiro is married with three children, her eldest child being 15 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. She is 38 years old and her husband is a builder and he also supports their home.

With the profit she makes from her business Ejiro supports her family. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 39-year-old lady married to a builder and together they have six children. They both contribute to the family welfare; each one helps out the other in keeping their family of seven afloat.

Margret operates a clothing shop in Hoima, Uganda, and is also a tailor. She has been in the business for seventeen years now and wants her business to grow to bigger heights so that she becomes a big supplier of clothing material. She also farms to complement her business for sustainability.

Margret wishes to buy school uniform clothing materials to sell using the loan funds from HOFOKAM.

loans.use: To buy school uniform clothing materials

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda P. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Hilda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hilda owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as some food for snacks, noodles, eggs, shampoo, candies, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Hilda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Hilda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive con uno de los 6 hijos que tiene con su esposa Esther, de 49 años. A sus 62 años, él asegura que no termina de plantearse más objetivos que lo satisfagan. 

Su espíritu emprendedor a diario le hace vencer las adversidades, pues no le atemorizan las plagas ni las inclemencias del tiempo, ya que está acostumbrado a lidiar con ellos desde hace 40 años. Se dedica a la plantación de café, plátano, palta y piña, con la ayuda de su hijo y su esposa, esta última es quien siempre lo acompaña en las épocas de cosecha dejando sus quehaceres cotidianos del hogar.
A Juan le gusta cosechar porque ve el fruto de su esfuerzo, el cual le brindará las ganancias económicas necesarias para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Como su actividad es rentable, para el futuro quiere renovar sus plantaciones de café, las cuales crecerán a aproximadamente en 3 años.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y refiere que le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque es una persona recta que y lucha por la unión de sus compañeros. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita pagará el jornal de los operarios que contratará para que le ayuden a cosechar su producción de café.
texts.en:
Juan is married to Esther, age 49, and lives with one of his six children. At 62 years of age, he says has succeeded with most of the objectives he has set out to accomplish.

His enterprising spirit allows him to overcome adversity each day because he is not easily intimidated by pests or inclement weather since he has been dealing with these factors for 40 years. Juan grows coffee, bananas, avocados, and pineapples with the help of his son and his wife. During the harvest season, Juan’s wife sets aside her daily household chores so that she can be by his side. Juan enjoys harvesting because he is able to see the fruits of his labor and generate the necessary income to maintain his household. Since his business is profitable, he wants to renew his coffee crops since they take approximately three years to mature.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Juan enjoys being part of his Communal Bank because is a direct person who strives to bring his fellow group members together. With his loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, Juan will pay the workers who have been hired to help harvest coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the workers who help harvest his coffee crop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 37 years old, married, and has four school-age children. Janet owns a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops in which she primarily plants and harvests rice for sale. She hopes for her farm to expand in the future.

Janet joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Janet is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Janet from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees and provide for the increasing needs in her household.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Edgardo A. J., tiene la edad de 30 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo de 5 años que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Edgardo tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Edgardo A. J. is 30 years old and in a common law marriage. He has a five year old son, who is his greatest priority. He wants the loan to buy some calves and for their feed. He wants to take care of the livestock adequately in order to get the greatest income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has. He wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Edgardo has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Orocarita

texts.en:
Orocarita C. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Orocarita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from  buying and selling personal products and some ready to wear items in the local community. Orocarita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Orocarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Orocarita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mrs. El M., age 40, is a married woman and a good house wife. She takes care of two young children who go to school every day. The family is contributed to by El M.’s husband, who works as a civil servant officer in the ministry of interior. Also, he operates his own small business which buys and sells wooden furniture. Recently, there are many customers who order his furniture but he can’t satisfy the needs of his customers due to a lack of funds. So, El M. has decided to request a loan of $1,000 for her husband to purchase wooden furniture to resell to raise a profit.

loans.use: To purchase wooden furniture to resell.

loans.name: Alice Atieno

texts.en:
Alice Atieno O. has a strong desire to be self-reliant economically. That is why, after pursuing her training in tailoring, she decided to establish a tailoring business in the year 1998 in Nyamasaria where she is also a resident, to get income to realize her dream of economic dependency. She often purchases her stock once a month at Kibuye market in Kisumu. 

As an entrepreneur, she has been very innovative and for this reason, she has been able to realize an influx of customers. She needs a large amount of stock to be able to meet their demands. Since she lacks enough capital to improve her business, she applied for a loan grant worth 15,000 from K-MET micro finance, which will be used to increase stock.
