She believes that with the loan she will be able to earn enough income to help her achieve her life objective of economic stability. She is 34 years old, married and a mother of four children.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: El Sueño Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama El Sueño. Esta ubicado en Tlayecac, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. El grupo esta conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su 1er. Préstamo con Fundacion Realidad.
La integrante del grupo la señora Araceli E. C. tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria obtuvo su certificado. Ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos varones Eduardo tiene 8 años de edad y esta estudiando la primaria, Alexander tiene 2 años. La señora Araceli va a iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa y necesita su préstamo para comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc. para surtirse de mercancía, va a trasladarse la ciudad de Cuernavaca a surtirse de su mercancía. Ella quiere repillar su casa y ponerle la puerta por que ya se cambiaron a vivir a su casa pero no esta terminada, y decidió iniciar con el negocio para ayudar en los gastos y terminar de  repillar y poner la puerta de su casa para que se  vea bonita y este mas segura con sus niños. Sus sueños son trabajar para crecer en el negocio de la venta de ropa para obtener ganancias e invertirlas en su casa. El negocio esta en su casa en Tlayecac y enfrenta la competencia de varias personas que venden los mismos productos. Ella esta muy emocionado pon el préstamo que le proporcionan porque va a poder superarse, trabajar para crecer en su negocio y espera que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que terminen sus estudios.
Las integrantes del grupo son la señora Araceli E. C. y va a comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc. para hincar su negocio, la señora Lulu Rodríguez Gutiérrez va a comprar blusas, faldas, pantalones para dama para surtir su negocio, la señora Mitzi Yuridia B. Rodríguez va a comprar perfumes y  cosméticos por mayoreo para vender, la señora virginia C. B. va a comprar Huaraches de dama para surtir su negocio, la señora Yeimi García V. va a Comprar donas y diademas para el cabello, pulseras y collares para surtir su negocio.
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad: “Gracias por apoyarnos con el préstamo, con ese dinero vamos a salir adelante nuestros negocios y nuestras familias”
texts.en:
This solidarity group called “El Sueño” (The Dream) is from Tlayecac, Ayala, in the State of Morelos in México. The group consists of five members who know one another since they are neighbors. This is their first loan with Fundación Realidad.

One of the group members is Sra. Araceli E. C.. She is 33 years old and was able to achieve her high school diploma. Araceli is married and has two sons: Eduardo who is 8 years old and attending elementary school, and Alexander who is 2 years old. She plans to start a business selling clothing, so she needs a loan to buy blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts, and other items so that she can be stocked with merchandise. Araceli will travel to the city of Cuernavaca to obtain her inventory. She wants to whitewash her house and install a door since her family just moved into their house, but the work is still not finished. The reason for starting this business is to help with the expenses and to complete the work on her house so that it will be beautiful and be more secure for her children. Her dreams include growing her clothing business, earning more income, and investing in her home. She operates her business out of her house in Tlayecac and has competition from different merchants who sell the same products. Araceli is excited about her loan because it will provide her the opportunity to get ahead and grow her business. In addition, she hopes that her children will continue with their studies and complete their education.

The members of the group are as follows: • Araceli E. C. is starting her business and will sell blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts, and other items. • Sra. Lulu Rodríguez Gutiérrez will restock her business with blouses, skirts, and women’s trousers to sell. • Sra. Mitzi Yuridia B. Rodríguez will buy perfumes and cosmetics from a wholesaler to sell. • Sra. Virginia C. B. will buy women’s sandals to restock her business. • Sra. Yeimi García V. will buy hairclips, tiaras, bracelets, and necklaces to restock her business.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for supporting us with this loan. The money will help us move forward in our businesses and with our families.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, trousers, shirts, skirts, and other items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old and is married with five children who are between 6 and 13 years old.

Esther sells drinks made from sorghum and she has been in this business for a long time. The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Esther needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum for making drinks to sell to her customers. If successful, Esther will keep expanding her business and create some other sources of income and more jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of sorghum for making drinks to sell

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline C. is a married woman with two sons, both of whom attend school. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, rent and clothing.

Everline has been operating her tailoring business for the last seven years. She sells her finished products in a shop and from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her other source of income is her husband’s salary. Her major challenges are local competition and seasonality.

Everline decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans and improve her business. With 40,000 KES she wants to purchase more cloth. She hopes to have her own shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Sansizbai

texts.en:
Sansizbai U. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian home/tent. Two of his children attend a local high school and one son operates a taxi business in the local community. His wife is currently unemployed. 

Sansizbai operates a grass and fodder trading business. In addition, Sansizbai works in construction during the summer months. He has been engaged in his grass and fodder trading business for the past 10 years and has built a stable and successful operation. He moves and buys grass in bulk from hay lands in Nogoonnuur sub-province during hay time to resell in the capital city of the province. 

Sansizbai says, " I want to have my own truck to transport my products." He needs more funds to transport his bulk grasses from hay lands to the capital city of the province and therefore he is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To transport his hay

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of flour, butter, sugar, yeast etc.

loans.name: Florence Yaa Komaa

texts.en:
Florence Yaa Komaa A. sells plastic bowls at Abura. She is married and has six dependents.  Her husband is a farmer. Florence has not received any formal education. She assists her husband in taking care of the family. The loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls to expand her business.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

Displayed in the picture are some of the plastic products she sells.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls to expand her business.

loans.name: Victoria Santiago's Group

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from Barangay Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Victoria is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Victoria is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Victoria operates a direct selling business in the local community, selling cosmetic products. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rebeca Delfina

texts.es:
Rebeca Delfina Z. L. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de carne, verduras y pollo desde hace tiempo. Ella inicio con este negocio para sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños y sobre vivir ante la crisis de empleo que hay.
Ella sueña con expandir su negocio y que crezca.
texts.en:
Rebeca Delfina Z. L. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling meat, vegetables and chicken for some time.  She started this business to get her two little ones ahead in life and to survive in the face of the jobs crisis.

She dreams of expanding her business and helping it grow.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables and chicken

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda E. is from the village of Bunawan, Iligan City. She is 45 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emmalinda raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and raising pigs for sale. She also makes and sells coco charcoal. Emmalinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Emmalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Emmalinda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be Emmalinda's sixth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Bunawan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Flor Angel

texts.es:
La señora Flor socia del banco comunal El Oriente, del distrito de Campo verde, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como chofer (transportista)y tiene 4 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo, comenzó su negocio de venta de comida para ayudar a su esposo con algunos gastos, por que el trabajo que tiene su esposo no genera muchos ingresos para su hogar.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 soles la señora comprará una parrilla, 1 saco de carbón, ½ saco de arroz, 3 litros de aceite, 1/2 kilo de ajinomoto, 2 litros de vinagre, 3 pollos y 5 kilos de chanco para los chicharrones, 1 racimo de plátano y demás demás condimentos.
La señora Flor agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos, sobre todo para las personas que quieran poner un pequeño negocio puedan acceder a un crédito sin muchos requisitos más que su DNI y sus ganas de trabajar.
texts.en: Flor is a member of El Oriente community bank in the district of Campo Verde, department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 44 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver and they have four children. With her initial loan, she started her business selling food so she could help her husband with some expenses since he doesn't make a lot of money with his job. With this new loan of 1,200 soles, Flor plans to purchase a grill, a sack of charcoal, a half-sack of rice, 3 liters of oil, a half-kilo of spices, 2 liters of vinegar, three chickens, one bunch of bananas, and other items. Flor is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the loans, and above all the people who helped her start her small business by granting the loan with nothing more than her ID and her desire to work.

loans.use: Purchase a grill, a bag of charcoal, a half-sack of rice, 3 liters of oil, half-kilo of spices, 2 liters of vinegar, one bunch of bananas, and other items

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fantobougou, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font de la restauration et le commerce des céréales et des produits de cueillettes.
Ces femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé les onze précédents.
MAMOU T. du groupe Djekafo compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des grains de Dah et du Néré. 
Il faut noter que les grains de Dah et Néré sont artisanalement transformés en produits alimentaires entrant dans la préparation de plusieurs  sauces en l’Afrique de l’ouest.
Elle s’approvisionne avec les femmes aux environnants. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en: The women of the group Djekafo are all married and average 47 years of age and four children living in traditional extended families in the village of Fantobougou, in Fana sub-prefecture, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship. They work in food service, and they do commerce in grains and in gathered items. The group members are now on their 12th solidarity loan after having properly repaid their 11 previous ones.   Ms. MAMOU T., a member of the solidarity group, intends to use her loan to buy some dah and néré seeds.  It should be noted that these seeds are processed by hand into artisanal food products used as ingredients in making several sauces in West Africa. She gets her supplies from women in the area. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base compose of women and men, she makes her sales locally and at the Fana market.   She plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for meeting day-to-day family expenses.  The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Buying seeds (dah and néré)

loans.name: Verónica Inés

texts.es: Verónica Inés A. D. U. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a dos hijos menores D. edad. Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora, quien ha tenido que ser padre y madre para poder sacar adelante a su familia, debido a que ella es madre soltera. Verónica posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, así mismo se dedica a la elaboración D. platillos típicos salvadoreños entre los cuales se encuentra: atol D. elote, yuca frita, papas fritas, elotes asados y otros más. Los platillos típicos los comercializa D. forma ambulante cerca D. uno del monumento más simbólico D. la capital D. El Salvador, el cual es llamado “Salvador del Mundo”. Con todo el deseo D. salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor, Verónica solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su tienda y así mismo elaborar mayor cantidad D. platillos.
texts.en:
Veronica Ines A. D. Umana is 37 years old and she lives in the department of San Salvador.  She lives together with her two young children. Veronica is a very hard working person who has had to be both father and mother to support her family because she is a single mother. 

Veronica has a store from where she sells perishable goods and basic needs products. She also makes traditional Salvadoran foods, among which are: corn drinks, fried yucca, fried potatoes, roasted corn on the cob, and others. She sells these traditional foods itinerantly near one of the new symbolic monuments in the capital city of El Salvador, named "Salvador del Mundo", meaning the Savior of the World. With all her will to come out a head and to have a better life,  Veronica requests a loan to supply her store with inventory and to make larger quantities of  prepared foods.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Uulkan's Group

texts.en:
Uulkan E. K., 20, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village near Osh, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is divorced. 

In order to earn money, she breeds livestock. She began two years ago with an initial investment of 4,000 KGS. Her father helps her with that activity. She now earns 3,200 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan she wants to increase the number of livestock. In the future she dreams of purchasing a house and improving her living conditions.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El sr. Jaime, vive en la localidad de Sacaba cerca del coliseo de sacaba, es casado tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, El Sr. Jaime es peluquero la actividad que realiza es de hace 15 años, por lo que es muy conocido en su zona el préstamo lo invertirá para compra de material de trabajo como maquinas eléctricas para su peluquería, Su negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico y céntrico de la localidad de sacaba, tiene ya muchos cliente por el buen trabajo que realiza, es muy trabajador y siempre se actualiza en los cortes ya que muchos jovencitos le piden cortes modernos, el Sr. Jaime esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime lives in the town of Sacaba near the coliseum.  He is married and has two school-aged children. He runs a barber shop which he has had for 15 years and is very well-known in the area.  He plans to use the loan to buy work supplies, such as electric equipment, for his shop.

His business is located in a strategic, focal point of the town.  He has many customers because of his good service.  He is very hard-working and stays abreast of all the latest fashion since many young men ask for the latest haircuts.  

Mr. Jaime is very grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy electric equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Khot

texts.en:
Khot S. is a 39-year-old woman who lives with other family members in Siem Reap Province. She feeds a few pigs and chickens to earn a living. Her husband is a rice farmer, who earns a profit of approximately $5 each day to support his family. They have four children; three are single and one is married. 

Presently, one of her kids is a fish seller and is using a bicycle as a vehicle. It is very hard for her child to sell this way. To encourage her child, Khot S. is taking her loan to buy a motorbike to pick up fish to sell.

Khot S. and her cute child are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to pick up fish to sell

loans.name: Jugie

texts.en:
Jugie is a married woman who lives in the island of Cebu. She earns her living by selling fruits and vegetables and operating a pig fattening business. Her husband Joel, who is 32 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 1 and 7 years old.

Jugie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jugie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to purchase fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of the family. Jugie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Olga Azucena

texts.es: Olga tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos menores de 06 y 03 años. Vive en casa de su madre en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de dos años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como maquillaje y perfumes por catalogo. Su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Olga ha solicitado un crédito para ayudar con los gastos escolares de su hijo menor. Este préstamo permitirá que Olga trabaje tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento tanto comercial como familiar. Olga cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Es muy trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Olga is 31 years old and a single mother of two young children, ages 6 and 3. She lives at home with her mother in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. For more than two years, Olga has been selling beauty products such as make-up and perfumes through a catalog. Her business is located in her home. She is well-known in her area and has an established customer base.

Olga is requesting a loan to help pay for the school expenses of her young son. This loan will allow her to work peacefully without having to resort to informal lenders who charge very high interest rates that would impact her daily liquidity and slow the growth of both her business and her family.

Olga has good personal and work-related references. She is hardworking and responsible. Her greatest wish is to provide her two children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school expenses.

loans.name: Samuel Ngigi

texts.en:
Samuel has been practising dairy farming in Njabini town for the last 15 years.  He is 38 years old, married to Hannah Wanjiru, and they have four children.  

Samuel  was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his 2nd loan.  He had repaid his previous loan of Kshs 45,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this new loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Samuel hopes to become a leading dairy farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 42 years old. She has six children who are between the ages of 2 months and 20 years. She owns a shop in which she sells sugar, rice, coffee and some scholastic materials. She has done this business for 10 years and this business has enabled her meet her needs and the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Kry

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Kry.  She is 41 years old and is a humble mother who has three children who attend school. Since 2000, she has been cultivating rice on the farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband also works with her on the farm.  In addition to the current farming work, Mrs. Kry’s husband also raises and sells animals.  He buys them from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the animal  sales business is the most important source of income for her family, Mrs. Kry requested a loan for her husband to buy an extra cow to raise and sell.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is an illiterate 58-year-old mother who wanted to build a small project for her sons to do after their full time work. One of them is a baker and the other is in the military.

Fatmeh bought a few birds and pigeons and started a hatching business on their house roof. Ever day either Fatmeh or one her sons feeds and checks on their birds. Their business has been running for a while now and they have had sold a good numbers of birds.

Now Fatmeh is applying for a loan to build a proper house on the roof for the birds and to provide a good environment for the eggs to hatch. Since she is a conservative person, she preferred that her son Wa'ed be in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To build a proper house for her poultry

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil, age 48, is a tailor. He has worked in tailoring for 27 years and opened his own business in 1997. He is a hard worker, and his considerable experience gives him a special position in his domain: in addition to offering his services to local neighbors, friends, and relatives, he has customers who come to him from several neighboring villages as well. Khalil lives with his wife and five children in Tyre.
 
Khalil is has been with Kiva partner Al Majmoua for seven consecutive lending cycles. All his previous loans have had a positive impact on his social and financial situation, and he is a borrower in good standing. He works hard on improving both his business and his family's situation, and he gives special attention and care to his customers, whom he values highly as his main source of living.

Khalil is requesting this loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary textiles for his business. He will also use part of it to help his son to continue building his family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary textiles for his business and to help his son to continue building his family house.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Beatriz has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy detergents, noodles & snacks.

Beatriz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Beatriz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, noodles & snacks.

loans.name: Topchugul's Group

texts.en:
Topchugul is a member of this group. She is 51 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she is bringing up two sons and a daughter. The older son went to work in Russia, the daughter studies at school and the second son is preschool age (younger than 7). 

Two years ago, with an initial investment of 3,000 soms, Topchugul started to sell cookies and stationery near the school. In this way she earns about 3,000 soms per month. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to rent a container for selling her wares. Topchugul wants to start selling school uniforms at the market. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to rent a container for selling her wares

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother of four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business selling household commodities. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to start a constructions supplies business, purchase construction supplies of cement and sand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies of cement and sand.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.en:
Kurbonali is a hardworking and active farmer. He is married and the father of two children. He is engaged in animal husbandry and he has been running his business for eight years. Kurbonali keeps his cattle near his house and at any time he can visit his cattle. 

Kurbonali would like to increase the number of his cattle and make a good profit. With the loan he plans to buy cattle and feed for his cattle. With this aim he has requested a loan of 800 USD. He hopes that the lenders will help him and allow him to expand his business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed.

loans.name: St Yowanina Group

texts.en:
Neverless is a 50-year-old single mother with four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been operating a retail shop for 16 years. She started her shop with capital of 100,000 UGX, and now she has 1,000,000 UGX as her working capital. 

Her hardship is debtors who take too long to pay. Her vision is to run a wholesale business and to educate her children.

Neverless needs the money to buy sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and soap to resell.

loans.name: Harold Fermín

texts.es: Harold Fermín tiene 64 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más 8 años que tiene este medio de ingreso. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar productos como granos básicos, detergentes, pan, gaseosa, jugos, papel higiénico y otros productos. El financiamiento puede ayudar a aumentar su inventario y además proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que necesitan. Su sueño es convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Harold Fermín is 64 years old; his business is a general store.  He has had this means of income for more than eight years.  The majority of his customers come looking for products like bulk grains, detergents, bread, soda, juice, toilet paper and other products.

The loan can help him to grow his inventory and also provide his clients with what they need.

His dream is to convert his general store into a distributorship.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, detergent, bread, soda, juice, toilet paper and other products.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda, se dedica a la producción de leche y su esposo es constructor albañil y sus hijos la ayudan con labores agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  dos vacas lecheras para  así poder aumentar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz. Hilda  es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en:
Hilda devotes herself to milk production, and her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Their children help with the farm work.

The loan that she needs is to buy two dairy cows.  That way she will be able to increase milk production and improve her income.  

She lives in her own house in Achacachi in the La Paz department.  Hilda is married and has two children.

This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of milk production that will be sold later.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 33-year-old young woman (she is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead). She is married and has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver making a low income; it is the only source of income the family has. Samar wants to help her husband with painting and licensing expenses for the taxi by taking out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Samar gets the loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to share with her husband in paying for painting and licensing the taxi. This will make the taxi more efficient and her husband will work extra hours to get better income and provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to pay for painting and licensing the taxi.

loans.name: Nissondiya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Nissondiya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent dans le camp militaire de Banankoroni Village dans la région de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes wax, de poissons frais et fumés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Connue dans le camp et dans le village  de Banankoro pour sa vente de pagnes wax surtout pendant les périodes de mariage, Madame Odile (2ème position des femmes de la droite vers la gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant dans le village et dans le camp militaire à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Odile espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour l’entretien et des frais scolaires des enfants. Madame Odile a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The five women who belong to the Nissondiya group are married and most of them live in polygamous families. Their average age is 32 and they each have, on average, three children. They live in the military camp at Banankoroni Village, in Ségou region. They know each other through links of physical proximity and kinship. The members of this group run small businesses selling wax pagnes, fresh fish and smoked fish. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the members of the group have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their second group loan. Odile (second from the right) is known in the camp and in the village of Banankoro for her sales of wax 'pagnes', above all during wedding periods. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 lengths of wax pagnes in the main market in Bamako. She makes her retail sales for cash and on credit. She makes her sales at home and as a street vendor in the village and in the military camp. Her customers are mainly women. Odile hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs which she will use to support her children and pay their school fees. Odile's goal is to keep her business running long term through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en: Emmah is aged 25 and single. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. For the last two years, she has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. She also does poultry farming for more income.  She has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more chickens for raising.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with seven school going children.  Her husband is a teacher who helps cover the cost of basic family needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for their family and school fees for their children.

Mupa has operated a grocery for the past eight years.  She also runs a motorbike transportation business.  Her clients are local villagers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality; in the rainy season there are low sales due to good harvests so people do not purchase groceries.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase vegetables and other groceries for her business.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and other groceries for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has operated her grocery shop in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. She is 25 years old, and she and her husband Martin have two children attending school. Besides her primary activity of operating the grocery shop, she also sells popcorn for additional income.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fish to sell in the Naivasha markets and hotels, as well as buy more goods to sell in her grocery shop.

In the future, Grace hopes to boost her fish supplies and extend her sales to other markets in Nairobi. She also hopes to expand her grocery shop to wholesale and distribute cereals to all parts of Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a 46-year-old woman, she is married and has one son and three daughters.  Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Ibtesam wants to improve her home by purchasing new necessary home furniture such as bedroom furniture for her children, living room seats, and a kitchen table but she doesn't have enough money to pay for these so she needs to borrow a loan from FATEN.  When Ibtesam gets the loan, she will purchase new home furniture and be able to offer her family better and more comfortable living conditions.  Ibtesam is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed here instead of her in the picture.



About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture to improve her home.

loans.name: Altyn

texts.ru: Алтын 41 год, замужем и имеет пятерых детей, младшей из которых десять лет. В 1996 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Алтын начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и полеводстве. В качестве старта была закуплена одна корова и благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Алтын насчитывается две коровы, одни теленок, двадцать пять баранов, и одна рабочая лошадь. Также Алтын возделывает на собственном земельном наделе картофель и фасоль. В сезон, Алтын вместе с мужем переезжает на пастбище, где они работают в качестве пастухов, выводя на выпас скот местного населения. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтын обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2-х телят и 14 баранов . В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Алтын планирует сделать хороший ремонт своего дома и провести паровое отопление в доме.
texts.en: Altyn is 41 years old, married and a mother of five children, the youngest of whom is 10 years old. As a means of supporting her family, Altyn started a farming and cattle raising business in 1996. She started with one cow and because of Altyn's hard work and savvy business skills she now has two cows, a calf, twenty five sheep and a horse. Altyn also grows potatoes and beans on her own plot of land. During the summer season Altyn moves with her husband out to pastures where both of them work as shepherds for the herds of their neighbors. In order to grow her own farming business Altyn has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS). She is planning to buy two more calves and fourteen sheep with this money. In the future Altyn is planning to using the profits from the loan to repair her family's home and install a steam heating system.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la señora María, quien por medio de la venta de cosméticos logra tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Nos comenta que tiene buena venta debido a la variedad que siempre tiene, sumado a eso el buen precio y la amabilidad con que ella atiende a sus clientes. Desea poder seguir creciendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Desea comprar maquillajes de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad y de esa forma atraer a más clientas. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Nineteen women in the Ciudad del Este have united with the purpose of working together and through this work getting ahead and helping one another. They are hard working women and fighters, and are in the eighth cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Fundación Paraguayan (Paraguayan Foundation).

One of the members is María, who by selling cosmetics succeeds by having the financial means necessary in order to be able to help her family. She comments to us that she has good sales because of the variety she always has, in addition to the good price and the friendliness with which she assists her customers. She wants to be able to continue growing her business, and this is why she is asking for a loan.

She wants to buy all types of makeup, with which she could have more variety and therefore attract more clients. She thanks the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Sheekha

texts.en:
Sheekha is a 67-year-old widow from Madaba, Jordan, and a mother of seven children. 

Sheekha produces dairy products such as cheese and yogurt, and she is requesting a loan of 800 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase milk for their production. 

Sheekha's home-based business is considered as one of the biggest home-based projects in the area she lives in and she is looking to use some land she has to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk for producing dairy products

loans.name: Alodo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALODO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Alphonsine (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Alphonsine  est mariée a un menuisier du nom de Martin. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Alphonsine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Alphonsine vend des savons, des allumettes, des conserves et des pâtes alimentaires depuis vingt ans à son domicile. Alphonsine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Alphonsine ensemble avec les membres du groupe ALODO sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont étés bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des savons, des allumettes, des conserves et des pâtes alimentaires.

loans.name: Lucia Eladia

texts.es: Lucía es una mujer de 55 años que vive junto a su esposo en la localidad rural de Segundia, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; además de ello, tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa orgánica para la alimentación de su ganado vacuno orgánico. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para comprar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa orgánica para alimentar a su ganado vacuno orgánico

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud smallholder woman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kakwet, Nandihills, which is in the North rift region of Kenya. Joan is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. 

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps dairy cows. Joan has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states "I have to do something for my three children." 

Joan joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Joan is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Joan to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

For smallholder women in Nandihills, accessing a financial solution is tough, but Joan feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women. The benefits of this loan are many and one of them is that Joan will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase. 

Joan intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Joan will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future. You can help Joan with the loan she needs and get her closer to accomplishing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Great Provider Enterprise is managed by Madam Theresa A., a very hardworking lady. She purchases food items mainly maize and yam from Techiman for resale in Takoradi. She is seeking  a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to grow her business. She is willing to work harder than she is doing now and very capable of paying back the loan.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and a mother of 2 children. She had no education at all. She therefore supports her husband in catering for the family needs with her "kenkey" business. She has been in the business for the past 3 years and has a fairly good client base.

Her major issue is the sourcing of maize which is the major component of her "kenkey" operations. Having gone through the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION, she wants to access the KIVA loan to buy the maize up-front and do away with the credit regime she operates with now.

loans.use: Workig Capital

loans.name: Mariana Lizeth

texts.en:
Mariana is 20 years old, married and is the mother of a beautiful 2-year-old girl. Her husband works in cell phones sales. Mariana and her husband are saving to buy a home, which is difficult on her husband's low income. In looking for new ways to obtain extra income, Mariana decided to begin selling cosmetics a year ago to help her husband with the household expenses. Fortunately she has gained many clients.

In order to increase the variety of products that she offers, Mariana asks for a loan of $250 dollars that she will use in the purchase of merchandise that clients have already solicited. She is committed to return this amount in 3 to 6 months. Be an important part of this business’s growth and help this young family to make it through. They sincerely thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariana tiene 20 años de edad, es casada y madre de una preciosa niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares, pero recibe un salario muy bajo, además están ahorrando para poder adquirir una casa, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra Mariana decidió empezar con la venta de cosméticos desde hace un año para ayudar de esta manera a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, afortunadamente ha logrado tener muchos clientes.

Para poder incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, Mariana solicita un préstamo de $250 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía que ya le ha sido solicitada por sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta joven familia a salir adelante, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use:
Purchase of Merchandise
Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Malika is a single mother. She is raising a daughter. Malica, 46 has high school education. Malica sells women’s shoes. Her daughter sells in a small store at the central market, while Malica travels to sell on the markets nearby. Two years ago, when Malica received her first loan to expand her business, she did not own the store. Gradually growing the business, Malica opened the small store. Today, Malica continues to collaborate with MicroInvest. She asks for another loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Малика незамужем и воспитывает дочь. Ей 46 лет, образование среднее. Занимается Малика продажей женской обуви. На центральном рынке у Малики есть маленький магазин, где торгует ее дочь, а она сама ездит торговать по окрестным рынкам. 2 года назад она получила свой первый займ для расширения бизнеса. Тогда у нее еще не было магазина. Постепенно расширяя свой бизнес Малика смогла открыть магазин. Малика и сейчас активно сотрудничает с Микроинвест и просит займ для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah is a 30 year old mother of 2 children. She sells clothes on credit and is a member of MBK. With her business, she can now make her own money without depending on her husband's help anymore.  Her husband, Selamet, is an informal labourer. His income is only enough to pay electricity and cover their family's daily needs. She usually earns $5/day and she expects to use the $50 loan to buy more other goods such as electrical goods. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy some goods

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 46, is married with five children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Caucasus region in Azerbaijan. Shamil owns a herd of milk cows. Every day he sells milk to the local milk processing shop. His children help him breed cows in the nearby grazing area.

The income from four cows is too low to support the family, and four cows are not enough to increase the number of cows. That’s why Shamil has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a loan of $500 to buy one more purebred cow to make his monthly income higher. The price of a milk calf is $300, and the cost of breeding is $100. The other $100 he plans to save for unexpected expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Vailet

texts.en:
In 2002 Vailet M. opened a small shop selling basic groceries. Five years later, having wisely invested and repaid two loans from SELFINA, Vailet has expanded the business so that it now generates a monthly profit of around $550, which is a considerable amount in Tanzania. Vailet now wants to expand her business further, by increasing the quantity and range of her stock and buying in bulk. She is married to husband Patson and has five children between the ages of 5 and 18 years.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Mais

texts.ru:
Mais P. was born in 1953. He has a wife and 3 children. He has been raising cattle for over 10 years now. Mais loves his business. He works from dawn to dusk. To have a profitable business Mais needs to buy more cows. This is why he came to the microcredit agency Normicro for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Поладов Маис 1953 года рождения. Семейный, имеет троих детей. Более десяти лет занимается скотоводством . Дядя Маис любить свой бизнес. Он с утра до ночи работает. Чтобы имет хорошую прибыль ему надо купить еще несколько коров.По этому он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. has been a seamstress for 3 years. She is married to a taxi driver and has one child.

She is requesting $525 to buy clothing materials to produce dresses and other clothes for sale. She hopes the loan will produce extra income to support her family.

Agnes is also a member of a lending group called “Kyere Nyame Association”, which consists of 11 entrepreneurs in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials to produce dresses and other clothes for sale.

loans.name: Wanyama West B (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Ruth is 30 years old and is divorced. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her family's needs. Ruth has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Samuel N. and Francis N.. Samuel N. has a business running a grocery shop and wants to open up a small retail shop. Francis N. is currently operating a business selling water and tailoring and wants a loan to purchase more fabric.

loans.use: To add more capital to charcoal business

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun K. and his wife have been married since 2006. They have one daughter and live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Bunthoeun has been earning income driving a motor-taxi trailer for the last six years. He carries people and goods from the village to Phnom Penh and back. His wife stays at home and takes care of the children.

Mr. Bunthoeun is now asking for a loan of US$900 to purchase a new motor-taxi trailer to replace the old one.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motor-taxi trailer

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.en:
T. Saidjon has been raising livestock for 5 years. He learned the necessary skills from by watching his father care for their livestock during his earliest years. He has a good flock, including a pedigree bull and a milk cow. Mr. T. Saidjon raises and sells livestock, and also he works on the collective farm. Mr. T. Saidjon has a good reputation.

Mr. T. Saidjon is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 6 months to buy rams to expand his sheep business. He thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy rams to expand his sheep business

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: A. Khursheda has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005. She is married and has 3 children. She lives in Khujand and is engaged in trade. She has traded furniture, towels, and underwear in the local bazaar for 12 years. Mrs. A. Khursheda has special business skills and she started the business many years ago from scratch. Now Mrs. A. Khursheda has applied to KIVA requesting a loan of 4100 STJ for 4 months to widen her assortment of merchandise and import new goods.

loans.use: Widen assortment and import new goods

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, a 56-year-old married man with five children, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Mohamed owns a sewing and ironing shop. He needs a loan of USD$700 to purchase a new sewing machine, which will allow him to expand his business and therefore guarantee a better livelihood for his family.

Mohamad has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years and he always repays his loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
For the past three years, María has woven artisanal bracelets. She provides weaving services to other people. In a week she does 100 bracelets. At the same time, María sells desserts outside of the house of her mother-in-law, one time per week. Finally, María rents out her garage and keeps 2 cars there every day. At the moment, she is enlarging her garage in order to keep two more cars. She has used her previous loans to enlarge her garage. María would like to be able to fix her garage to give it a door and a roof of strong material.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky and John Glassmire, Kiva Volunteers.

Desde hace 3 años, María teje pulseras artesanales. Ella hace servicios de tejido a otras personas. A la semana hace 100 pulseras. Igualmente, María vende postres afuera de la casa de sus suegra, una vez por semana. Por último, María alquila su cochera y guarda 2 autos todos los días. Actualmente, está ampliando su cochera para poder guardar 2 autos más. Los préstamos que ha utilizado le han servido para ampliar su cochera. A María le gustaría poder arreglar su cochera colocándole una puerta y techo de material resistente.

loans.use: To enlarge María's garage so she can rent out more car spaces

loans.name: Ronaldo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ronaldo E. , tiene la edad de 55 años, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , con su esposa Isabel Linarez, esta señora es ama de casa le ayuda con el negocio que lo tienen ubicado en su casa de habitación, ellos tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 tienen a su cargo que estudian su secundaria , este señor se dedica al comercio y la agricultura ya q trabaja 2 manzana de tierras para poder salir adelante con sus pequeños ya que quiere lo mejor para ellos . Don Rolando tiene una pulpería la cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado tenerla y él esta pasando por una circunstancia difícil ya que por causa de las lluvias se la han dañado sus cosas; por que el techo de la vivienda tiene muchos orificios por lo cual solicitó un préstamo para comprar zinc y reparar el techo de su vivienda
texts.en:
Mr. Ronaldo E. is 55-years old and lives in the borough of Medardo Andino in the town of Ticuantepe, with his wife Isabel Linarez. Isabel is a housewife that helps with the business that is run out of their home. They have four children of which two are in secondary school. Ronaldo does small trade and farm work and has two blocks of land that he works to get ahead and to provide for his little ones as he wants the best for them. Ronaldo has a grocery store that with great effort and sacrifice he has managed to keep operating through difficult times. Due to heavy rains that have caused damage, he has a lot of holes in his roof and is requesting a loan to buy zinc and repair the roof of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof of his house/business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 41 years old, and is a wife and the mother of two children. She sells charcoal, gari, groundnut, etc. in her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in most traditional Ghanaian homes. Victoria buys her supply of charcoal, bags of gari and groundnuts etc. from the villages and sells them to her customers. She has supported one of her children to the university level with income from her business. With the loan, she wants to buy more supplies of charcoal, gari and groundnuts to serve her customers. She hopes the loan will enable her to save more to support the other one to finish senior high school. She would be very grateful for that support. She belongs to the group called Be Serious Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support to one another to repay the loan. She is in a photograph during her group meeting.

loans.use: Victoria would like to buy more supplies of charcoal, gari, groundnut etc. to resell so she can provide schooling for her children.

loans.name: Chantra

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantra P. is a villager in Sdouv Kanleng village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Bou Vin, are fishermen to earn their living. They face some problems with their business because they do not have much money to buy equipment for their fishing.

Mrs. Chantra P. has decided to request a loan to buy a boat and fishnets for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 39 years old and she does not have any children yet. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishnets

loans.name: Sipriana

texts.es: Sipriana tiene 40 años, vive sola ya que es soltera. Se dedica a vender fruta en las diferentes islas flotantes de los Uros, en su pequeño bote, con el cual va de isla en isla vendiendo sus productos. Esta labor la realiza desde hace un año atrás, Sipriana ha ido incursionando en diferentes negocios para ganarse la vida,  trabajando desde muy temprana edad y no pudiendo concluir sus estudios secundarios. Le va bien en la venta, es por eso que quiere aumentar la cantidad de fruta que vende y así lograr mejores ingresos, es por eso que recurre a nosotros para lograr esta tan ansiada meta. Es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado incrementará la cantidad de fruta  que vende para ofrecer a los habitantes de las islas flotantes de los Uros.
texts.en:
Sipriana is 40 years old, is single, and lives alone. She sells fruits on the different floating islands of Los Uros from her small boat, with which she goes from island to island selling her products. She began this work a year ago. Sipriana has endeavored in different businesses to earn a living, working from a very early age without being able to finish her high school education. Her sales are going well, so she wants to increase the quantity of fruit that she sells and increase her income. For this she returns to us to accomplish this very pressing goal. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will increase the quantity of fruit that she sells in order to provide more products to the islanders.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of fruit she sells

loans.name: Mrs. Beun Chhum  Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of thirteen members and is located in Phum Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Beun C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. PH. Sony, is a government officer who does not make enough salary to support the family. Even though they have two careers, they still do not earn enough income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Beun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase income and provide a better life for her family. She is 54 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a security guard while the others two are farmers who help the mother farm and the remaining are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y un años, Olinda ha trabajado mucho en toda su vida y aun dice que tiene mucho por hacer a pesar de no encontrarse bien físicamente. Como madre soltera ella se ha dedicado desde joven a la crianza y manutención de sus cinco hijos.

En un inicio ella trabajo para el estado como cocinera y por las noches vendía lo que podía preparar en la puerta de su casa. Así fue como pudo darles educación a sus hijos. Después de muchos años, con el paso del tiempo y con sus hijos mas grandes se animó a ser comerciante en un mercado, donde se dedico mas de dos años a vender abarrotes. Con la ayuda de su hijo pudo administrar bien este negocio y creció rápidamente. No obstante, sus hijos crecieron y formaron también sus familias por lo que ya no pudo encargarse de este trabajo.

Por el contrario, una de sus hijas que vive en Italia la animo a tejer chompas para poder venderlas en el país donde ella se encuentra. Es así que por ahora se dedica a tejer chompas en invierno y polos en verano para venderlos en el extranjero con la ayuda de su hija.

Como no le va nada mal, dentro de poco quisiera abrir un taller de tejido en su casa para poder vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
At 71 years of age, Olinda has worked hard throughout her life and still says that she has much to accomplish, despite her declining health. As a single mother, Olinda raised and cared for her 5 children. At one time she worked for the government as a cook during the day, and at night sold what food she could cook from her doorstep. With such hard work Olinda was able to send her children to school. After many years, with the passing of time and now that her children are grown, Olinda would like to be a businesswoman in a market, where she sold groceries for over two years. With the held of her son she was able to manage her business well and it grew rapidly. Nevertheless, her children grew up and and formed her own families and could no longer help their mother with the business. On the other hand, one of Olinda's daughters who lives in Italy has sold her mother's sweaters for her in Italian markets. Because of this, for now Olinda will continue to knit sweaters to sell in Italy as it is winter time, and knit polos to sell during the summer. As things are going well, soon Olinda would like to open a knitting work shop in her house so that she can produce clothing in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make sweaters

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is a rice grower. She has 4 children who are still studying. Now that she is 41 and her children need more assistance from her in their studies, she can't avoid worrying about where to get the money to pay all their tuition fees and for school projects. Her husband, Raul M., is helping her sustain their business. Farming is their only source of income, which they inherited from their parents. Together, they work hard to run their farm.

Elvira is asking a CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner) for a loan of Php 5,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. Specifically, the loan will be used to buy sniper chemicals to improve the yield of her rice crops. She is also looking into some other possible income areas to support her family well.

CEVI is a field partner of KIVA in the Philippines. It provides all its client like Elvira not just credit assistance, but also trainings in their business and insurance coverage to help them grow their businesses more.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora K. is 45 years old. She is still working diligently to help her husband who currently works in Russia. She has worked in the agricultural business of farming and also buying and selling cattle for 7 years. She uses the profits to cover the family expenses and her children’s education fees. Gulnora has three children. The loan from IMON International will be used to purchase mineral fertilizer for growing onions, which she is planning. She hopes that the business goes well and her family will have a better quality of life.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Tuuipo

texts.en:
Tuuipo L., 35, is married with seven children. She has four years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village people and to the public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala.

SPBD loans are Tuuipo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase timber and cement for home improvement and the rest will be saved for the business.

loans.use: To buy timber and cement for home improvement

loans.name: Mile

texts.en: Mile L., 38, is married with five children. She has two years of experience in the Pancake business. She sells to the village people and the general public five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala. SPBD loans are Mile’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, oil, frying pan, gas oven, plastic storage containers.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
Simeona es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Simeona es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Simeona viaja a las ferias de donde compra queso, cereales, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Simeona vende leña en su casa.
Simeona necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Simeona sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Simeona is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris". She is married, 39 years old and has 2 children. Simeona travels to the fairs where she buys cheese and cereals, products she sells on the markets of the town of Ayacucho. She also sells firewood at her house. Simeona needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of firewood. It is Simeona's dream that her children become professionals and that she will finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Ida Martina

texts.es:
La señora Ida Martina R. Huamán, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 316, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Es conviviente, tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de 02 niños que depende de ella.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró productos de belleza de las marcas Ebel y Unique para ofrecerlos a sus amistades.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, en un espacio que su mamá le ha proporcionado para la venta de sus productos en su domicilio.  También vende ropas y las coloca a sus amistades quien pagan en partes y al contado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará más ropa según los pedidos que le están haciendo sus amistades y así poder incrementar su capital que ya tiene formado.
Es una mujer independiente, manifiesta que apoya en los gastos de la familia con el negocio que ella tiene.
Agracede el apoyo que le viene brindando el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le permite crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Martina Romera H. is a member of the Community Bank "Las Triunfadoras de Catac". She lives in Av. 31 de Mayo Nunber 316, in the district of Catac of the province of Recuay in Ancash. She is common law married, she is 35 years old and she is mother of 2 children who still depend on her.

With the first loan of S/.300 she purchased beauty products of the Ebel and Unique brand to sell to her friends.

Currently she carries on with the same business in a space that her mother has remodelled to sell products from her home. She also sells clothing, supplying her friends who make cash and credit purchases from her. With this loan of S/1000 she will purchase more clothing to fill orders placed by her friends, so to increase her capital that she has been forming.
