She is an independent person and she supports the family expenses with her business. She is grateful for the support that has been given her by the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner), especially because it permits her to grow as a small business owner.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchas items of clothing.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es:
La señora Felisa vive en casa de su tía con su esposo e hijos en la Calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de ropa, ella viaja y compra en cantidad y acomoda al crédito a todas las señoras que venden en la feria de la ciudad de El Alto, también vende a personas particulares. Con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más mercadería y mantener su fuente de trabajo estable.

Felisa solicitó un préstamo a través de Kiva  en Abril de 2007 y pagó muy bien, por lo que  puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Felisa lives with her husband and children at her aunt's home on Manuel Jofre Street in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. Her business is to sell clothing. She travels and buys in large quantities and sells on credit to all the women that sell at the market in the city of El Alto. She also sells to other individuals. With this commercial activity, she sustains her family. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, to buy more merchandise, and to have a stable source of income. Felisa requested a loan through Kiva in April of 2007 and paid punctually, so she can acquire a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business and sell it

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk where he is originally from. He started his business about 8 years ago, after he quit working as a public van driver. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of four – his wife Lidiya and two daughters, 12 and 9 years old. Currently, his monthly income is about 7,000 Grivnas.

Bogdan works 16 hours a day to provide a decent living for his family. Right now he’s faced with a need to do some repair work on his vehicle. He is requesting a 15,000 UAH loan to fix his car engine. Bogdan has many challenges in his work. However, he doesn’t want to go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself. He is saving money for his children's college education.

loans.use: to fix his car engine

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha T. is from the town of Loman, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 53 years old. Juditha is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Juditha owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Juditha has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In February 2009, Juditha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juditha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Juditha is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Pring T. is a 39-year-old farmer. She is married with two children who both attend secondary public school. Her husband works in construction to help the family's finances. Pring T. wants her husband to set up in business as a taxi driver. She believes that such a business would be profitable and help her family meet its daily expenses. Therefore, Pring T. is requesting a loan of $300 USD to add to her savings in order to buy a trailer motorbike (Tuk Tuk) for her husband to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a trailer motorbike (Tuk Tuk)

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia’s priority in life is her family. She always wanted to give them a good future and this is the reason why she works diligently as a snack vendor. Aside from being a vegetable and snack vendor, Lilia is also a direct seller of Avon products, retails cell phone loads, and sells barbecue sticks in front of their house at night. She is really a jack of all trades.

Engaging in those businesses really needs a lot of effort but she does not get tired in providing the needs of her family, especially her children. To further improve her businesses, especially her vending where she earns higher income, Lilia is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders. She is hoping that through the loan, she can have a more stable business and have it grow.

Lilia is already 47 years old. She is married and her husband is one of the councilors in their village. They have four children: Jovito – 24 years old, already a college graduate and working as a mechanic in Manila; Joel – 21 years old, a college graduate and working as a cell phone technician; Junel – 18 years old, and Jeffrey - 15 years old are both studying. Lilia hopes that someday, all her children will have a good future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 50 years old and married with seven children. She sells clothes and shoes. This business is her source of income. She hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is  45 years old and she is married to Marcelo, a local farmer in their village at Bantay Solana, Cagayan. The couple is blessed with two children: Ronel, 25 years old and his twin sister Mildred.  Milded her daughter is able to graduate from college and now teaching in a public school in their place. 

Zenaida is managing a general store business. Her store is doing well and is full of different merchandise. Though her store is small, Zenaida is hoping that someday, she will able to expand the business in order to gain higher income. Doing this encourages her to request for additional business capital from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP6, 000. According to her, she will use the loan to purchase additional items such as two sacks of rice to retail and other grocery items that are very in demand in their village.  She dreams to improve her business and to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Damaso Nelvin

texts.es: El señor Dámaso de 40 años, se desempeña de albañil en los diferentes proyectos de vivienda de la capital, gana bien pero es un trabajo bien forzado de fuerza y a veces pasa todo el día en el sol. Reside en Laureles Sur, su esposa procreo tres hijos todos estudian su primaria. Poco a poco ha ido haciendo su casa, con la ventaja de que el mismo la construye, con el financiamiento en Afodenic lograra comprar verjas, arena cemento ya que desea embaldosar y poner las ventanas más seguras y poder dar a su familia una casa digna como todo ser humano sueña. Sus dificultades es que a veces no hay contratos y me llevo algunas semanas para encontrar trabajo en la construcción. Solo con pocos rumbos en el cual gana solo para la alimentación. Da las agracias a la institución por la oportunidad de promover en cada familia mejorar nuestras vivienda con financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Dámaso is 40 years old and works on different homebuilding projects in Managua. He makes a decent living, but his work takes tremendous effort and requires that he spend the entire day in the sun. He and his wife live in Laureles Sur. They have three children who attend elementary school.

Over time, Dámaso has been building a home for his family in the same manner he constructs other houses. Using a loan from AFODENIC, he will buy railing, sand, and cement. He wants to lay down tile and install windows in order to provide his family with a decent and secure home any human being would want. Dámaso encounters difficulties at times because he is not able to secure contracts and it can take a few weeks to find construction jobs. He only needs a few jobs in order to earn enough income to feed his family. He thanks the Institution for encouraging families to improve their housing situation and providing them with financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase railing, tiles, and cement

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita es una mujer  perseverante y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, es madre de cinco hijos, uno de ellos mayor de edad. Melita se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, ella vende en su casa, cuenta  con el apoyo de su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” desde hace ocho meses. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que lo utilizó para comprar gaseosas, yogures y néctares, en la actualidad Melita necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar ropa de segundo uso. La meta de Melita es tener una tienda de artículos de abarrotes y pasamanería.
texts.en:
Melita is a persistent and hardworking woman. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha, which is in the region of Ucayali. Melita is 37 years old and the mother of 5 children, of whom 1 is already an adult. She sells secondhand clothing out of her home and has the support of her husband.

Melita joined the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love) eight months ago. Her first loan of 500 soles was used to buy soft drinks, yogurts, and nectars. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more secondhand clothing. Melita’s goal is to open her own clothing store and sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en:
Isoken sells groceries at the front of her house in Benin City, Edo State and has been in this business for seven years. She is determined to lift her business above poverty and hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Isoken hopes for a loan of N30,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is 45 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is widowed. She has a retail business selling men's clothing at the Yulana market in Pavlograd town. She has been in this business for only two years. Valentina has plans to develop her business and sell shoes along with clothing. She offers great client service and attracts clients by her prices and the good location of her kiosk. Valentina would like to borrow 3,300 Ukrainian grivna to purchase men's sweaters.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 04 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, iniciándose con un capital de S/. 500.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas y patos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Maribel, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to the “La Mujer Riojana” Communal Bank, of Rioja, province of Rioja, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, and she is 32 years old and is a mother of 4 children who still depend on her.

The necessity to give her children a good start in life and thanks to her spirit and enterprising energy, Maribel started her own business selling live chickens with a capital of S/. 500.00. She began selling chickens and little by little she became well-known amongst her customers. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, she will buy more farmyard animals like chickens and ducks. Part of the money will also be used to buy a well-balanced feed and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free of any disease.

Maribel feels very pleased with the job that she does and believes that it is worth the sacrifice to see her dreams and goals come true. She is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) for helping her start her business and to many women who want to grow in businesses as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Glory Group

texts.en:
Faustina is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of six children who are currently being educated in senior, junior and primary schools. She lives with her family in their own house in a farming community. Faustina runs a grocery store and also sells cereals. She makes income mainly from these businesses to support her family. 

She is the leader of a village trust bank group called Glory. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travel. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their children's school fees. Your support would enable them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Edgar Rosendo

texts.es:
El señor Edgar es un cliente antiguo y puntual, y responsable es de buena actitud, tambien se vio que es una persona emprendedora al ser muy joven, el señor edgar se dedica al servicio de juegos en red e internet que esta ubicado en la calle imperial donde tambien es su domicilio.

Su negocio es mediano tiene aproximadamente 10 computadoras en los que da los servicios de internet y juegos en red,  El Sr. Edgar atiende su negocio todos los dias desde muy temprano hasta muy altas horas de la noche, el señor edgar tambien conoce mucho de electronica por lo tanto la reparacion de sus computadoras lo realiza el mismo, el actualmente es soltero, pero todo lo que gana lo invierte en su negocio de internet, su madre es cliente de la institucion varios años y demostro responsabilidad y puntualidad, la inversion que realizara con el prestamo es poner azulejos en su otra tienda para alquilarla.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Edgar is an old client of Emprender. He is punctual, responsible, and has a good attitude. He is also very enterprising for his young age. Edgar has a business of Internet service and web games, located on Imperial Street, which is also where he lives. It is a medium-sized business with about ten computers, which provide Internet service and web games. Edgar is at the business everyday from very early to the late hours of the night. He also knows electronics and is able to do repairs on the computers himself. Edgar is single, and all his earnings are reinvested in his business. His mother has also been an Emprender client for years and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality. This loan will be used to install tiles in his other store to rent it. Edgar is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown by the approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New tiles for his store

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun D. cares for three school-aged children. To earn money, Hun D. sews clothes in the garment industry. Another source of family income is her husband’s construction business. In addition, the family cultivates a rice crop as their annual business. The rice drying season is approaching, but Hun D. lacks some farm supplies, so she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, a pump, and rice seed to support her field. 

(Mrs. Hun D.’s husband appears in the photograph.)

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a pump, and rice seed

loans.name: Delia Tereza

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Delia es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Delia vende raspadillas (refresco preparado con hielo y jugo de frutas) actividad que realiza ambulatoriamente en un triciclo en un parque. Además Delia vende Salchipapas por las tardes y noches.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de otra maquina de raspadilla.
Los sueños de Delia son que sus hijos salgan adelante y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Guadalupe communal bank. She is 34, years old, married, with five children. Delia sells “raspadas” (shaved ice flavored with fruit juices) in the park, from a three-wheeled push cart. She also sells “Salchipapas” (sausage and potatoes) in the evenings. Delia needs a loan for 2,000 PEN ($725) to buy a new ice shaving machine. Delia’s dreams are for her children to come out ahead in life and for her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new ice shaving machine

loans.name: Chevalier Group

texts.en: The Chevalier de Romeo group is excited about receiving their firS. loan from Esperanza. The group has a variety of businesses from selling used clothing and sandals to food and meats in local markets. Leonel B. is the representative of the group. He is a 31-year-old husband and father of two children. Leonel has a thriving gas business, a sort of mini station. He sells both at home and by the side of the road to passing motorists.  His intereS. in joining Esperanza came from the low intereS. rate of the loans and because the organization shares his same Christian values. He hopes to grow his business and be a blessing to the people in the area. On behalf of Leonel, Chevalier, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel fuel

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah R. is from the village of Del Pilar, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Leah operates a food vending business. She has been involved in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Leah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah is requesting her second loan, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her snack vending business

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley K. is 35 years old and married to Elizabeth Muthoni, who is 25 years old.  They have one child, Adrian K. Kimemu (age four who attends baby Class).

Stanley is a hawker dealing will electronics, cosmetics, utensils, hair-bands and combs.  He's been in this business for the last six years and earns an  average profit of Kshs 10,000. His business is located in Kabarnet town and most of his customers are Kabarnet residence.

Stanley was introduced to Kadet by a friend who wanted to join Kadet at that time, so they both joined.  He wants to borrow Kshs 20,000 to purchase more stock for his business. If this loan boosts his business Stanley intends to rent a house for his business and purchase more stock. 

Stanley would like to specialize in utensils and cosmetics wholesaling.  He also wants to educate his child to the highest level possible and have a fulfilling life.  Stanley describes himself as determined and hardworking.

loans.use: Purchase items to resell.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon L. is from the town of Maamot, San Jose, Tarlac. He is 29 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns and operates a furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Marlon joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Panamericana, se reúnen la Asociación Comunal ESTRELLAS DE BELEN. Se agruparon hace 4 años aproximadamente, por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.

Una de las integrantes es Simona L. de 47 años desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a vender pan, negocio que le ha permitido cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia, ahora necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen varias actividades económicas como la venta de ropa, jugos, servicio de transporte, venta de habas, comida cartones y tienda de barrio. 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Association "Estrellas de Belen" (Stars of Bethlehem) meets at the Panamericana central office. The members formed this group approximately 4 years ago because they needed capital to improve their businesses. Simona L., 47 years old, is one of the members. For more than 10 years, she has sold bread. Her business has allowed her to cover the costs of her and her family's basic necessities. Now, she needs a loan to acquire merchandise. The other members of the group are involved in various economic activities such as selling clothes, juices, broad beans, food, and cardboard; offering transportation services, and operating a neighborhood shop. All of the members need the loan in order to invest and strengthen their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sylviane

texts.fr:
Né vers le 27/08/1981 à San,  Sylviane K. n’as pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, elle s’intéressa donc très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus. Elle est mariée et mère  d’un enfant. Elle vit chez époux dans le quartier Dabani de la préfecture de San.  
Sylviane fait la vente de cartes de recharge téléphoniques, de téléphones portables et accessoires il y a plus de 3 ans.
Sylviane est très sollicitée et pour satisfaire sa clientèle, elle décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Sylviane K. compte acheter, 50.000FCFA de cartes de crédits de 1000 FCFA, 75.000 de cartes de crédits de 2000FCFA, 100.000FCFA pour acheter des  téléphones portables et 25.000FCFA pour les accessoires (chargeurs, pochettes etc.)  
Elle revend à San ville et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. 
Sylviane espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités de revenus.
Il ambitionne agrandir  sa boutique et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour qu’elle puisse améliorer davantage sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born on August 27, 1981 in San, Sylviane K. was not lucK. enough to shine in school, so she became interested early on in earning money. She is married and the mother of one child. She lives in her husband's home in the Dabani district of the prefecture of San. Sylviane has been selling telephone charge cards, mobile phones, and accessories for more than three years. She is much sought after and in order to satisfy her clientele, she decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan. Sylviane K. intends to buy 50,000 F CFA worth of charge cards of 1000 F CFA each, invest 75,000 F CFA in charge cards worth 2000 F CFA each, put 100,000 F CFA into buying mobile phones, and 25,000 F CFA into buying accessories (chargers, cases, etc.) She sells her goods in the town of San and at the weekly markets to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to repay the loan, pay school fees for her child, buy food, and reinvest any remainder in other businesses. She intends to expand her shop and thus increase her sales so that she can further improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying phone credit cards, mobile telephones, and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase basic grains, dairy products, meat, chicken, and candy

loans.name: Leos Nduati

texts.en:
Leos is 26 years old, married to Virginia Wambui, and they have one child. He has been in the motorcycle transport industry for four years.  He is also contracted to supply cakes for a local baker in town.  After doing the cake delivery service for two years, he also believes he can bake his own cakes and start supplying them in town.  That is why he is asking KADET to help him buy an oven with this loan.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan.  He used his first loan of 81,000 KES to buy a new motorbike which he's been using in his transportation business.  He paid the loan well and on time.

Leos hopes to grow the bakery business in the future and become a leading supplier of bread and cakes in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy an oven and start baking bread and cakes for sale as a secondary business.

loans.name: Mrs. Roeun Ya Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun Y., who was born in 1978, is the village bank president selected by the eighteen members located in Khsom village in Kandal province. The members will each use their portion of the loan for a different purpose to improve their living.

Mrs. Roeun Y. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family and she is a fish-seller who sells some fish that her husband, Mr. Lab Lun, a fisherman, catches.

This couple has a big problem because their fishing supplies are too little to use. So, to solve this large problem, Mrs. Roeun Y. is asking for a loan to buy more fishing supplies.

Mrs. Roeun Y. is the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school while the others are too small to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more fishing supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie A.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling household products like casseroles, clocks and many more in her community. She is 35 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Rosalie has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 18 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, específicamente en la localidad de Santa Rosa. A Nora siempre le ha gustado ayudar a tíos desde su adolescencia en un restaurante que ellos poseen, y a cambio del trabajo recibe una remuneración considerable. Ella anhela en un corto plazo estudiar la carrera de agronomía, de esa manera pueda contribuir con su familia y la sociedad, desde luego que primero va prepararse. Es por ello que trata de esforzarse en su trabajo, por el cual se siente cómoda, ya que le dá la oportunidad de socializarse con varias personas. Su plan a futuro es ser una gran profesional en agronomía, con la finalidad de que pueda sostenerse de forma independiente. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP,  por el cual se asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente en confianza con su grupo comunal, ya que toman decisiones eficaces. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en lo estudios, para ello se preparará en una academia, especialmente para la carrera que va postular.
texts.en:
Nora is 18 years old, she is single and she does not have any children. She lives with her parents in a house located in the beautiful region of the Ayacucha forest, specifically, in the Santa Rosa village. Since she was a teenager Nora has always enjoyed helping her uncles run their restaurant, and for her work she is receives good wages. In the near future she aspires to study agriculture so that she may be able to help support her family and contribute to society. She works hard at her job, a job that grants her financial stability and an opportunity to meet different people. Her plan for the future is to become an expert agriculturer with the goal of one day becoming independent. This will be her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the obligations of this loan. She enjoys her group in the community bank, especially because they always make sound decisions. The loan that she requests will be invested in her studies. She wishes to begin her academic studies towards the career of which she dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition expenses to study a career in agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a tailoring table. fabric and other materials

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells fish at Elmina. Aba has not received any form of education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a petty trader. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy P. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old and married. She has 4 children aged 13, 14, 17 and 19. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Juvy got involved in farming when she was in her 20s.

Juvy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and financially support her immediate and extended families.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Angel  Neftali

texts.es: El Sr. F. labora como empleado en una empresa desde hace mas de un año, su esposa tambien es empleada de otra institucion. Son un matrimonio joven con 2 hijos a los que le quieren dar un mejor nivel de vida, el Sr. tiene 15 años viviendo en el domicilio que le dejaron sus padres, como ya es una casa algo deteriorada le quiere dar un mejor aspecto y a base de esfuerzos ofrecerle un hogar comodo y agradable a sus hijos ya que todo lo hacen pensando en ellos. Es por eso que requieren de este prestamo para pintar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernández has been employed at a firm for over a year.  His wife is also employed at another institution.  They are a young couple with two children who want to provide a better standard of living.

He has been living in a home his parents passed on to him for 15 years.  Because it’s pretty deteriorated he wants to improve its appearance and through his efforts provide a comfortable, pleasant home for his children.  Everything he and his wife do is with their children in mind.  

They need this loan in order to paint their house.

loans.use: To paint his house.

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Development Group-Kayunga

texts.en: With diligence and painstaking plans, all bets are off regarding the success of any business. Success will only be in one’s grasp if the above is adhered to. For 68 year old Livingstone K.  whose affiliation is with Basooka Kwavula Development Association-Kayunga, this resonates deeply He has been building on his success at the helm of his farming business in Kisaaba for 20 years. Through these years he has come to grips with the fact that there is always a silver lining, even in the most difficult of situations, whilst operating a business.  He has managed to strike a balance through the chequered experiences of business. Livingstone plants cash crops that he sells after harvesting. In a month his business generates him  260,000 shillings. With this loan he wants to buy more seeds of other crops like pumpkins, cabbage, coffee, etc that he plans on plant and later, after harvesting, to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of pumpkin, cabbage and coffee seeds for his plantation.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is 30 years old, married and with two children, ages four and one and a half years.  For two years he has been selling household items for a living.  On the side, he is also an herbalist.  Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to him because he has developed a saving culture.  This has helped him in managing his finances.  In five years, he wants to transform his business into a wholesale business.  Samwel has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sufurias (cooking pot), Vikombe (cups) and thermos flasks.

loans.use: To buy sufurias (cooking pot), cups and thermos flasks.

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karina; tiene 25 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de adornos navideños, la socia venderá adornos en una feria que se realiza todas las navidades y también ella estudia biología en la universidad y por medio de este pequeño negocio que realizara pagara las mensualidades de la universidad, ella quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de adornos para navidad. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de adornos de navidad.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the “Los Diamantes” (Diamonds) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Karina is 25 years old and she is single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Christmas decorations.  She will sell decorations in a market which takes place every Christmas period.  She is also studying biology at university and will use this small business to make her monthly payments to the university.  She would like to improve her business selling Christmas decorations.  She is requesting this loan to buy Christmas decorations.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy Christmas decorations

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 63-year-old lady, married to Martin, 63, who is a farmer.  They are blessed with four children who are grown ups

Alice has been in this business for a year, whereby she earns Kshs. 6,000 in profit monthly.  The extra cash she gets from her husband's farming  is used to supplement what she gets from the business, thus helping her business to grow.

She  was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This is her first loan, which she is planning to use to purchase stocks of new clothes worth Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 30 years old. Virgie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años de edad, es divorciada y reside junto a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como mango, maracuyá y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella ofrece su mercadería en base a pedidos y también cuenta con un stock permanente en su domicilio. Usualmente ofrece su mercadería a los vecinos de la zona, aunque también suele recorrer los caserío aledaños en busca de más clientes. Esta actividad es la única que le permite hacerse cargo del mantenimiento de sus menores hijos, por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería con prendas de vestir de temporada de verano, con esa inversión ella pretende aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda sacar adelante a sus menores hijos. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old.  She is divorced and lives with her three children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  This is an area with a semi-tropical climate that mainly produces fruit such as mangos, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Rosa sells clothes to the general public.  She takes orders for her merchandise and also has a fixed stock in her home.  She usually offers her merchandise to her neighbors, though she also travels to neighboring villages in search of more customers.  This is the only business activity Rosa carries out to support her dependent children so she always does her best to maintain her business as well as possible.

Rosa would like to expand her business, buying more merchandise: clothes for the summer season.  She is making this investment to increase her sales and make more profits which she can use to get her children ahead in life.  In order to achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise: summer clothes

loans.name: Zorig

texts.en:
Zorig is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. His three children attend a local secondary school. His wife and Zorig operate a grocery shop within their own fence. His wife is responsible for managing their grocery shop while he runs a carpentry business out of his home where he produces a variety of wooden items according to his customers' orders to supplement his earnings. 

Zorig started his own business in 2004 by operating a coal and firewood trading business with working capital of 200,000 MNT. After years of successful operation, he was able to build his own grocery stop which opened in 2009. Today, his working capital exceeds 1,200,000 MNT. For the future, he hopes to have his own mini-supermarket. 

Zorig is a hard-working and modest person and says, "I plan to expand my grocery shop." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more grocery products to sell at his grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Jane Achieng

texts.en:
Jane Achieng M. is 34 years old, married and a mother of two school aged children. Jane is a business grocery woman and she does the business in the town, which she has been doing for the last eleven years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan which she is plans to spend to buy more stock of food stuffs. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her business.

Jane dream is do educate her kids to higher level and expand her business. She is a persevering woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food stuff

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Isabel nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comida, ella tiene un restaurante donde expende desayuno, almuerzo y cena, ella abre el restaurante desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de  noche de lunes a domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cerveza, gaseosas y otras cosas que se necesitan para preparar comida. 

Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isabel is 49 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Isabel tells us that her business is selling meals.  She has a restaurant where she serves breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She opens her restaurant at 7.00am and closes at 9.00pm, Monday to Sunday.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Isabel requires a loan to buy more beer, soda and other products that she needs to prepare her meals.

Isabel is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered with this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda and other products that she needs to prepare her meals

loans.name: Mrs. Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who have selected Mrs. Keo to become the village bank president. Each will use their portion of the loan to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Keo was born in 1946 and is married to Mr. KhU.; both of them are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow both rice and vegetables to sell to support their family. They have three children, two of whom are employed in private companies, and the other is a student. 

Now Mrs. Keo has a problem because her child needs some money to pay school fees. Mrs. Keo is applying for a loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom K. has been spending her life cultivating crops on her own farmland in Kompong Cham province. She had learned this skill from her grandparent when she was single. She is now married and has two school-aged kids. 

She has the another financial earner in her husband who is currently a recycling seller. He always goes to buy used goods from the people who live in his village and other villages. The used goods he buys mostly come from cans, plastics and electronic wires, which he then sells to his wholesalers for a profit. 

Her husband always picks up the items by using his old motorbike. Unfortunately, the existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Yom K. has decided to seek a loan of $400 from Kiva, which she will use to change the broken motorcycle for her husband. 

Note that Yom K. and her husband appear in the picture.

loans.use: To change her husband's broken motorcycle

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Magret B., who is in her  mid-twenties, is married with three children (two are twins).  She has been running a small cafe business for four years. She works from 6:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Magret's twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to sell fruits and vegetables and also bought a plot of land.  She has repaid her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase her cafe's items (food and drinks).  Her dream is to one day have a big restaurant and also send her children to good schools.

Magret will share this loan with her loan group "Jitahidi Msakuzi", which has a total of 16 members.  The members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Magret is behind, last row 3rd from right.

loans.use: To increase her small cafe items.

loans.name: Bateesa Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en: N. Resty is a 41-year-old, mobile clothes sales business-woman who operates mostly in Mpigi Town. She has been selling clothes for the past decade. With the earnings from her business she has, in certain respects, been able to shoulder most of her family's responsibilities. Previously she was operating a restaurant. She says she is able to make a weekly profit to the tune of shillings 100,000. With this loan, Resty says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to resell.

loans.use: The purchase more bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 38 years old and married. She is a farmer who tills land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Yolanda started her farming business three years ago. She and her husband help to keep the farm productive. Her husband also works as a carpenter.

Yolanda’s loan will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Yolanda hopes to have their own furniture shop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and married with 3 children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marites has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 8 years and also earns income from buying and selling rice.

Marites aspires to save enough money to buy agricultural land for rice.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Corsina

texts.en:
Corsina is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Talibon, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Corsina is in the business of raising hogs. She and her husband built a small backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. Corsina sells the pigs at the market. She also helps her husband sell his catch to the people in her community.

Corsina plans to use her loan to buy pig feeds and fishing gears. She hopes for her family’s living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and fishing gears.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil has been running a farming business for 6 years. He is a hardworking man and has two children. He has 20 hundredths of land where he cultivates potatoes, carrots and onions. He sells his crops in the “Shurnavo” market and makes a good profit. Ismoil is also engaged in animal husbandry. He would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to increase his working capital and expand his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: Eleveur de volailles (poules, dindes) depuis 2010,  Anani est papa de 04 enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse. Ce premier prêt qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des poussins  au GHANA (pays voisin) afin d’accroitre son activité d’éleveur  Une personne l’aide dans l’activité.
texts.en: Anani has four children and has raised hens and turkeys since 2010. His wife has a small business. This is his first loan which will allow him to purchase hens in Ghana (a neighboring country) in order to grow his business. He has someone who helps him with the business.

loans.use: to purchase hens

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa. 44, is married and has two children.

She has been selling clothes for 20 years. She started her own business in 2002 and sells clothes from her house to help her husband cover their expenses and increase their income, and to make a better living for her children.

Hanaa works hard to satisfy her customers. She insists on purchasing whatever they need and desire to keep them loyal and happy.

Hanaa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua and it will be her seventh loan as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good history. With the loan, she will  introduce cosmetics and perfumes and start selling them in addition to clothes.

Hanaa hopes to keep improving her business more and more in the future and to provide her children with the best healthy and secure living.

loans.use: To add cosmetics and perfume to her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Mahutin Cocotomey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY est composé de cinq membres qui fréquentent la même Église. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Françoise est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Françoise est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Françoise est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Françoise a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Françoise mène comme activité depuis huit ans environs, la vente du maïs, de la farine de blé et du sucre. Françoise s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Françoise et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY is composed of five members who attend the same church. The group representative is named Françoise and she is raising her hand in the photo.  In order to grow the level of their activity and better respond to the demand of their clientele, this group is requesting their first loan from  ALIDé. 

Françoise, 44, lives in Bénin. She is married to Germain. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and all under their roof. Françoise lives with her husband and children. She attended school only for a short while. To support herself and her children, Françoise has been selling maize, wheat flour and sugar for about eight years. She buys her supplies at one of the biggest markets in Bénin. 

In order to expand their businesses and better satisfy their clientele, Françoise and the other members of the MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY group are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to grow the level of their business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 43, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a street vendor, and a mother to her four children. The oldest is in college while the youngest is staying at home. Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Nida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nida earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nida hopes to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos Eduardo tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive con el hijo de trece años de edad  en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVOS UNIDOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

Carlos Eduardo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café, etc. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
 
Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño de aquí a cinco años es poderse comprar una casa para poderle dejar a su hijo.

Le gusta escuchar música, salir y compartir momentos amenos junto a su hijo y  amigos.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo is 33 years old, single and living with his 13-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nuevos Unidos” (New United Ones) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, banana, oranges and coffee.

Carlos Eduardo farms corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas, coffee, etc.  He makes his purchases and sells his products at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

He requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizer and manure for his crops.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  The challenges he faces are drops in prices of the products he sells as well as dealing with middlemen.  His five-year plan is to be able to buy a house to leave to his son.

He enjoys listening to music, going out and sharing pleasant moments with his son and friends.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Genny Amparo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Genny, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos, tres de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y los tres menores que estudian en colegio y escuela, cuatro de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante y agricultor.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedican a  la venta de frutas y legumbres, para lo cual se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta donde vende sus productos por las calles en un triciclo, él vende productos que el mismo cultiva y también compra en el mercado de Manta los productos que le hacen falta, trabaja los días martes, jueves y sábados ya que los otros días se dedica a la agricultura. Lleva realizando esto por más de 15 años y esta es la fuente del sustento de la familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The  members of the "María Auxiliadora" communal bank meet in Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province. It is full of hard-working, committed people, who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish where the residents are decent people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families. 

This is where we met Genny, who is 45, married, with 6 children. Three of her children are adults, and the three youngest go to school; 4 of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant and farmer.  She is undertaking the loan for her husband's business.  He sells fruits and vegetables. For this, he travels to the city of Manta, where he sells his products in the street from a tricycle.

He sells products that he himself grows, and also buys products he needs in the Manta market. He works Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, since on the other days he farms. He's been doing this for more than 15 years, and this is the main source of livelihood for the family. This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables.  

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and likes the easier terms for getting loans. Her dream is to have a well-constructed house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Joseline Jeannette

texts.es:
La joven Joseline tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá y sus hermanas.

La clienta se dedica a cuidar niños desde hace 10 años con su mamá, quien le ha enseñado el oficio y le ayuda desarrollar esta actividad.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para ampliar su casa ya que quiere construir una habitación mas. Actualemnte, Joseline y su familia viven en una casa de una sola habitación la cual fue construida por su padre hace ya muchos años. Hace mucho tiempo que Joseline y su mamá han querido hacer mejoras a la casa, pero han invertido lo que ganan el la educación de una de las hermanas de Joseline. 

Con el préstamo, Joseline espera pagar por el techo, paredes repelladas, y piso de cemento para la nueva habitación. Al mejorar su casa Joseline y su familia estará más cómoda, ya que en la actualidad una sola habitación la comparten 4 personas.

En un futuro Joseline espera poder seguir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Joseline, 20, is a single young lady living with her mother and sisters.  She has been working caring for children with her mother for the last ten years.  Her mother has taught her this occupation and helps her carry out this activity.

She is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to enlarge her house because she wants to add another room.  Currently, Joseline and her family live in a one room house that was built by her father many years ago.  Joseline and her mother have wanted to do these home improvements for a long time now but have invested their earnings in the education of one of Joseline’s sisters.

With the loan, Joseline hopes to pay for the roof, plastered walls and cement floor of the new room.  By improving her house, Joseline and her family will be more comfortable because currently the one room is shared by four people.  In the future, Joseline hopes to continue to improve her house little by little.

loans.use: to add a room to the house.

loans.name: Laura Alejandrina

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

Doña Laura tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 13, 10 y 2 años de edad, 2 estudian en el colegio y 1 en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo  labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Laura se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, ella tiene cuyes, pollos y en especial ganado, ella arrienda potreros para alimentar su ganado. Trabaja en esta labor ya que le da el tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es comprar potreros para criar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank "La Esquina."  She lives in the Sinincay parish.  Here one can find beautiful places to observe nature, a great variety of traditional dishes, and people who maintain their culture and traditions.  The people here are known for their kindness and friendliness.

Laura is 34 years old and married.  Her marriage has produced 4 children who are now aged 14, 13, 10 and 2.  Two of the children are in school, and one is in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They own the home that they live in.

Laura has a business raising and selling animals.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and especially cattle.  She rents pasture lands to feed her livestock.  She does this type of work because it gives her time to care for her children.

She has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of feed for her animals.

Her goal is to buy pasture land so that she can raise more livestock.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.en: Mahmadi is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables. This means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his six children. Mahmadi has been characterized as a person who is hard working, since he has been working in agriculture for seven years. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and, above all, strength; it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Mahmadi is determined to raise the level of living in his family and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо замужем имеет детей невесток и внуков. Муж работает таксистом. Она предприниматель разного профиля. Занимается откормом скота, выращиванием помидоров, продажей неочищенного риса. Семья у них большая и содержать семью в достатке удается не всем. Мархабо хочет получить займ  для строительства дома и улучшения благосостояния семьи. Она надеется на одобрение займа.
texts.en: Marhabo is married and has children, daughters-in-law and grandchildren.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Marhabo is a multidisciplinary entrepreneur.  She is involved in fattening up livestock, growing tomatoes and selling unprocessed rice.  She has a large family, and it is not always possible to provide abundance for them.  Marhabo wants to obtain a loan to build a house and improve her family's well-being.  She hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y 3 hijos de 14 años, 12 años y un bebe de 4 meses.

El señor José, se dedica a prestar sus servicios de motorista  y al comercio de ropa de vestir, lociones y cosméticos en junto con su compañera de vida, quines tienen  más de 6 años de dedicarse ha esta actividad, la cual la aprendió de un familiar que se dedicaba al comercio de ropa. 

Actualmente cuentan con  4 docenas de prendas de vestir como: blusa para damas, camisas para caballero y ropa de bebe. El señor José siempre se ha dedicado a prestar sus servios como motorista, hoy en día en apoyo de su compañera de vida a la venta de ropa.

La mercadería la compra en un departamento de la zona oriental del país, que se encuentra ha 26 kilómetros de la ciudad de donde el vive, en esta cuidad se pueden comprar la ropa ha precio cómodos para su comercialización y también donde él vive en el día del comercio que son los domingos, cuando llegan comerciantes de otras zonas ha vender ropa. 

José invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ropa, para su comercialización: como lo son, 5 docenas de blusas para damas, 5 docenas de faldas,  5 docenas de camisas para caballeros, 5 docenas de pantalones y  para bebe: pañales, mantillas cuturinas calcetines, gorros, entre otros más.

Al comprar toda esta ropa contara con mercadería de moda y abastecerá la demanda que tiene en este momento, ya que llegan clientes a su vivienda donde comercializa y les dice que no tiene hasta la próxima semana. Realizando la inversión él podrá satisfacer la demanda existente y de esta manera venderá más y por ende sus niveles de ingresos o ganancias incrementaran. Con estos ingresos tiene planeado adquirir vitrinas donde pueda mostrar sus prendas de vestir, adquiriendo mobiliario para establecer un mini bazar, mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 33, lives with his partner and three children aged 14, 12, and 4 months. He works providing his services as a driver and selling clothing, lotions, and cosmetics together with his partner. They have more than six years of experience in this line of work and learned it from a family member who worked in the clothing industry.They currently have 4 dozen garments including women's blouses, men's shirts, and baby clothing. José has always worked as a driver but today he supports his partner in selling clothing.

José will use the loan to buy clothing for his business including: 5 dozen women's blouses, 5 dozen skirts, 5 dozen men's shirts, 5 dozen pairs of pants, and diapers, socks, caps, etc. for babies. He purchases the merchandise from an area in the eastern zone of the country, 26 miles outside of the city where he lives. In this city one can buy clothing at an affordable price. Also where he lives Sundays are the days for other storekeepers to come from other places to sell clothing.

By buying this clothing, he will be able to have fashionable merchandise and meet the demand that he has at this time, as he currently has clients coming to his home and he has to tell them they have to wait until next week. With this loan he will be able to meet existing demand and thus sell more and increase his income and earning levels. With this income he is planning to purchase windows that can display his clothing, buying furniture to establish a mini bazaar, and improving the roof to his home.

loans.use: to buy women's blouses, skirts, men's shirts, pants, diapers, and socks and caps for babies

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 26 years old, married to Penina and they have one child.  

Peter was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his farming business and get more income, thereby improving his family's living.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Monzer

texts.en:
Monzer is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children, one of whom is working. Despite his older age, he is still courageous and brave, searching for a better life for his family.

He has owned a mini market in his town for the past 28 years. He has a good reputation and a fair number of loyal clients.

Today, he is asking for a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional inventory to add to his existing one. He notes that this Kiva loan will help him increase his business sales thus his income. 

In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to add to his existing one.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with 2 children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling feed in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Aida has previously borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF. She has been running the business for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Aida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  sra. Maria tiene 50 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de naranjas, su negocio lo  tiene ubicado  en el caserio Somotillo,. todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para comprar sus naranjas al por mayor y luego salir a venderlas, la  sra Maria cuenta  con  el apoyo  de  sus  hijos para la venta de las naranjas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de naranjas al por mayor, sus ventas han aumentado y en ocasiones se queda sin producto. 
Maria en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia y tambien se dedica a criar gallinas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 50 years old and sells oranges. Her business is located in the village of Somotillo. Every day she wakes up early so that she can buy oranges in bulk and sell them later. Sra. Maria has the help of her children with selling oranges.

This loan will be used to buy oranges in bulk. Her sales have increased and sometimes she runs out of product. In her free time, Maria goes to church and also raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Karamatkan

texts.en:
The first Kiva loan helped Karamatkan to purchase cattle. Today she has a farm with six cows, six heifers, two bull-calves, and one horse, which allows her to earn about 5,000 KGS in a month. 

Now, Karamatkan plans to broaden her business activities by land-cultivating. For this reason she is applying for her second Kiva loan of 60,000 KGS to  purchase seeds of tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Maria Limbany

texts.es: La señora Maria Limbany desde la muerte de su hermano se ha convertido en el apoyo económico para su madre. Además de sus 5 hijos, Maria Limbany ha tenido que luchar fuertemente para sacar toda su familia adelante, pues hace aproximadamente 9 meses murió su hermano, quién con su fábrica de arepas era el sostenimiento para su familia. Es por esto que junto con su madre, Maria Limbany quiere reabrir la fábrica de arepas que tenía su hermano que funcionaba desde su casa, pero para ello, requiere de la compra de algunos equipos necesarios para la producción de las arepas. Maria Limbany y su madre, sueñan con tener un gran negocio con bastante clientela, y que sean reconocidos por la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en: Since her brother's death, Maria Limbany has become her mother's source of financial support. Maria Limbany has five children and she has had to work hard to provide for her whole family because, approximately 9 months ago, her brother died. He had an 'arepa' factory and provided for the family. Together with her mother, Maria Limbany would like to re-open the arepa factory that her brother had at home. However, in order to do this, she needs to buy some necessary equipment for making arepas. Maria Limbany and her mother dream of having a large business with a lot of customers. They would like to be well known for the quality of their products.

loans.use: to buy production equipment

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 42 Group

texts.fr:
L e  groupe de crédit  Djiguène  Bakhna 42 regroupe cinq femmes qui font de la vente de fruits et légumes.
La  présidente madame Ngoné  exerce le commerce depuis 10 ans et son activité consiste à vendre des fruits et des légumes dans le marché local. Ngoné  arrive à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Dans l’avenir elle voudra avoir son propre magasin et être autonome.
texts.en: The group Djiguène Bakhna 42 is made up of five women who sell fruit and vegetables. The head of the group, Ngoné, has been in business for 10 years and she sells fruit and vegetables at the local market. She manages to provide for her family's needs. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and be independent.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Anthony.  He is married and has 1 child. She is 12 years old and goes to school. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him because they are going to school and they help him with domestic affairs.  

In 2002, Anthony established his cosmetics, provisions and drinks business. He got his High School Diploma and was looking forward to going to college, but due to a lack of financial support, he had to set up a petty trade through the help of a distant relative. His business was growing gradually when a friend advised him to learn a trade out of the little he saved. He paid his fees towards a technical vocation. With the help of his younger brother, he was able to handle the business and also learn a trade. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,157,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.
